<h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b>The Role<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2> \n <div>\n  <p><b>What’s the role?<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p> Your accountabilities as Process Technician include the following:<\u002Fp>\n  <ul>\n   <li><p> Operating process units of Ethylene Cracker Complex (including Utility) within the Production Area to achieve Shift Plan in accordance to Daily Operating Instructions, Standing Instructions and Site Health, Safety, Security, Environment procedures.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Operating the plant optimally within alarm, Design-Operating-Window and the Integrity-Operating-Window.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Perform structured rounds (DCS Panel\u002FField) for field data logging and proactive monitoring. Take corrective action to maintain equipment and plant operations within optimal operating windows. Raise notifications for defects\u002Fmaintenance issues with preliminary assessment of work order prioritization.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Update operating procedures, prepare job pack documentation and execute them for equipment maintenance<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Carry out operational activities like sampling, equipment decontamination and isolation for maintenance, equipment commissioning, critical activities go and see etc.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Participate in shutdown and start-up of units with thoughtful compliance to procedures.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Participating in minor maintenance activities and maintain good housekeeping.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Keeping log records of operational activities for optimal and thorough handover to other shifts.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Support team shift plan delivery and competency development proactively.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Share observations of good practices, unsafe acts\u002Fconditions, near misses and incidents. Support shift 5 why to understand the root cause of PQ\u002FDOW\u002Fupset incident occur within the shift to capture and facilitate learning across shift.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Perform the role of Auxiliary Fire Fighter if assigned in the event of emergency situations<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Apply emerging technologies to perform process operational tasks<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Carry out\u002FPerform other related duties when required<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> This role will be based in Pulau Bukom, on a rotating 12-hour shift.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> What we need from you?<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <ul>\n   <li><p> Strong commitment to HSE and Operational Discipline (Knowledge, Commitment, Attention to Details, Situational Awareness).<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Strong problem-solving skills, good technical and process aptitude, and ability to remain calm and composed during abnormal situations to make informed and risk-balanced decision.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Demonstrate proactiveness, learner mindset, approachable and inclusive behaviour.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Demonstrated strong team player behaviour with good communication skills (both written and verbal).<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Digital skills and aptitude are beneficial.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Flexible to perform both shift work and day-work, and overtime when the need arises.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> More about Shell in Singapore<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p> Shell is one the largest foreign investors in Singapore and began operations in 1891. Today, we have more than 3,200 employees in Singapore alone. The Pulau Bukom Manufacturing Site today is the largest Shell refinery in the world in terms of crude distillation capacity, which makes Singapore a key regional supply and trading centre for Shell in the East. Singapore is the largest petrochemical production and export centre in the Asia Pacific region. Shell Jurong Island (SJI) manufactures petrochemicals to meet the fast-growing demand for these products in the region. We also have one of the largest single-branded retail networks in Singapore, providing customers with a wide range of quality products and services. When you join Shell in Singapore, you can count on our commitment to help you thrive and propel your career by means of our industry-leading development programme and our available and unrivalled pool of local and global experts. Our numerous global and local skill pools as well as our diversity are key to our success and continuing innovation.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><b><br> An innovative place to work <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p>There’s never been a more exciting time to work at Shell.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> Join us and you’ll be adding your talent and imagination to a business with the ambition to shape the future – whether by investing in oil, gas and renewable energy to meet demand, exploring new ways to store energy, or developing technology that helps the world to use energy more efficiently, everyone at Shell does their part.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> An inclusive place to work <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p>To power progress, we need to attract and develop the brightest minds and make sure every voice is heard. Here are just some of the ways we are nurturing an inclusive environment – one where you can express your ideas, extend your skills, and reach your potential.<\u002Fp>\n  <ul>\n   <li><p> We’re creating a space where people with disabilities can excel through transparent recruitment process, workplace adjustments and ongoing support in their roles. Feel free to let us know about your circumstances when you apply, and we’ll take it from there.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> We’re closing the gender gap – whether that’s through action on equal pay or by enabling more women to reach senior roles in engineering and technology.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> We’re striving to be a pioneer of an inclusive and diverse workplace, promoting equality for employees regardless of sexual orientation or gender identity.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> We consider ourselves a flexible employer and want to support you finding the right balance. We encourage you to discuss this with us in your application.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> A rewarding place to work <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p>Combine our creative, collaborative environment and global operations with an impressive range of benefits and joining Shell becomes an inspired career choice.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> We’re huge advocates for career development. We’ll encourage you to try new roles and experience new settings. By pushing people to reach their potential, we frequently help them find skills they never knew they had, or make career moves they never thought possible.<\u002Fp>\n  <br> \n  <p><\u002Fp> \n <\u002Fdiv>\n <p><\u002Fp> \n <div>\n  <h3 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><p>Disclaimer <\u002Fp><\u002Fh3>\n  <div>\n   <div>\n    Please note: We occasionally amend or withdraw Shell jobs and reserve the right to do so at any time, including prior to the advertised closing date. <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b>The Role<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2> \n <div>\n  <p><b>Where you fit in<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p> The Pulau Bukom Manufacturing Site today is the largest Shell refinery in the world in terms of crude distillation capacity, which makes Singapore a key regional supply and trading centre for Shell in the East. Singapore is the largest petrochemical production and export centre in the Asia Pacific region.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> What’s the role? <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p>As a Mechanical Maintenance Engineer, you will provide technical support, carry out hands-on maintenance and coordinates mechanical maintenance work in Production Unit (PU). The role assures that activities on the weekly schedule, emergencies or assigned non routine maintenance work are executed with quality and efficiency and in compliance to the site Health, Safety and Environment requirements.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> Your accountabilities include the following:<\u002Fp>\n  <ul>\n   <li><p> Deliver maintenance execution of static equipment in the PU. Perform equipment troubleshooting and providing feedback to custodian.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Maximizing the productivity of the contractor.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Implementation of LEAN. Ensure Safety, Reliability\u002Fquality &amp; optimum cost during maintenance execution. Ensure compliance of mechanical engineering practices and assets with statutory obligations, Engineering Codes of Practices and Shell DEP (Design and Engineering Practice) standards. Monitor and feedback on the maintenance effectiveness process and take corrective action if required.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Uses GSAP as a tool to manage maintenance execution. Accountability targets on duration, cost, and safety.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Execute plant changes and minor projects meeting HSE requirements, budget, and schedule. Manage the activities in the hard week schedule, adopting small adjustments or deviations where necessary.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Analyze and trouble-shoot mechanical problems. Report on recurring problems\u002Fbreakdowns.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Update and Maintain Spares Inventory. Planning for Emergency and Schedule Breaker Work orders. Plan \u002F execute \u002F obtain resources, materials, services, and equipment for E and SB priority work repairs. GSAP administration of time sheets, service, purchase, and material orders.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Use TRACK system to enter all the resources man hrs. Review and communicate daily \u002F weekly schedule assignments with workforce; ensure safe and efficient completion of assigned work.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Lead in daily maintenance schedule execution. Liaise with\u002Fconsults Operations, Technology, other Engineering and Procurement departments as part of the execution of jobs.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Perform end of day schedule progress. Ensure completion of QA \u002F QC and condition reports.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Field presence and supervisor of maintenance contractor (craft productivity and quality of work) for effective and efficient execution.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Feedback jobs that roll-over into next week(s) to the scheduler. Feedback to maintenance planning and scheduling. Identify risks for not achieving schedule and taking mitigating action, keeping maintenance team lead informed.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Timely request to operations for maintenance permitting. Work with Execution contractors to verify ePTW and submission timely for planned soft week review.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Perform shutdown management - planning, preparation &amp; execution.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> What we need from you<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p> To succeed in this role, you will have:<\u002Fp>\n  <ul>\n   <li><p> Diploma\u002FDegree in mechanical engineering with 5-7 years of experience, minimum 2-3 years of which is in engineering\u002Fmaintenance of rotating &amp; static equipment (experience in oil and gas industry is an advantage).<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Good understanding of the various international mechanical engineering standards. Troubleshooting skills, RCA, Causal Learning, Defect Elimination, etc.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Ability to work independently and yet participate as a member of a multidiscipline team. You will feature strengths as an energetic and collaborative team member, demonstrating proactive self-learner working behavior.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Knowledge of GSAP and Global Asset Mechanical Execution processes would be an added advantage.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> More about Shell in Singapore<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p> Shell is one the largest foreign investors in Singapore and began operations in 1891. Today, we have more than 3,200 employees in Singapore alone. Apart from the Palau Bukom Manufacturing site, Shell Jurong Island (SJI) manufactures petrochemicals to meet the fast-growing demand for these products in the region. We also have one of the largest single-branded retail networks in Singapore, providing customers with a wide range of quality products and services. When you join Shell in Singapore, you can count on our commitment to help you thrive and propel your career by means of our industry-leading development programme and our available and unrivalled pool of local and global experts. Our numerous global and local skill pools as well as our diversity are key to our success and continuing innovation.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><b><br> An innovative place to work <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p>There’s never been a more exciting time to work at Shell.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> Join us and you’ll be adding your talent and imagination to a business with the ambition to shape the future – whether by investing in oil, gas and renewable energy to meet demand, exploring new ways to store energy, or developing technology that helps the world to use energy more efficiently, everyone at Shell does their part.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> An inclusive place to work <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p>To power progress, we need to attract and develop the brightest minds and make sure every voice is heard. Here are just some of the ways we are nurturing an inclusive environment – one where you can express your ideas, extend your skills, and reach your potential.<\u002Fp>\n  <ul>\n   <li><p> We’re creating a space where people with disabilities can excel through transparent recruitment process, workplace adjustments and ongoing support in their roles. Feel free to let us know about your circumstances when you apply, and we’ll take it from there.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> We’re closing the gender gap – whether that’s through action on equal pay or by enabling more women to reach senior roles in engineering and technology.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> We’re striving to be a pioneer of an inclusive and diverse workplace, promoting equality for employees regardless of sexual orientation or gender identity.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> We consider ourselves a flexible employer and want to support you finding the right balance. We encourage you to discuss this with us in your application.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> A rewarding place to work <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p>Combine our creative, collaborative environment and global operations with an impressive range of benefits and joining Shell becomes an inspired career choice.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> We’re huge advocates for career development. We’ll encourage you to try new roles and experience new settings. <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b>The Role<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2> \n <div>\n  <p><b>What’s the role?<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> This role will be based in Singapore Jurong Island (SJI).<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <ul>\n   <li> Operate the process units in accordance to Operating Plan, Daily Operating Instructions, Standing Instructions and Site Health, Safety, Security, Environment procedures<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Work with the team to operate the plant within Design-Operating-Window and the Integrity-Operating-Window<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Upon completion of the training and guidance from team, you will perform the structured rounds and take corrective action to maintain equipment and plant operations within safe operating windows.<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Responsible for managing plant and equipment upsets, abnormal conditions and subsequent troubleshooting including incidents\u002Fplant emergencies and subsequent follow-up<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Assist in coordination of daily maintenance planning and participating in shutdown and start-up of units<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Help to update the operating procedures and prepare job pack documentation for equipment repair<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Keeping log records of operational activities for thorough handover to incoming shifts and sharing plant info with other disciplines of the company<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Participating in minor maintenance activities<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Perform the role of Auxiliary Fire Fighter if assigned in the event of emergency situations<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Operate robotic and automation technologies to perform plant surveillances and inspections<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Perform routine field data logging and reporting<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Use new data technologies to monitor plant and equipment performance<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Carry out\u002FPerform other related duties when required\u002Fassigned<\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> What we need from you?<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <ul>\n   <li> Nitec\u002FHigher Nitec in Chemical Process Technology or Diploma in Chemical Engineering \u002F Chemical &amp; Green Technology \u002F Clean Energy<\u002Fli>\n   <li><b> Fresh graduates are welcome to apply as we have a structured In-house training program<\u002Fb><\u002Fli>\n   <li> Strong passion to pursue a career with a forward-looking and dynamic organization<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Team player and keen interest for continual learning<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Ability to perform both Shift work and Day work when the need arises<\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> Shell is one the largest foreign investors in Singapore and began operations in 1891. Today, we have more than 3,200 employees in Singapore alone. The Pulau Bukom Manufacturing Site today is the largest Shell refinery in the world in terms of crude distillation capacity, which makes Singapore a key regional supply and trading centre for Shell in the East. Singapore is the largest petrochemical production and export centre in the Asia Pacific region. Shell Jurong Island (SJI) manufactures petrochemicals to meet the fast-growing demand for these products in the region. We also have one of the largest single-branded retail networks in Singapore, providing customers with a wide range of quality products and services. When you join Shell in Singapore, you can count on our commitment to help you thrive and propel your career by means of our industry-leading development programme and our available and unrivalled pool of local and global experts. Our numerous global and local skill pools as well as our diversity are key to our success and continuing innovation.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><b><br> An innovative place to work <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p>There’s never been a more exciting time to work at Shell. Everyone here is helping solve one of the biggest challenges facing the world today: bringing the benefits of energy to everyone on the planet, whilst managing the risks of climate change.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> Join us and you’ll be adding your talent and imagination to a business with the ambition to shape the future – whether by investing in renewables, exploring new ways to store energy, or developing technology that helps the world to use energy more efficiently, everyone at Shell does their part.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> An inclusive place to work <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p>To power progress together, we need to attract and develop the brightest minds and make sure every voice is heard. Here are just some of the ways we are nurturing an inclusive environment – one where you can express your ideas, extend your skills, and reach your potential…<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <ul>\n   <li> We’re creating a space where people with disabilities can excel through transparent recruitment process, workplace adjustments and ongoing support in their roles. Feel free to let us know about your circumstances when you apply, and we’ll take it from there.<\u002Fli>\n   <li> We’re closing the gender gap – whether that’s through action on equal pay or by enabling more women to reach senior roles in engineering and technology.<\u002Fli>\n   <li> We’re striving to be a pioneer of an inclusive and diverse workplace, promoting equality for employees regardless of sexual orientation or gender identity.<\u002Fli>\n   <li> We consider ourselves a flexible employer and want to support you finding the right balance. We encourage you to discuss this with us in your application.<\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> A rewarding place to work <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p>Combine our creative, collaborative environment and global operations with an impressive range of benefits and joining Shell becomes an inspired career choice.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> We’re huge advocates for career development. We’ll encourage you to try new roles and experience new settings. By pushing people to reach their potential, we frequently help them find skills they never knew they had, or make career moves they never thought possible.<\u002Fp>\n  <br> \n <\u002Fdiv>\n <p><\u002Fp> \n <div>\n  <h3 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><p>Disclaimer <\u002Fp><\u002Fh3>\n  <div>\n   <div>\n    Please note: We occasionally amend or withdraw Shell jobs and reserve the right to do so at any time, including prior to the advertised closing date. The Shell Group and its approved recruitment consultants will never ask you for a fee to process or consider your application for a career with Shell. Anyone who demands such a fee is not an authorised Shell representative and you are strongly advised to refuse any such demand. <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b>The Role<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2> \n <div>\n  <p><b>Where you fit in<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p> The Freight Trader position offers you the opportunity to join the Global Products Freight Trading Team with its challenging, dynamic and fast paced Physical and Paper Freight Trading business environment. The role also offers the ability to develop cutting edge, innovative analysis models to gain the most accurate forward view of the products freight markets.<br> <br> The role is expected to work closely with Products Global Trading Networks (GTN) and other parts of Shell Downstream in support of their business objectives by providing a first class and competitive freight service and interface in areas of mutual benefit.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> What’s the role?<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p> The Products Freight Trading Team is required to charter full range of crude, products and chemicals. This will include spot, CVC, COA, TCT and Time Charter activities, as well as Freight Trading both in the physical and derivatives markets. Analytics are an important component of the Freight Trader role, developing an understanding of how the markets trade from a ground-up approach.<\u002Fp>\n  <ul>\n   <li><p> Manage physical freight trading positions in support of the freight team goals\u002Ftargets, while also utilising derivatives trading tools for exposure management.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Support financial and other targets set for the Freight Trading Group, therefore maximise profitability on Group controlled vessels.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Work with oil trading desks\u002Fother cargo desks within Downstream to seek optimal logistics solutions in wet and paper freight trading. Be proactive in looking for opportunities that might give traders an \"edge\".<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Shell trading systems must at all times be kept fully updated, input concluded by close of business on the day a deal is completed or as required by a particular location. Close contact must be maintained with the finance \u002F Credit \u002F compliance \u002F KYC \u002F Trade Control teams to ensure trading practices are correct and compliance.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Liaise with counterparties (owners\u002Fbrokers\u002Fcharterers) around the world and therefore with varying time differences. Gathering market information, assessing the accuracy of such and dispensing this around the GTN + Downstream. It is important that relationships are built with other Charterer’s and Owners as a customer base.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Deal generation is very high and the ability to work under pressure is an extremely important attribute to have. It must be understood that working hours are not standard. It is important that the incumbent is above all a team player.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> What we need from you<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <ul>\n   <li><p> Possess at least 5 to 10 years Freight Trading\u002FChartering experience.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Candidates with relevant Chemical Freight Parcelling, Commercial and Time Chartering experience will be preferred.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Background in Tanker\u002FChartering and Oil &amp; Gas is advantageous.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> It is essential that you can show you are a self-starter and can work well as part of a team.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Trading and Shipping operational knowledge including loading and discharging of ships, liaising with customers and knowledge of cargoes etc are desirable.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> An awareness \u002F understanding of paper instruments utilized for hedging and speculative trading would be valuable.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> Company Description<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p> Shell is one the largest foreign investors in Singapore and began operations in 1891. Today, we have more than 3,200 employees in Singapore alone. The Pulau Bukom Manufacturing Site today is the largest Shell refinery in the world in terms of crude distillation capacity, which makes Singapore a key regional supply and trading centre for Shell in the East. Singapore is the largest petrochemical production and export centre in the Asia Pacific region. Shell Jurong Island (SJI) manufactures petrochemicals to meet the fast-growing demand for these products in the region. We also have one of the largest single-branded retail networks in Singapore, providing customers with a wide range of quality products and services. When you join Shell in Singapore, you can count on our commitment to help you thrive and propel your career by means of our industry-leading development programme and our available and unrivalled pool of local and global experts. Our numerous global and local skill pools as well as our diversity are key to our success and continuing innovation.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> An innovative place to work <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p>There’s never been a more exciting time to work at Shell.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> Join us and you’ll be adding your talent and imagination to a business with the ambition to shape the future – whether by investing in oil, gas, and renewable energy to meet demand, exploring new ways to store energy, or developing technology that helps the world to use energy more efficiently, everyone at Shell does their part.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> An inclusive place to work <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p>To power progress, we need to attract and develop the brightest minds and make sure every voice is heard. Here are just some of the ways we are nurturing an inclusive environment – one where you can express your ideas, extend your skills, and reach your potential.<\u002Fp>\n  <ul>\n   <li><p> We’re creating a space where people with disabilities can excel through transparent recruitment process, workplace adjustments and ongoing support in their roles. Feel free to let us know about your circumstances when you apply, and we’ll take it from there.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> We’re closing the gender gap – whether that’s through action on equal pay or by enabling more women to reach senior roles in engineering and technology.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> We’re striving to be a pioneer of an inclusive and diverse workplace, promoting equality for employees regardless of sexual orientation or gender identity.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> We consider ourselves a flexible employer and want to support you finding the right balance. We encourage you to discuss this with us in your application.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> A rewarding place to work <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p>Combine our creative, collaborative environment and global operations with an impressive range of benefits and joining Shell becomes an inspired career choice.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> We’re huge advocates for career development. We’ll encourage you to try new roles and experience new settings. By pushing people to reach their potential, we frequently help them find skills they never knew they had, or make career moves they never thought possible.<\u002Fp>\n  <br> \n <\u002Fdiv>\n <p><\u002Fp> \n <div>\n  <h3 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><p>Disclaimer <\u002Fp><\u002Fh3>\n  <div>\n   <div>\n    Please note: We occasionally amend or withdraw Shell jobs and reserve the right to do so at any time, including prior to the advertised closing date. Anyone who demands such a fee is not an authorised Shell representative and you are strongly advised to refuse any such demand. <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b>The Role<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2> \n <div>\n  <p><b>What’s the role? <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p>As Electrical Maintenance Technician, you will provide technical support and coordinate maintenance work related to electrical discipline.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> The role assures that activities on the weekly schedule, emergencies or assigned non-routine maintenance work are executed with quality, efficiency and in compliance to the site Health, Safety and Environment requirements.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> Your key accountabilities include the following:<\u002Fp>\n  <ul>\n   <li><p> Provides day-to-day hands-on support to Electrical Engineer on maintenance\u002Ftroubleshooting in Production Unit.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Timely execution of routine\u002Fpreventive maintenance on all electrical works including Steam and Gas Turbine Generator, UPS, Emergency Diesel Generator, Power distribution system, VSD, HV and LV motors\u002Fcables, PLC, Earthing, Ex-equipment to ensure high plant availability and equipment integrity.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Support in preparing job specifications and costing for works involved &amp; follow up issuance of purchase order to Contractors.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Liaises with\u002Fconsults Operations, Technology, other Engineering and Procurement departments on scheduled jobs with minimal disruptions to the operations of the process plants.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Provides good documentation to ensure all equipment, technical records and drawings are updated to reflect the latest changes, proper and correct procedures are followed, configuration and software changes to electrical equipment are documented, archived, and backed up for disaster recovery.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Work safely with all staff and contractors to comply with HSSE standards; and participate in audits to ensure compliance with SHELL HSSE standards.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Participates\u002Fconducts audits related to quality, health, safety, and environment.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Seeks improvement in techniques, procedures, and technology to improve reliability at minimum costs and within budget.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Maintains work requests and records on maintenance works using computerized maintenance management systems GSAP.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> What we need from you<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p> To succeed in this role, you will have:<\u002Fp>\n  <ul>\n   <li><p> Relevant Diploma \u002F ITE in Electrical Technology\u002F Engineering or equivalent.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> 2-5 years of relevant experience in the Oil &amp; Gas\u002F Process industry maintenance field.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Skilled in Electrical circuit interpretation, troubleshooting, executing maintenance work, interfacing with others and managing the contractors on site.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Knowledge of the Job Hazard Analysis, Confine Space Entry, Permit to Work system and Clearance application requirement.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Electrician’s Licence (L7) and\u002For CompEx Certification will have an advantage.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> Company Description<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p> Shell is one the largest foreign investors in Singapore and began operations in 1891. Today, we have more than 3,200 employees in Singapore alone. The Pulau Bukom Manufacturing Site today is the largest Shell refinery in the world in terms of crude distillation capacity, which makes Singapore a key regional supply and trading centre for Shell in the East. Singapore is the largest petrochemical production and export centre in the Asia Pacific region. Shell Jurong Island (SJI) manufactures petrochemicals to meet the fast-growing demand for these products in the region. We also have one of the largest single-branded retail networks in Singapore, providing customers with a wide range of quality products and services. When you join Shell in Singapore, you can count on our commitment to help you thrive and propel your career by means of our industry-leading development programme and our available and unrivalled pool of local and global experts. Our numerous global and local skill pools as well as our diversity are key to our success and continuing innovation.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> An innovative place to work <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p>There’s never been a more exciting time to work at Shell.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> Join us and you’ll be adding your talent and imagination to a business with the ambition to shape the future – whether by investing in oil, gas, and renewable energy to meet demand, exploring new ways to store energy, or developing technology that helps the world to use energy more efficiently, everyone at Shell does their part.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> An inclusive place to work <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p>To power progress, we need to attract and develop the brightest minds and make sure every voice is heard. Here are just some of the ways we are nurturing an inclusive environment – one where you can express your ideas, extend your skills, and reach your potential.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <ul>\n   <li><p> We’re creating a space where people with disabilities can excel through transparent recruitment process, workplace adjustments and ongoing support in their roles. Feel free to let us know about your circumstances when you apply, and we’ll take it from there.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> We’re closing the gender gap – whether that’s through action on equal pay or by enabling more women to reach senior roles in engineering and technology.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> We’re striving to be a pioneer of an inclusive and diverse workplace, promoting equality for employees regardless of sexual orientation or gender identity.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> We consider ourselves a flexible employer and want to support you finding the right balance. We encourage you to discuss this with us in your application.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> A rewarding place to work <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p>Combine our creative, collaborative environment and global operations with an impressive range of benefits and joining Shell becomes an inspired career choice.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> We’re huge advocates for career development. We’ll encourage you to try new roles and experience new settings. <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b>The Role<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2> \n <div>\n  <p><b>Where you fit in<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p> You will be based in our integrated lubricants and grease production facility in Tuas, Singapore and will be partnering with business stakeholders to build truly integrated, collaborative, and competitive supply chains for Lubricants.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> What’s the role? <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p>As Digital and Data Analyst, your key accountabilities include the following:<\u002Fp>\n  <ul>\n   <li><p> Perform review of on digitalization project initiatives to ensure timely completion and value delivery.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Liaise with government agencies to understand their steer in Industry 4.0 and highlight fit for purpose suggestions to activities.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Extract data from data platforms, track and report Key Performance index (KPIs). KPI may include but not limited to: Overall Equipment Efficiency (OEE), Energy Performance index and CO2 footprint, Blend Right First Time (RFT), Sample Track and Trace (STT), Days in Inventory (DIO) etc.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Perform detailed data analysis on the KPIs and set target on those KPIs.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Perform data - based evaluation to identify work processes that is less than efficient and suggest area of improvements.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Perform weekly discussions and cadence with production, planning, logistic and quality team to plan and execute improvements item.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Work with internal and external stakeholders to design, execute and implement new digital tools.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> What we need from you<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p> To succeed in this role, you will have:<\u002Fp>\n  <ul>\n   <li><p> Bachelor’s degree in Engineering discipline or equivalent.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Minimum 3-5 years of relevant work experience.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Awareness in Industry 4.0 and Skilled in Data analytical\u002F visualisation tools (Spotfire\u002F Phyton\u002F Power Bi etc).<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Experience in LEAN and\u002For Continuous Improvement (CI) methodologies is a plus.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Demonstrated interest and outward focus on new technologies, sustainability, industry trends.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Experience with manufacturing and production operations.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Excellent communication skills across organization levels.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Strong teamwork &amp; collaboration skills.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Basic proficiency in MS Office.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> Company Description<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p> Shell is one the largest foreign investors in Singapore and began operations in 1891. Today, we have more than 3,200 employees in Singapore alone. The Pulau Bukom Manufacturing Site today is the largest Shell refinery in the world in terms of crude distillation capacity, which makes Singapore a key regional supply and trading centre for Shell in the East. Singapore is the largest petrochemical production and export centre in the Asia Pacific region. Shell Jurong Island (SJI) manufactures petrochemicals to meet the fast-growing demand for these products in the region. We also have one of the largest single-branded retail networks in Singapore, providing customers with a wide range of quality products and services. When you join Shell in Singapore, you can count on our commitment to help you thrive and propel your career by means of our industry-leading development programme and our available and unrivalled pool of local and global experts. Our numerous global and local skill pools as well as our diversity are key to our success and continuing innovation.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> An innovative place to work <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p>There’s never been a more exciting time to work at Shell.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> Join us and you’ll be adding your talent and imagination to a business with the ambition to shape the future – whether by investing in oil, gas, and renewable energy to meet demand, exploring new ways to store energy, or developing technology that helps the world to use energy more efficiently, everyone at Shell does their part.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> An inclusive place to work <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p>To power progress, we need to attract and develop the brightest minds and make sure every voice is heard. Here are just some of the ways we are nurturing an inclusive environment – one where you can express your ideas, extend your skills, and reach your potential.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <ul>\n   <li><p> We’re creating a space where people with disabilities can excel through transparent recruitment process, workplace adjustments and ongoing support in their roles. Feel free to let us know about your circumstances when you apply, and we’ll take it from there.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> We’re closing the gender gap – whether that’s through action on equal pay or by enabling more women to reach senior roles in engineering and technology.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> We’re striving to be a pioneer of an inclusive and diverse workplace, promoting equality for employees regardless of sexual orientation or gender identity.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> We consider ourselves a flexible employer and want to support you finding the right balance. We encourage you to discuss this with us in your application.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> A rewarding place to work <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p>Combine our creative, collaborative environment and global operations with an impressive range of benefits and joining Shell becomes an inspired career choice.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> We’re huge advocates for career development. We’ll encourage you to try new roles and experience new settings. By pushing people to reach their potential, we frequently help them find skills they never knew they had, or make career moves they never thought possible.<\u002Fp>\n  <br> \n <\u002Fdiv>\n <p><\u002Fp> \n <div>\n  <h3 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><p>Disclaimer <\u002Fp><\u002Fh3>\n  <div>\n   <div>\n    Please note: We occasionally amend or withdraw Shell jobs and reserve the right to do so at any time, including prior to the advertised closing date. <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b>The Role<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2> \n <div>\n  <p><b>What’s the role?<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p> Shell Trading integrates a world-wide trading network with an unsurpassed global portfolio in crude oil, refined products, natural gas, electrical power and chemicals. As the world’s largest energy trading business, Shell Trading is a key segment of the Royal Dutch Shell portfolio, leveraging scale, global reach, talent and financial strength to compete strongly and continue to grow in the evolving energy trading market.<\u002Fp>\n  <p> With trading volumes of about 14 million barrels of crude oil equivalent per day, this organization has the skill base, dedicated staff and international scope to capitalize on trading opportunities inherent in Shell's asset and market positions around the world. Member companies of the Shell Trading Network are located in North and South America, Asia, Europe and the Middle East.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> The role will be based in Singapore which is one of the 3 major trading hubs covering Asian markets. The trader development program is a unique opportunity for high caliber candidates to go through a 2-4 year structured program to become a trader. No prior experience in trading is necessary, candidates would typically have 3-5 year work experience after graduation. The program will be tailored based on prior experience and can be accelerated for those with some relevant skillset. Typically, rotations will include trading operation, risk analysis, market analysis, refinery scheduling role at the Bukom refinery as well as blending. Towards the end of the program it will cover paper and physical trading under supervision. Progress will be assessed and monitored through regular assessment by trading management. Support will be provided through on the job training and mentoring by senior trading staff as well as regular training courses.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> Accountabilities:<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <ul>\n   <li><p> The accountabilities will depend on the particular rotation, some examples below<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Scheduling ship operations, communicating and aligning with various internal and external stakeholders such as inspectors, shipowners, trading counterparties<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Gain in depth understanding of various risk in trading, including market risk, counterparty and operation risk and how to best manage and mitigate those risks<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Gain in depth understating of particular oil or energy market, learn tools and techniques how to study each market and how to translate analysis views into trading positions<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Closely work with Shell assets such as Bukom refinery and other parts of Shell (retail or aviation business for example) to maximize value along the whole value chain<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Work closely with other parts of the global team on arbitrage opportunities<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Learn how to execute both physical and paper trades under supervision of senior traders<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Learn how to create trading strategies and how to build trading structures<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Ability to multi-task in a stressful and dynamic work environment.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n  <p><b> What We Need From You<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <ul>\n   <li><p> Must have legal authorization to work in the Singapore on a full-time basis for anyone other than current employer.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Bachelor’s Degree or higher level of education required.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Highly numerical, strong analytical and problem-solving aptitude.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> High level of attention to detail and accuracy.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Ability to perform under pressure, meet tight deadlines<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Self-starter with excellent computer skills.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Ambitious, driven, self-motivated individual who functions well in a team environment<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Ability to work with incomplete information, to form market views and take educated risks<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Strong resilience to be able to deal with emotional ups and downs of a trading role<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> An innovative place to work<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p> There’s never been a more exciting time to work at Shell. Everyone here is helping solve one of the biggest challenges facing the world today: bringing the benefits of energy to everyone on the planet, whilst managing the risks of climate change.<\u002Fp>\n  <p> Join us and you’ll add your talent and imagination to a business with the power to shape the future – whether by investing in renewables, exploring new ways to store energy or developing technology that helps the world to use energy more efficiently.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> An inclusive place to work<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p> To power progress together, we need to attract and develop the brightest minds and make sure every voice is heard. Here are just some of the ways we’re nurturing an inclusive environment – one where you can express your ideas, extend your skills and reach your potential…<\u002Fp>\n  <ul>\n   <li><p> We’re creating a space where people with disabilities can excel through transparent recruitment process, workplace adjustments and ongoing support in their roles. Feel free to let us know about your circumstances when you apply, and we’ll take it from there.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> We’re closing the gender gap – whether that’s through action on equal pay or by enabling more women to reach senior roles in engineering and technology.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> We’re striving to be a pioneer of an inclusive and diverse workplace, promoting equality for employees regardless of sexual orientation or gender identity.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> We consider ourselves a flexible employer and want to support you finding the right balance. We encourage you to discuss this with us in your application.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> A rewarding place to work<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p> Combine our creative, collaborative environment and global operations with an impressive range of benefits and joining Shell becomes an inspired career choice.<\u002Fp>\n  <p> We’re huge advocates for career development. We’ll encourage you to try new roles and experience new settings. By pushing people to reach their potential, we frequently help them find skills they never knew they had, or make career moves they never thought possible.<\u002Fp>\n  <br> \n  <p><\u002Fp> \n <\u002Fdiv>\n <p><\u002Fp> \n <div>\n  <h3 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><p>Disclaimer <\u002Fp><\u002Fh3>\n  <div>\n   <div>\n    Please note: We occasionally amend or withdraw Shell jobs and reserve the right to do so at any time, including prior to the advertised closing date. Before applying, you are advised to read our data protection policy. This policy describes the processing that may be associated with your personal data and informs you that your personal data may be transferred to Shell\u002FShell Group companies around the world. The Shell Group and its approved recruitment consultants will never ask you for a fee to process or consider your application for a career with Shell. Anyone who demands such a fee is not an authorised Shell representative and you are strongly advised to refuse any such demand. Shell is an Equal Opportunity Employer.\n   <\u002Fdiv>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b>The Role<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2> \n <div>\n  <p><b>This is an exciting opportunity for you to be part of the Acquisitions, Divestments and New Business Development Deal Execution Team as a Management Assistant to GM Deal Execution East &amp; Team Assistant. Your role is to provide personal assistant support and will involve interfacing with senior stakeholders internal and external to the organization. <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b>Where you fit in<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> The Acquisitions, Divestments and New Business Development organization in Shell (‘IGM’) is being established as part of Reshape to deliver Shell’s largest and most complex commercial deals in partnership with all businesses. Strategy Delivery is a key priority, and the business purpose is to deliver sustainable value and drive strategic portfolio changes through the Energy Transition through innovative, integrated commercial deals, from inception to successful completion and implementation.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> This organisation covers the majority of Shell’s merger, acquisition and divestment transactions, all acquisitions of public listed companies and the largest and most complex New Business Development (NBD) activities.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> What’s the role?<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> The Management Assistant is responsible for providing business and office administrative support to the GM Deal Execution East and other leaders in the A, D &amp; NBD organisation. Key areas of responsibilities include but are not limited to:<\u002Fp>\n  <ul>\n   <li> Agenda Management e.g. monitoring, managing, sorting, or routing messages, emails, to respective parties;<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Travel arrangements i.e. (incl. required preparations for travel location such as visa requirements, and organizing local matters)<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Organizing\u002Fcoordinating events in\u002Foutside Shell offices e.g. for social events, conferences, workshops, meetings, lunches, trainings, talks. These events usually require the job holder to research venues, negotiate with 3rd parties and undertake costing activities. Accountable for full administration before\u002Fduring\u002Fafter the event.<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Visitor arrangements – making arrangements for visitor(s) at the office, which includes preparing the agenda, organizing site access, greeting and escorting the visitor(s)<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Finance management e.g. maintenance of accounts, assisting to verify invoices related to the department, supporting the budgeting process and any other data analysis.<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Publishing e.g. coordinating printing of conference papers, reports, news forum, newsletter and website.<\u002Fli>\n   <li> General office management e.g. assisting to prepare documents, reports, presentations; preparing meeting minutes (outcomes, action plans, follow up); drafting routine letters; on-boarding new staff in the department on office<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Acting as business focal point for Real Estate and Facilities Management, office planning and keeping track \u002F maintenance of department IT equipment<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Managing data and records management as needed<\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> What we need from you?<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> Skills<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <ul>\n   <li> Ability to work with minimal supervision and be a self-starter<\u002Fli>\n   <li> The ability to work under pressure and cope with last minute changes is essential<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Strong written and verbal English language skills<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Data privacy and confidentiality given the sensitive nature or projects\u002Fpre-reads handled. Ability to hand highly sensitive situations with diplomacy and tact<\u002Fli>\n   <li> At peak times, flexibility in working hours outside the normal work pattern may be required<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Working to a global calendar with solid understanding of time zone challenges when scheduling meetings<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Sound administrative\u002Fsecretarial skills<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Excellent interpersonal skills both face to face and on the phone\\<\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> Finally, none of us has all the skills, so we look for those who want to learn and grow our community capability.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> COMPANY DESCRIPTION<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> Shell is one the largest foreign investors in Singapore and began operations in 1891. Today, we have more than 3,200 employees in Singapore alone. The Pulau Bukom Manufacturing Site today is the largest Shell refinery in the world in terms of crude distillation capacity, which makes Singapore a key regional supply and trading centre for Shell in the East. Singapore is the largest petrochemical production and export centre in the Asia Pacific region. Shell Jurong Island (SJI) manufactures petrochemicals to meet the fast-growing demand for these products in the region. We also have one of the largest single-branded retail networks in Singapore, providing customers with a wide range of quality products and services. When you join Shell in Singapore, you can count on our commitment to help you thrive and propel your career by means of our industry-leading development programme and our available and unrivalled pool of local and global experts. Our numerous global and local skill pools as well as our diversity are key to our success and continuing innovation.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> An innovative place to work <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p>There’s never been a more exciting time to work at Shell.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> Join us and you’ll be adding your talent and imagination to a business with the ambition to shape the future – whether by investing in oil, gas and renewable energy to meet demand, exploring new ways to store energy, or developing technology that helps the world to use energy more efficiently, everyone at Shell does their part.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> An inclusive place to work <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p>To power progress, we need to attract and develop the brightest minds and make sure every voice is heard. Here are just some of the ways we are nurturing an inclusive environment – one where you can express your ideas, extend your skills, and reach your potential.<\u002Fp>\n  <ul>\n   <li> We’re creating a space where people with disabilities can excel through transparent recruitment process, workplace adjustments and ongoing support in their roles. Feel free to let us know about your circumstances when you apply, and we’ll take it from there.<\u002Fli>\n   <li> We’re closing the gender gap – whether that’s through action on equal pay or by enabling more women to reach senior roles in engineering and technology.<\u002Fli>\n   <li> We’re striving to be a pioneer of an inclusive and diverse workplace, promoting equality for employees regardless of sexual orientation or gender identity.<\u002Fli>\n   <li> We consider ourselves a flexible employer and want to support you finding the right balance. We encourage you to discuss this with us in your application.<\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> A rewarding place to work <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p>Combine our creative, collaborative environment and global operations with an impressive range of benefits and joining Shell becomes an inspired career choice.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> We’re huge advocates for career development. We’ll encourage you to try new roles and experience new settings. By pushing people to reach their potential, we frequently help them find skills they never knew they had, or make career moves they never thought possible.<\u002Fp>\n  <br> \n <\u002Fdiv>\n <p><\u002Fp> \n <div>\n  <h3 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><p>Disclaimer <\u002Fp><\u002Fh3>\n  <div>\n   <div>\n    Please note: We occasionally amend or withdraw Shell jobs and reserve the right to do so at any time, including prior to the advertised closing date. <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b>The Role<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2> \n <div>\n  <p>We are looking for a motivated and passionate individual who is keen to work in an extremely fast paced and challenging environment where you will be constantly involved in crisis management\u002Fsolution mode. Every second counts, time is money.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> What’s the role?<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <ul>\n   <li><p> Operators are the key executors of the ’life of the deal’, managing movements on bulk crude or product tankers from supply to delivery point in an operationally excellent and optimal manner, preventing profit leakage and looking for value add or optimization opportunities.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Some Operator roles will be more involved with running voyage charter vessels, operating Shell-leased terminals and or possibly involved in some blending activities. In these instances, Operators are expected to defend the P&amp;L and look out for opportunities to maximize margins through effective asset utilization, preventing unnecessary downtime\u002Fdemurrage or improving blend margins.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Ensure that all obligations arising from the contract and charter party are executed flawlessly, in compliance with governmental and industrial regulations as well as Shell’s HSSE guidelines.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Daily external interface with contractual counterparties, terminal operators, vessel owners\u002Fbrokers and contracted vendors such as cargo surveyors or port agents.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Daily internal interface with Cargo\u002FFreight Traders, Shipping &amp; Maritime, Manufacturing, Product Optimizers, Claims, Contracts, Demurrage, Legal and Trade Finance.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Expected to manage supply and delivery schedules with internal and external counterparties. Operators will need to appreciate the challenges and constraints of the end-to-end supply chain, and operationalize a plan to meet those objectives, while remaining profitable and compliant.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Timely and accurate ship\u002Fcargo and date range nominations to ensure supply integrity and successful implementation of commercial business\u002Fsupply intent.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Manage vessel operations, such as scheduling, routing, bunkering, stow planning &amp; optimization, issuing voyage orders and monitoring fleet of vessels under your charge.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Manage cargo operations, such as managing off-spec issues, cargo readiness, scheduling, blending (where applicable for more senior or specialized Operators roles), avoiding tank-top\u002Fstock-out situations and volume\u002Fdate-range optimization.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Support post-deal activities like settlements, customs clearance, demurrage and claims for example; ensuring that all necessary operational information is passed on in good time and documentary requirements are met.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Appoint independent cargo surveyors, expeditors, ship-to-ship service providers and ships agents.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Ensure that all operational data is updated into trading systems in timely and accurate manner, facilitating up-to-date and accurate information flow.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Ensure that adequate records are filed to meet the company’s legal and fiscal obligations.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Ensure that any necessary financial security is in place prior to transfer of title to customers.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Be available to manage critical out of regular office hour issues.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> The job may require after office hours or weekend attention from time to<br> time.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Attention to details, meticulousness and numeracy skills are a prerequisite.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> What we need from you<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <ul>\n   <li><p> Display some evidence of commerciality and ability to maximize margins or adding-value to the bottom line. For example: ability to participate in or positively contribute to end-to-end supply strategy plans as well as ability to identify\u002Fresolve potential blockers to successful operational execution.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Ability to contribute to successful implementation of an operations plan, identifying and managing supply\u002Foperational constraints independently.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Display some understanding of and ability to articulate the demands and nature of the commercial business.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Display evidence of effective teamwork, strong networking and influencing skills. Prospective candidates should be able to give evidence of effective stakeholder and relationship management.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Evidence of being able to manage multiple and conflicting priorities to achieve business intent and objectives with minimal supervision. Ability to multi task under pressure and yet maintaining the level of details\u002Faccuracy.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Evidence of ability to problem solve in uncertain circumstances or working with incomplete information.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Evidence of ability to function well in a fast-paced dynamic environment where changes are the norm.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Candidates are expected to be proactive self-starters, as well as demonstrable evidence of resilience in adversity, determination and drive to get things done.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Demonstrate a passion for operations excellence and evidence of participating in optimization initiatives or activities.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> Company Description<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p> Shell is one the largest foreign investors in Singapore and began operations in 1891. Today, we have more than 3,200 employees in Singapore alone. The Pulau Bukom Manufacturing Site today is the largest Shell refinery in the world in terms of crude distillation capacity, which makes Singapore a key regional supply and trading centre for Shell in the East. Singapore is the largest petrochemical production and export centre in the Asia Pacific region. Shell Jurong Island (SJI) manufactures petrochemicals to meet the fast-growing demand for these products in the region. We also have one of the largest single-branded retail networks in Singapore, providing customers with a wide range of quality products and services. When you join Shell in Singapore, you can count on our commitment to help you thrive and propel your career by means of our industry-leading development programme and our available and unrivalled pool of local and global experts. Our numerous global and local skill pools as well as our diversity are key to our success and continuing innovation.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> An innovative place to work<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p> There’s never been a more exciting time to work at Shell.<\u002Fp>\n  <p> Join us and you’ll be adding your talent and imagination to a business with the ambition to shape the future – whether by investing in oil, gas, and renewable energy to meet demand, exploring new ways to store energy, or developing technology that helps the world to use energy more efficiently, everyone at Shell does their part.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> An inclusive place to work<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p> To power progress, we need to attract and develop the brightest minds and make sure every voice is heard. Here are just some of the ways we are nurturing an inclusive environment – one where you can express your ideas, extend your skills, and reach your potential.<\u002Fp>\n  <ul>\n   <li><p> We’re creating a space where people with disabilities can excel through transparent recruitment process, workplace adjustments and ongoing support in their roles. Feel free to let us know about your circumstances when you apply, and we’ll take it from there.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> We’re closing the gender gap – whether that’s through action on equal pay or by enabling more women to reach senior roles in engineering and technology.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> We’re striving to be a pioneer of an inclusive and diverse workplace, promoting equality for employees regardless of sexual orientation or gender identity.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> We consider ourselves a flexible employer and want to support you finding the right balance. We encourage you to discuss this with us in your application.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> A rewarding place to work<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p> Combine our creative, collaborative environment and global operations with an impressive range of benefits and joining Shell becomes an inspired career choice.<\u002Fp>\n  <p> We’re huge advocates for career development. We’ll encourage you to try new roles and experience new settings. By pushing people to reach their potential, we frequently help them find skills they never knew they had, or make career moves they never thought possible.<\u002Fp>\n  <br> \n <\u002Fdiv>\n <p><\u002Fp> \n <div>\n  <h3 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><p>Disclaimer <\u002Fp><\u002Fh3>\n  <div>\n   <div>\n    Please note: We occasionally amend or withdraw Shell jobs and reserve the right to do so at any time, including prior to the advertised closing date. Before applying, you are advised to read our data protection policy. This policy describes the processing that may be associated with your personal data and informs you that your personal data may be transferred to Shell\u002FShell Group companies around the world. The Shell Group and its approved recruitment consultants will never ask you for a fee to process or consider your application for a career with Shell. Anyone who demands such a fee is not an authorised Shell representative and you are strongly advised to refuse any such demand. Shell is an Equal Opportunity Employer.\n   <\u002Fdiv>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b>The Role<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2> \n <div>\n  <p><b>Where you fit in<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> The Shipping Industry is moving towards cleaner fuel alternatives such as LNG, Methanol and Biofuels. There is also growing appetite to manage carbon exposure through various management techniques and create a more sustainable footprint for the future of the freight business. Bunker Sourcing team members will play a key role in minimising value leakage throughout these changes and will support forming and implementing the bunker purchasing strategy for their region.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> This position is in the Commercial Operations area, which is part of the Shell Global Trading Network. The ability to prioritize from several potentially conflicting tasks whilst keeping a cool head is essential to success in dealings with internal and external customers. We are looking for those willing to work to deadlines in a lively, fast-moving, frequently changing environment where numeracy, attention to detail, proven team working, and communication skills are important.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> Due to the nature of the role, it is critical that the candidate has the right focus to manage the significant potential exposure in both HSSE and Compliance.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> The candidate will be expected to be available outside of office hours in-case of certain issues given shipping is a 24\u002F7 business.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> What’s the role?<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> This position is responsible to carry out bunker sourcing activities across the Asia Pacific and Middle East regions, supporting the Global Crude, Products and LNG Freight Trading businesses.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> Freight Trading in Shell continues to evolve with a growing amount of external voyage charters, significant changes in regulatory policy, a move towards cleaner fuel choices and tough market conditions which require all industry players to seek out improved technological and operational solutions to add value.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> This role will specifically focus on the Asia-Pacific market.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> This role will require strong collaboration with associated Commercial teams within Crude, Products and LNG Freight Trading and alignment &amp; support of the strategies of these teams.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> The specific requirements of this role are to:<\u002Fp>\n  <ul>\n   <li><p> Source bunkers both through the Shell marine fuel network and the external market in most cost-efficient way, fully aligned to HSSE, Compliance and business objectives<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Partnership with Freight Traders and Operators in assessing business opportunities by providing economics and fuel availability to ascertain the ideal bunkering location<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Develop solutions to reduce bunker costs jointly with Freight Traders and Operators<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Establish and articulate a market view to Freight Traders &amp; Operators and leadership.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Establish strong relationships both internally and externally<\u002Fp>\n    <ul>\n     <li><p> Bunker suppliers and build long term and strategic partnerships with key suppliers<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n     <li><p> Key stakeholders and manage interfaces across Freight Trading, Operations and Maritime Assurance<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n    <\u002Ful><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Identify and negotiate claims arising from bunker purchase contracts e.g. short deliveries, specification shortfalls. Liaise with Claims Team on major claims.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> The candidate can also look forward to the following development opportunities:<\u002Fp>\n  <ul>\n   <li><p> Develop and build long term and strategic partnerships with key suppliers to support future business development plans.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Be a key contributor of the bunker sourcing strategy which is refreshed annually in line with business objectives.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Identify and develop Continuous Improvement opportunities to streamline and improve performance.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> What we need from you<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <ul>\n   <li><p> Commercial trading operations, bunker broker or bunker trader experience encouraged.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Strong decision-making ability and comfortable to work with limited information on hand.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Strong commercial acumen and proven ability to work independently and thrive within a dynamic, fast paced and business critical trading environment.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Demonstrated negotiation skills and ability to influence stakeholders to make challenging calls.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Knowledge and experience dealing with the potential risks associated with the bunker category (e.g. HSSE, Ethics &amp; Compliance, supply shortage)<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Proven ability to manage relationship and communicate effectively, proactively, and professionally with regional stakeholders.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> Company Description<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> Shell is one the largest foreign investors in Singapore and began operations in 1891. Today, we have more than 3,200 employees in Singapore alone. The Pulau Bukom Manufacturing Site today is the largest Shell refinery in the world in terms of crude distillation capacity, which makes Singapore a key regional supply and trading centre for Shell in the East. Singapore is the largest petrochemical production and export centre in the Asia Pacific region. Shell Jurong Island (SJI) manufactures petrochemicals to meet the fast-growing demand for these products in the region. We also have one of the largest single-branded retail networks in Singapore, providing customers with a wide range of quality products and services. When you join Shell in Singapore, you can count on our commitment to help you thrive and propel your career by means of our industry-leading development programme and our available and unrivalled pool of local and global experts. Our numerous global and local skill pools as well as our diversity are key to our success and continuing innovation.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> An innovative place to work <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p>There’s never been a more exciting time to work at Shell.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> Join us and you’ll be adding your talent and imagination to a business with the ambition to shape the future – whether by investing in oil, gas, and renewable energy to meet demand, exploring new ways to store energy, or developing technology that helps the world to use energy more efficiently, everyone at Shell does their part.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> An inclusive place to work <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p>To power progress, we need to attract and develop the brightest minds and make sure every voice is heard. Here are just some of the ways we are nurturing an inclusive environment – one where you can express your ideas, extend your skills, and reach your potential.<\u002Fp>\n  <ul>\n   <li><p> We’re creating a space where people with disabilities can excel through transparent recruitment process, workplace adjustments and ongoing support in their roles. Feel free to let us know about your circumstances when you apply, and we’ll take it from there.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> We’re closing the gender gap – whether that’s through action on equal pay or by enabling more women to reach senior roles in engineering and technology.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> We’re striving to be a pioneer of an inclusive and diverse workplace, promoting equality for employees regardless of sexual orientation or gender identity.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> We consider ourselves a flexible employer and want to support you finding the right balance. We encourage you to discuss this with us in your application.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> A rewarding place to work <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p>Combine our creative, collaborative environment and global operations with an impressive range of benefits and joining Shell becomes an inspired career choice.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> We’re huge advocates for career development. We’ll encourage you to try new roles and experience new settings. By pushing people to reach their potential, we frequently help them find skills they never knew they had, or make career moves they never thought possible.<\u002Fp>\n  <br> \n <\u002Fdiv>\n <p><\u002Fp> \n <div>\n  <h3 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><p>Disclaimer <\u002Fp><\u002Fh3>\n  <div>\n   <div>\n    Please note: We occasionally amend or withdraw Shell jobs and reserve the right to do so at any time, including prior to the advertised closing date. The Shell Group and its approved recruitment consultants will never ask you for a fee to process or consider your application for a career with Shell. Anyone who demands such a fee is not an authorised Shell representative and you are strongly advised to refuse any such demand. Shell is an Equal Opportunity Employer.\n   <\u002Fdiv>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n
