<h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b>The Role<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2> \n <div>\n  <p><b>Where you fit in<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p> Refers to the management and engineering of capital projects compliant with agreed business and technical objectives, within schedule and budget, whilst ensuring quality, safe installation, and operation as well as performance to agreed requirements.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> What’s the role? <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p>As Project Engineer, your key accountabilities include the following:<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <ul>\n   <li><p> Having a good understanding of the workflow of the capital project processes and the required deliverables for the various phases of the capital project life cycle.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Driving the development and execution of assigned capital projects in accordance with HSSE requirement, technical specifications, quality requirement within the committed schedule and budget.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Leading and working with the various assigned disciplines engineers and the construction teams to successfully deliver the portfolio of the site capital projects.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Deliver best in class Capital Projects execution in line with Global Manufacturing Standards, Flawless Project Delivery process and Shell Jurong Island’s construction standards. To provide leadership in the capital projects\u002FTA planning and execution to achieve projects\u002FTA premises.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Champion and drive safety aspects of program on all assigned Capital projects. Lead, manage, integrate, develop, execute &amp; deliver all multi-disciplinary capital projects for the site.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Provide leadership and develop project execution strategies\u002Fplans, contracting &amp; procurement strategies and execute all aspects of capital projects from Engineering kick-off till Handover\u002FCloseout. Coordinate constructability reviews and integrate operational \u002F maintenance \u002F human factor aspects in design for all assigned capital projects.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Manage project construction through Site Construction Manager and Site Construction Team or external resources such as Engineering, Procurement and Construction Management (EPCM) contractors. Ensure all aspects of the capital projects field execution comply with relevant local HSSE legislative, ISO14001, OSHA18001 and Shell group requirements.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Champion cost and productivity initiatives by incorporating best practices and learning from previous projects, Turnaround and externally from the industries.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Track and monitor plan\u002Factual project status to ensure timely development, execution, close out including as-built documentation submission. Drive timely report on progress status to customers and stakeholders.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Liaise and work closely with various digitalization initiatives workstream leads to facilitate the utilization of digitalization tools and platforms to improve the efficient execution of capital projects in Shell Jurong Island.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> What we need from you<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p> To succeed in this role, you will have:<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <ul>\n   <li><p> A degree in Mechanical or related Engineering field.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Must have hands-on project or maintenance experience in petrochemical plants or refineries, preferably with 3-5 years relevant experience in project management and execution.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Knowledge and application of planning tools like Primavera P6, MS-Project, Excel, Word, Access, and SAP are essential.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Knowledge or interest in digitalization tools\u002Fprograms; data science architecture and platforms, automation technologies will be desirable.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> Company Description<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p> Shell is one the largest foreign investors in Singapore and began operations in 1891. Today, we have more than 3,200 employees in Singapore alone. The Pulau Bukom Manufacturing Site today is the largest Shell refinery in the world in terms of crude distillation capacity, which makes Singapore a key regional supply and trading centre for Shell in the East. Singapore is the largest petrochemical production and export centre in the Asia Pacific region. Shell Jurong Island (SJI) manufactures petrochemicals to meet the fast-growing demand for these products in the region. We also have one of the largest single-branded retail networks in Singapore, providing customers with a wide range of quality products and services. When you join Shell in Singapore, you can count on our commitment to help you thrive and propel your career by means of our industry-leading development programme and our available and unrivalled pool of local and global experts. Our numerous global and local skill pools as well as our diversity are key to our success and continuing innovation.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> An innovative place to work <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p>There’s never been a more exciting time to work at Shell.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> Join us and you’ll be adding your talent and imagination to a business with the ambition to shape the future – whether by investing in oil, gas, and renewable energy to meet demand, exploring new ways to store energy, or developing technology that helps the world to use energy more efficiently, everyone at Shell does their part.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> An inclusive place to work <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p>To power progress, we need to attract and develop the brightest minds and make sure every voice is heard. Here are just some of the ways we are nurturing an inclusive environment – one where you can express your ideas, extend your skills, and reach your potential.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <ul>\n   <li><p> We’re creating a space where people with disabilities can excel through transparent recruitment process, workplace adjustments and ongoing support in their roles. Feel free to let us know about your circumstances when you apply, and we’ll take it from there.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> We’re closing the gender gap – whether that’s through action on equal pay or by enabling more women to reach senior roles in engineering and technology.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> We’re striving to be a pioneer of an inclusive and diverse workplace, promoting equality for employees regardless of sexual orientation or gender identity.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> We consider ourselves a flexible employer and want to support you finding the right balance. We encourage you to discuss this with us in your application.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> A rewarding place to work <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p>Combine our creative, collaborative environment and global operations with an impressive range of benefits and joining Shell becomes an inspired career choice.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> We’re huge advocates for career development. We’ll encourage you to try new roles and experience new settings. By pushing people to reach their potential, we frequently help them find skills they never knew they had, or make career moves they never thought possible.<\u002Fp>\n  <br> \n <\u002Fdiv>\n <p><\u002Fp> \n <div>\n  <h3 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><p>Disclaimer <\u002Fp><\u002Fh3>\n  <div>\n   <div>\n    Please note: We occasionally amend or withdraw Shell jobs and reserve the right to do so at any time, including prior to the advertised closing date. <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b>The Role<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2> \n <div>\n  <p>Shell Health’s purpose is to empower employees and our business to thrive through care. The world is changing fast, and Shell Health also must change to keep up with the external environment, and the needs of the new Shell organization in delivering the Powering Progress strategy. We enable business outcomes by providing science-based Health expertise and services, developing in Shell, a sustainable culture of care, focused on helping people to be the best that they can be.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> Where you fit in<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p> You are a part of the health team responsible for delivering the health strategy to your key stakeholders – a defined employee population and or a line of business\u002Ffunction. This also includes ensuring compliance with local legislation as well as being customer centric. You provide occupational health nursing input and professional guidance. This will be through leveraging the Shell Health core competencies of health expertise, science, collaboration, and business intimacy.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> What’s the role? <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p>As the Occupational Health Nurse for Bukom Singapore, you will be entrusted with the following:<\u002Fp>\n  <ul>\n   <li><p> You work through Shell Health protocols and processes to deliver agreed KPIs working autonomously most of the time, whilst learning from others and sharing best practice across Shell Health.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Informs management about outcome measures and recognize when to escalate information to more experienced Shell Health staff.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Dealing with general health and occupational health enquiries and signposting to the appropriate resource to guide key internal stakeholders on basic health information.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Promote and implement all Shell Health activities and programs to your population to improve their physical, mental, and social health through structured care program.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> When faced with business issues and requests, first leverages existing expertise from the asset class specialists.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Maintain and manage all records relating to occupational health nursing issues.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Provide medical treatment to eligible employees with injuries and or illnesses, including during the performance of Medical Standby Duties (after office hours, weekends, and public holidays) and attend to emergencies as well as taking charge of the clinic after office hours.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Carry out the medical treatment within the scope of training and experience as directed by the Bukom Refinery Health Advisor and the Occupation Health Nurse Practitioner.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Carry out Industrial Hygiene duties within the scope of training and experience as directed by the Bukom Refinery Health Advisor and the Bukom Industrial Hygienist.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Participate and contribute positively in HSSE Assurance Audits\u002FWalkabout by Factory Safety Committee and Bukom Leadership Team, including:<\u002Fp>\n    <ul>\n     <li><p> Canteen\u002Ffood and drinking water safety inspections.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n     <li><p> Site’s Drug and Alcohol Program and testing.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n     <li><p> Site’s Worker Welfare Program.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n    <\u002Ful><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Participate in duties related to Occupational and Public Health (NEA\u002FMOM Officers inspection\u002Fauditing Bukom).<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Assist and support in organising campaigns to enhance health awareness at business unit.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Maintain and ensure proper filing and maintenance of Medical and Administrative Records of Bukom Medical Department.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Plan, organize and conduct continuous trainings in First Aid Response Skills for designated First Aiders as necessary.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Plan, organize and perform Statutory Medical Examination for chemical hazard exposure including (but not limited to) Benzene and to submit the required reports to Ministry of Manpower.<\u002Fp>\n    <ul>\n     <li><p> In conjunction with the above, to incorporate the use of OneHealthIT tool so as to provide reassurance for the medical surveillance and bio monitoring of (but not limited to) Benzene to workers in line with Shell requirements.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n    <\u002Ful><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Plan, organize and perform audiometric Screening Tests for employees for noise exposure and to submit the required reports to Ministry of Manpower.<\u002Fp>\n    <ul>\n     <li><p> In conjunction with the above, to incorporate the use of OneHealthIT tool so as to provide reassurance for the medical surveillance and audiometry to workers in line with Shell requirements for noise monitoring.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n    <\u002Ful><\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> What we need from you<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p> The successful candidate will have the following:<\u002Fp>\n  <ul>\n   <li><p> A Nurse with Occupational Health qualification recognized by the relevant professional body.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Current licenses that are relevant to the practice and performance of the duties within the country\u002Flocation.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Driving license is a must. Please indicate in your resume if you hold a class 3 license.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Experience working as a staff nurse from A&amp;E department or a paramedic from Singapore Civil Defense Force (SCDF).<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> Below are added advantage experience\u002Fskills are good to have but not a must:<\u002Fp>\n  <ul>\n   <li><p> Significant experience of developing and implementing work setting evaluations, with occupational health standard.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Demonstration of ongoing learning and continuous professional development. HAZMAT Basic Provider Course, PHTLS and\u002For BCLS+AED (Instructor preferable) or equivalent.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Previous clinical experience relevant to this role. Industrial Hygiene Technician competence is a bonus to have but not a must have.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Able to work with clinical data to analyze outcomes and trends. Presentation skills desirable but can be developed in role.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Demonstrate a learner mindset, fostering inclusivity and psychological safety to identify improvement opportunities and innovation and efficient ways of working.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Good team player who can engage and inspire colleagues and stakeholders. Good communication skills- written and spoken.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Demonstrated ability to collaborate (business partnering) and integrate across boundaries to maximize value for Shell as a whole. Able to prioritize and shows courage to identify improvement opportunities and challenge lower value work.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Continuously looks for opportunities to learn from and leverage best practices<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> Company description<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p> Shell is one the largest foreign investors in Singapore and began operations in 1891. Today, we have more than 3,200 employees in Singapore alone. The Pulau Bukom Manufacturing Site today is the largest Shell refinery in the world in terms of crude distillation capacity, which makes Singapore a key regional supply and trading centre for Shell in the East. Singapore is the largest petrochemical production and export centre in the Asia Pacific region. Shell Jurong Island (SJI) manufactures petrochemicals to meet the fast-growing demand for these products in the region. We also have one of the largest single-branded retail networks in Singapore, providing customers with a wide range of quality products and services. When you join Shell in Singapore, you can count on our commitment to help you thrive and propel your career by means of our industry-leading development programme and our available and unrivalled pool of local and global experts. Our numerous global and local skill pools as well as our diversity are key to our success and continuing innovation.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><b><br> An innovative place to work <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p>There’s never been a more exciting time to work at Shell.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> Join us and you’ll be adding your talent and imagination to a business with the ambition to shape the future – whether by investing in oil, gas and renewable energy to meet demand, exploring new ways to store energy, or developing technology that helps the world to use energy more efficiently, everyone at Shell does their part.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> An inclusive place to work <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p>To power progress, we need to attract and develop the brightest minds and make sure every voice is heard. Here are just some of the ways we are nurturing an inclusive environment – one where you can express your ideas, extend your skills, and reach your potential.<\u002Fp>\n  <ul>\n   <li><p> We’re creating a space where people with disabilities can excel through transparent recruitment process, workplace adjustments and ongoing support in their roles. Feel free to let us know about your circumstances when you apply, and we’ll take it from there.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> We’re closing the gender gap – whether that’s through action on equal pay or by enabling more women to reach senior roles in engineering and technology.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> We’re striving to be a pioneer of an inclusive and diverse workplace, promoting equality for employees regardless of sexual orientation or gender identity.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> We consider ourselves a flexible employer and want to support you finding the right balance. We encourage you to discuss this with us in your application.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> A rewarding place to work <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p>Combine our creative, collaborative environment and global operations with an impressive range of benefits and joining Shell becomes an inspired career choice.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> We’re huge advocates for career development. We’ll encourage you to try new roles and experience new settings. By pushing people to reach their potential, we frequently help them find skills they never knew they had, or make career moves they never thought possible.<\u002Fp>\n  <br> \n <\u002Fdiv>\n <p><\u002Fp> \n <div>\n  <h3 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><p>Disclaimer <\u002Fp><\u002Fh3>\n  <div>\n   <div>\n    Please note: We occasionally amend or withdraw Shell jobs and reserve the right to do so at any time, including prior to the advertised closing date. <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b>The Role<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2> \n <p><\u002Fp>\n <div>\n  <p><b>Where you fit in<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p> Within the job family of B2B\u002FB2C Aviation, a range of Commercial positions can be found such as Strategy: which aims to provide expert problem-solving and project management support for the highest priority strategic issues.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> Shell Aircraft and the Air Transport Network apply the very best of aviation (to Shell) and, together with our Supply Chain and SEAM partners, enable Shell’s global operations through safe, secure and efficient Aviation solutions. The links below will guide you to the relevant standards, guidance and information, but please contact any member of our staff if you have any questions or require further support.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> What’s the role? <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p>The Operations Supervisor is directly responsible for ensuring safe and efficient day-to-day (shift by shift) operation at the airport and shall report any changes proposed by Changi Airport Group \u002F Airlines or any other authorities that might affect the operations.<\u002Fp>\n  <p> You will thrive in:<\u002Fp>\n  <ul>\n   <li><p> Deliver Goal Zero at the site<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Implement Continuous Improvement tools on the site<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> The Supervisor shall be thoroughly familiar with and follow regulations \u002F instructions issued by governmental or other authorities.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> The Supervisor shall ensure that the procedures specified in SAOM (Shell Aviation Operations Manual) are understood and carried out correctly and that the appropriate records are prepared and maintained by him.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> The Supervisor shall ensure that the other staffs in his shift are advised of their complete range of responsibilities and supervise \u002F guide them to a high standard operation.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Ensure that both he and his staff fully understand and comply with the Shell Aviation HSSE Policies, Objectives, KPIs, Targets and Performance. To ensure full compliance with policies by the team as well as visitors.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> More specifically, you will be accountable for the following:<\u002Fp>\n  <p> Airport Operations:<\u002Fp>\n  <ul>\n   <li><p> Ensure all activities within area of responsibility are performed according to SAOM (Shell Aviation Operations Manual) and HSSE standards.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Ensure that all staff and contractors are clear on their responsibilities, authorities, and work requirements prior to undertaking work.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Regularly train &amp; coach operators in Shell standard aviation operating and safety \u002Fsecurity procedures and ensure that aircraft fuelling is carried out in accordance with these procedures<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Coordinate with the maintenance team for ensuring that aviation fuelling equipment (fixed\u002Fmobile) is well maintained and in good working condition. Report all vehicle defects, accidents, and incidents, hazard reporting.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Zero aircraft delay \u002F complaint performance. To reply to such enquiry within 48hrs upon receiving of e mail from customer.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Share the safety information, technical bulletins with staff on a regular basis.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Overview of stock\u002Fsales control on a daily basis done by the Operations Shift Team Lead.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Ensure correct vehicle meter reconciliation daily.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Ensure Right First Time Approach in terms of entry for correct customer billing.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Providing support for Delivery Receipts for customer upon request and ensure that timely corrections are done prior to final billing.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Maintain the duty roster and provide guidance to the Operations Shift Team Lead in manpower distribution according to the aircraft movement and resource available at the most optimal level.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Support the Airport Manager and Country Operations Manager on projects or tasks assigned.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n  <p> HSSE:<\u002Fp>\n  <ul>\n   <li><p> Maintain Goal Zero of No harm and No Leak.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Promote a generative HSSE culture through team engagement and support self-reporting through Near Miss and Potential Incident<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Conduct regular Observation on Tarmac (Go See) in every shift to coach and provide guidance to operators in HSSE Compliance and Operation Excellence through Learning Mindset.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Responsible for all aspects of safety and security within the site during the shift, including prompt reporting as per guidelines and taking corrective action.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Provide assistance in any incidents in terms of investigation.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Implement and maintain HSSE control framework within area of responsibility<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> What we need from you<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p> We are keen to speak to professionals with the following:<\u002Fp>\n  <ul>\n   <li><p> Diploma holder preferably in mechanical \u002F Electrical \u002F Aviation or related qualitications<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Previous experience in operational or maintenance roles, preferably in Aviation<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Supervisory experience will be an added advantage<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Heavy goods vehicle license of at least Class 3 (Class 4 is an advantage).<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Strong communication and leadership skills with the ability to influence people’s mindsets and behaviours.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Detailed knowledge of hazards and risks involved in activities being undertaken and an overall understanding of HSSE management systems \u002F control framework requirements.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Strong organizational and time management skills.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> More about Shell in Singapore<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p> Shell is one the largest foreign investors in Singapore and began operations in 1891. Today, we have more than 3,200 employees in Singapore alone. The Pulau Bukom Manufacturing Site today is the largest Shell refinery in the world in terms of crude distillation capacity, which makes Singapore a key regional supply and trading centre for Shell in the East. Singapore is the largest petrochemical production and export centre in the Asia Pacific region. Shell Jurong Island (SJI) manufactures petrochemicals to meet the fast-growing demand for these products in the region. We also have one of the largest single-branded retail networks in Singapore, providing customers with a wide range of quality products and services. When you join Shell in Singapore, you can count on our commitment to help you thrive and propel your career by means of our industry-leading development programme and our available and unrivalled pool of local and global experts. Our numerous global and local skill pools as well as our diversity are key to our success and continuing innovation.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><b><br> An innovative place to work <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p>There’s never been a more exciting time to work at Shell.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> Join us and you’ll be adding your talent and imagination to a business with the ambition to shape the future – whether by investing in oil, gas and renewable energy to meet demand, exploring new ways to store energy, or developing technology that helps the world to use energy more efficiently, everyone at Shell does their part.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> An inclusive place to work <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p>To power progress, we need to attract and develop the brightest minds and make sure every voice is heard. Here are just some of the ways we are nurturing an inclusive environment – one where you can express your ideas, extend your skills, and reach your potential.<\u002Fp>\n  <ul>\n   <li><p> We’re creating a space where people with disabilities can excel through transparent recruitment process, workplace adjustments and ongoing support in their roles. Feel free to let us know about your circumstances when you apply, and we’ll take it from there.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> We’re closing the gender gap – whether that’s through action on equal pay or by enabling more women to reach senior roles in engineering and technology.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> We’re striving to be a pioneer of an inclusive and diverse workplace, promoting equality for employees regardless of sexual orientation or gender identity.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> We consider ourselves a flexible employer and want to support you finding the right balance. We encourage you to discuss this with us in your application.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> A rewarding place to work <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p>Combine our creative, collaborative environment and global operations with an impressive range of benefits and joining Shell becomes an inspired career choice.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> We’re huge advocates for career development. We’ll encourage you to try new roles and experience new settings. By pushing people to reach their potential, we frequently help them find skills they never knew they had, or make career moves they never thought possible.<\u002Fp>\n  <br> \n <\u002Fdiv>\n <p><\u002Fp> \n <div>\n  <h3 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><p>Disclaimer <\u002Fp><\u002Fh3>\n  <div>\n   <div>\n    Please note: We occasionally amend or withdraw Shell jobs and reserve the right to do so at any time, including prior to the advertised closing date. <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b>The Role<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2> \n <div>\n  <p><b>Where you fit in <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p>Instrument Technician resides in Shell Jurong Island (SJI) Maintenance Department.<\u002Fp>\n  <p> The primary role is to execute instrument maintenance to the optimum level of performance for safe, reliable and efficient operation of the plant.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> Instrument technicians are to provide hands on maintenance including all assets under SJI or maintained by SJI. Manage contractors’ staff to provide a safe, cost-effective and efficient day-to-day maintenance services on instruments.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> What’s the role? <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <ul>\n   <li>Compliance to HSSE standards and requirements to make Shell Jurong Island (SJI) a safe place to work, and accountable for all assigned Critical activities.<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Perform Authorized Applicant as per SJI ePermit to Work (ePTW) requirement.<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Drive high standard of personal accountability &amp; performance to deliver the Site &amp; Department goals and target.<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Execute and supervise day-to-day maintenance activities including contractor\u002Fspecialist management as assigned from end-to-end basis to enable high equipment reliability &amp; plant availability. Update maintenance records, investigation findings &amp; prepare relevant reports<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Provide feedback on effectiveness of planning for the Corrective and preventive maintenance for site reliability improvement. Support in Bad actors management.<\u002Fli>\n   <li> In order to ensure SJI’s assets operate safely &amp; reliably, without suffering any process safety incident or causing life-changing events to person(s), the staff is accountable to ensure compliance to those Critical Activities assigned for the Job Position.<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Provide support for Turnaround execution in related Process Units (PUs).<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Plan and execute instrumentation related works depending on the technician level (L6 – L9).<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Have some QMI experience such as the ability to explain the operating principle of a simple QMI analyzers eg: PH, TOC, Conductivity.<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Use Computerized Maintenance Management System (CMMS) in compliance with the global maintenance and business processes.<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Attend standby callout to the Emergency work upon request.<\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n  <br> \n  <p><\u002Fp> \n <\u002Fdiv>\n <p><\u002Fp> \n <div>\n  <h3 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><p>Translated Company Description <\u002Fp><\u002Fh3>\n  <div>\n   <div>\n    <p><b>What we need from you<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n    <p><b> Educational Qualifications<\u002Fb>:<\u002Fp>\n    <p> Diploma\u002FITE or equivalent.<\u002Fp>\n    <p><\u002Fp>\n    <p><b> Professional Experience<\u002Fb>:<\u002Fp>\n    <p> Minimum 2 years petrochemical refinery experience as Instrument Technician or equivalent.<\u002Fp>\n    <p><\u002Fp>\n    <p><b> Company Description<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n    <p><b> Shell <\u002Fb>is one the largest foreign investors in Singapore and began operations in 1891. Today, we have more than 3,200 employees in Singapore alone. The Pulau Bukom Manufacturing Site today is the largest Shell refinery in the world in terms of crude distillation capacity, which makes Singapore a key regional supply and trading centre for Shell in the East. Singapore is the largest petrochemical production and export centre in the Asia Pacific region. Shell Jurong Island (SJI) manufactures petrochemicals to meet the fast-growing demand for these products in the region. We also have one of the largest single-branded retail networks in Singapore, providing customers with a wide range of quality products and services. When you join Shell in Singapore, you can count on our commitment to help you thrive and propel your career by means of our industry-leading development programme and our available and unrivalled pool of local and global experts. Our numerous global and local skill pools as well as our diversity are key to our success and continuing innovation.<\u002Fp>\n    <p><\u002Fp>\n    <p><b> An innovative place to work <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n    <p>There’s never been a more exciting time to work at Shell.<\u002Fp>\n    <p><\u002Fp>\n    <p> Join us and you’ll be adding your talent and imagination to a business with the ambition to shape the future – whether by investing in oil, gas, and renewable energy to meet demand, exploring new ways to store energy, or developing technology that helps the world to use energy more efficiently, everyone at Shell does their part.<\u002Fp>\n    <p><\u002Fp>\n    <p><b> An inclusive place to work <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n    <p>To power progress, we need to attract and develop the brightest minds and make sure every voice is heard. Here are just some of the ways we are nurturing an inclusive environment – one where you can express your ideas, extend your skills, and reach your potential.<\u002Fp>\n    <p><\u002Fp>\n    <ul>\n     <li> We’re creating a space where people with disabilities can excel through transparent recruitment process, workplace adjustments and ongoing support in their roles. Feel free to let us know about your circumstances when you apply, and we’ll take it from there.<\u002Fli>\n     <li> We’re closing the gender gap – whether that’s through action on equal pay or by enabling more women to reach senior roles in engineering and technology.<\u002Fli>\n     <li> We’re striving to be a pioneer of an inclusive and diverse workplace, promoting equality for employees regardless of sexual orientation or gender identity.<\u002Fli>\n     <li> We consider ourselves a flexible employer and want to support you finding the right balance. We encourage you to discuss this with us in your application.<\u002Fli>\n    <\u002Ful>\n    <p><\u002Fp>\n    <p><b> A rewarding place to work <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n    <p>Combine our creative, collaborative environment and global operations with an impressive range of benefits and joining Shell becomes an inspired career choice.<\u002Fp>\n    <p><\u002Fp>\n    <p> We’re huge advocates for career development. We’ll encourage you to try new roles and experience new settings. By pushing people to reach their potential, we frequently help them find skills they never knew they had, or make career moves they never thought possible.<\u002Fp>\n   <\u002Fdiv> \n  <\u002Fdiv>\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n  <h3 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><p>Disclaimer <\u002Fp><\u002Fh3>\n  <div>\n   <div>\n    Please note: We occasionally amend or withdraw Shell jobs and reserve the right to do so at any time, including prior to the advertised closing date. <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b>The Role<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2> \n <div>\n  <p><b>What’s the role? <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p>As Learning Advisor, you will be part of our team in Shell Jurong Island. And we’ll entrust you to:<\u002Fp>\n  <ul>\n   <li><p> Ensure alignment with, and contribution to the global learning strategy and agenda to deliver top-quartile learning via tactical planning &amp; execution with internal\u002Fexternal stakeholders through<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Function as Learning Advisor to site’s Functional Support such as Finance, HR, HR Learning, CP, IT, Business Excellence and Health.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Conduct onboarding program for new joiner.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Manage the Learning record analysis and tracking compliance in WorkDay Learning.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Strategize the approach to manage training gap closure with the relevant stakeholder to achieve compliance of &gt;98% at the site population of about 520.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Be the Lead site focal for WorkDay (WD) (Learning Management System) with provision of advice and solution the site on competency training mapping with Alternate Roles in collaboration with internal stakeholders.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Be responsible for assuring that LMS (Learning Management System), LCMS (Learning Content Management System), Power BI and features of WD including Alt-Role assignment to individual at site are used effectively to manage, deliver, track and report training compliance\u002Frequirement.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Manage LNA (Learning Needs Analysis) for site and ensuring relevant training are delivered\u002Foffered for gap closure.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Contribute to joint-up HR at site &amp; country level programme and engagement.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Track site Training budget in accordance with the training budget set on annual basis.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Be the FAM (Fountain Assurance Management) Focal for HR Learning and to ensure action closure to meet the stipulated deadline.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Manage external training provider and Government for training grant amounting to about $100,000 per annum.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> On\u002Foffboard interns for whole site<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Member of ICP Support Unit<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Focal of Do It Right The First Time, Drift project.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Process payment requests to training vendors and caterers.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Support the course attendance of participants from registration to completion including collection of certificates where applicable.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Admin support for HR &amp; LS visitors to SJI, or gifts, mails, etc.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Where required, support Bukom Learning with the last 3 abovementioned bullets.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Facilitate courses, e.g. FrontLine Barrier Management Assessor course<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Any other responsibilities assigned by LS Manager.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> What we need from you<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p> You must have\u002Fbe:<\u002Fp>\n  <ul>\n   <li><p> Familiar with Microsoft tools e.g. Teams, Excel, Power BI etc<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Familiar with GSAP systems to process invoices, purchase requisition and order.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Knowledge of Learning Management system WD.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Knowledge of Chemicals and Products Front Line Barrier Management.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Experienced in coordinating teams and\u002For projects.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Demonstrated communication, facilitation, and coaching\u002Fmentoring skills.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Resilience and persistence in driving change and achieving business results.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> The ability to influence and work effectively with multiple Stakeholders.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> Company Description<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p> Shell is one the largest foreign investors in Singapore and began operations in 1891. Today, we have more than 3,200 employees in Singapore alone. The Pulau Bukom Manufacturing Site today is the largest Shell refinery in the world in terms of crude distillation capacity, which makes Singapore a key regional supply and trading centre for Shell in the East. Singapore is the largest petrochemical production and export centre in the Asia Pacific region. Shell Jurong Island (SJI) manufactures petrochemicals to meet the fast-growing demand for these products in the region. We also have one of the largest single-branded retail networks in Singapore, providing customers with a wide range of quality products and services. When you join Shell in Singapore, you can count on our commitment to help you thrive and propel your career by means of our industry-leading development programme and our available and unrivalled pool of local and global experts. Our numerous global and local skill pools as well as our diversity are key to our success and continuing innovation.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> An innovative place to work <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p>There’s never been a more exciting time to work at Shell.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> Join us and you’ll be adding your talent and imagination to a business with the ambition to shape the future – whether by investing in oil, gas, and renewable energy to meet demand, exploring new ways to store energy, or developing technology that helps the world to use energy more efficiently, everyone at Shell does their part.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> An inclusive place to work <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p>To power progress, we need to attract and develop the brightest minds and make sure every voice is heard. Here are just some of the ways we are nurturing an inclusive environment – one where you can express your ideas, extend your skills, and reach your potential.<\u002Fp>\n  <ul>\n   <li><p> We’re creating a space where people with disabilities can excel through transparent recruitment process, workplace adjustments and ongoing support in their roles. Feel free to let us know about your circumstances when you apply, and we’ll take it from there.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> We’re closing the gender gap – whether that’s through action on equal pay or by enabling more women to reach senior roles in engineering and technology.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> We’re striving to be a pioneer of an inclusive and diverse workplace, promoting equality for employees regardless of sexual orientation or gender identity.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> We consider ourselves a flexible employer and want to support you finding the right balance. We encourage you to discuss this with us in your application.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> A rewarding place to work <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p>Combine our creative, collaborative environment and global operations with an impressive range of benefits and joining Shell becomes an inspired career choice.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> We’re huge advocates for career development. We’ll encourage you to try new roles and experience new settings. By pushing people to reach their potential, we frequently help them find skills they never knew they had, or make career moves they never thought possible.<\u002Fp>\n  <br> \n <\u002Fdiv>\n <p><\u002Fp> \n <div>\n  <h3 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><p>Disclaimer <\u002Fp><\u002Fh3>\n  <div>\n   <div>\n    Please note: We occasionally amend or withdraw Shell jobs and reserve the right to do so at any time, including prior to the advertised closing date. <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b>The Role<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2> \n <div>\n  <p><b>Where you fit in?<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p> The Trading &amp; Supply (T&amp;S) Monitoring &amp; Surveillance (M&amp;S) team has global responsibility for the monitoring &amp; surveillance of the trading practices and business communications in T&amp;S.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> The Specialist M&amp;S reports into the Senior Regional Specialist M&amp;S and is based in the regional hub.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> What’s the role? <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p>The successful candidate will manage monitoring &amp; surveillance of activities related to specialist product\u002Fmarket area(s), investigating potentially suspicious activity from initial escalation through to resolution. The Specialist will also act as SME in chosen product\u002Fmarket area(s), supporting investigations related to these products, upskilling the team, and actively identifying ways to improve the coverage, effectiveness or efficiency of surveillance undertaken, based on strong understanding of the product\u002Fmarket area(s) and associated risks and regulations.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> The Specialist will also be expected to:<\u002Fp>\n  <ul>\n   <li> Conduct investigation of escalated trading activity, business communications or transactions based on automated alerts, leveraging a strong understanding of market dynamics and a wide range of risks and how they may manifest, to assess for potential market integrity, compliance risk or financial crime.<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Act as SMEs for position limit monitoring undertaken by Analysts and assist with exemptions, account mapping and breach escalations.<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Take ownership of the escalated alerts and conduct level 2 investigation into suspicious activities. Ensuring escalations follow the M&amp;S processes including peer review and team leadership oversight, analysis is completed in a timely and quality manner, assessing whether all avenues have been explored to make the correct determination.<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Assist and provide feedback to Analysts on alert escalations and provide weekly reporting and metrics to management.<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Conduct quality assurance on closed level 1 alerts, assessing that M&amp;S processes have been followed and analysis is of sufficient quality, with the right decisions being reached. Provide feedback and training to Analysts as required.<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Periodically assess and managed the monitored population.<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Proactively review trends and emerging risks\u002Fregulations against existing monitoring to assess current coverage and risk areas requiring additional monitoring.<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Lead targeted monitoring of individuals, desks or transactions based on trigger events, including analysis of trading and communications activities and other available data points, to assess for potential market integrity or other compliance risks, focusing on high-risk and high-complexity areas, while supporting targeted monitoring by Analysts.<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Support Regional Senior Specialists in producing analysis and documentation of information required for Suspicious Transaction and Order Reports (STOR) filings, investigations, and Request for Information (RFI) responses.<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Identify and lead changes to surveillance process and automated alerting to drive effectiveness or efficiency improvements, based on market and risk understanding.<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Support compliance change projects as an SME in specific product area, providing insight into requirements and testing.<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Lead training for M&amp;S team in specialist product\u002Fmarket or risk areas.<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Continually enhance specialist product area knowledge and deep understanding of market integrity risks. Proactively develop insight into chosen area and continually look for ways to improve surveillance coverage.<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Work collaboratively with the other Specialists in the region to deliver as one team. Liaise also with Specialist in other regions to share knowledge and learnings.<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Liaise with and seek advice from Compliance Advisory and other Compliance SMEs as required.<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Liaise with business stakeholders as required.<\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <div>\n   <div>\n    <div>\n     <p><b> What we need from you?<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n     <p><\u002Fp>\n     <p> We are keen to hear from candidates with the following experience:<\u002Fp>\n     <ul>\n      <li><b> Monitoring and Trade Surveillance:<\u002Fb> Proficient understanding of market integrity risks and how they would manifest themselves across Oil and Energy markets based on strong knowledge of previous cases<\u002Fli>\n      <li><b> Regulatory Landscape Insight:<\u002Fb> Proficient understanding of market integrity, compliance and financial crime regulations and expectations and the ability to apply these to assess whether the firm’s activities are in line with regulations\u002Fexpectations.<\u002Fli>\n      <li><b> Market and Product Knowledge:<\u002Fb> Advanced understanding of oil and energy products and how they trade, including physical markets logistics (covering multiple product areas), and therefore the ability to identify unusual behaviours across complex activities.<\u002Fli>\n      <li><b> Data Manipulation and Analysis:<\u002Fb> Desirable: Proficient data manipulation and analytical skills allowing for large data sets to be assessed in order to identify trending and outliers to support investigations into trading activities.<\u002Fli>\n      <li><b> Core Soft Skills:<\u002Fb> Proficient communication and collaboration skills, demonstrating the ability to set the right tone and relay information succinctly and\u002For persuasively to get tasks completed in a timely manner. Advanced business analysis and report writing skills to process information, make critical judgements and present findings in a clear and concise manner.<\u002Fli>\n     <\u002Ful>\n     <p><\u002Fp>\n     <p><b> About Shell Singapore<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n     <p> Shell is one the largest foreign investors in Singapore and began operations in 1891. Today, we have more than 3,200 employees in Singapore alone. The Pulau Bukom Manufacturing Site today is the largest Shell refinery in the world in terms of crude distillation capacity, which makes Singapore a key regional supply and trading centre for Shell in the East. Singapore is the largest petrochemical production and export centre in the Asia Pacific region. Shell Jurong Island (SJI) manufactures petrochemicals to meet the fast-growing demand for these products in the region. We also have one of the largest single-branded retail networks in Singapore, providing customers with a wide range of quality products and services. When you join Shell in Singapore, you can count on our commitment to help you thrive and propel your career by means of our industry-leading development programme and our available and unrivalled pool of local and global experts. Our numerous global and local skill pools as well as our diversity are key to our success and continuing innovation.<\u002Fp>\n     <p><\u002Fp>\n     <p><b> An innovative place to work <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n     <p>There’s never been a more exciting time to work at Shell. Everyone here is helping solve one of the biggest challenges facing the world today: bringing the benefits of energy to everyone on the planet, whilst managing the risks of climate change.<\u002Fp>\n     <p><\u002Fp>\n     <p> Join us and you’ll be adding your talent and imagination to a business with the ambition to shape the future – whether by investing in renewables, exploring new ways to store energy, or developing technology that helps the world to use energy more efficiently, everyone at Shell does their part.<\u002Fp>\n     <p><\u002Fp>\n     <p><b> An inclusive place to work <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n     <p>To power progress together, we need to attract and develop the brightest minds and make sure every voice is heard. Here are just some of the ways we are nurturing an inclusive environment – one where you can express your ideas, extend your skills, and reach your potential…<\u002Fp>\n     <ul>\n      <li> We’re creating a space where people with disabilities can excel through transparent recruitment process, workplace adjustments and ongoing support in their roles. Feel free to let us know about your circumstances when you apply, and we’ll take it from there.<\u002Fli>\n      <li> We’re closing the gender gap – whether that’s through action on equal pay or by enabling more women to reach senior roles in engineering and technology.<\u002Fli>\n      <li> We’re striving to be a pioneer of an inclusive and diverse workplace, promoting equality for employees regardless of sexual orientation or gender identity.<\u002Fli>\n      <li> We consider ourselves a flexible employer and want to support you finding the right balance. We encourage you to discuss this with us in your application.<\u002Fli>\n     <\u002Ful>\n     <p><\u002Fp>\n     <p><b> A rewarding place to work <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n     <p>Combine our creative, collaborative environment and global operations with an impressive range of benefits and joining Shell becomes an inspired career choice.<\u002Fp>\n     <p><\u002Fp>\n     <p> We’re huge advocates for career development. We’ll encourage you to try new roles and experience new settings. By pushing people to reach their potential, we frequently help them find skills they never knew they had, or make career moves they never thought possible.<\u002Fp>\n    <\u002Fdiv>\n   <\u002Fdiv>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <br> \n <\u002Fdiv>\n <p><\u002Fp> \n <div>\n  <h3 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><p>Disclaimer <\u002Fp><\u002Fh3>\n  <div>\n   <div>\n    Please note: We occasionally amend or withdraw Shell jobs and reserve the right to do so at any time, including prior to the advertised closing date. The Shell Group and its approved recruitment consultants will never ask you for a fee to process or consider your application for a career with Shell. Anyone who demands such a fee is not an authorised Shell representative and you are strongly advised to refuse any such demand. Shell is an Equal Opportunity Employer.\n   <\u002Fdiv>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b>The Role<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2> \n <div>\n  <p><b>Where you fit in<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p> Provide technical support in corrosion and materials issues (e.g. RBI - Risk Based Inspection, CCDs – Corrosion Control Documents, IOWs – Integrity Operating Windows, MOCs – Management of Change and failure analysis) to work effectively in a team environment. This typically includes close working with Mechanical Static &amp; Inspection Engineers, along with multiple other site support staff in Process Engineering, Operations, Maintenance, Turnaround and Major Projects.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> What’s the role? <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p>As Materials &amp; Corrosion Engineer, your key accountabilities include the following:<\u002Fp>\n  <ul>\n   <li><p> Provide proactive technical support on issues related to corrosion mechanisms, corrosion control, inspection techniques\u002Feffectiveness and metallurgy for plant changes, and new projects.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Provide material selection and technical support to assist process engineers, operations specialists, and Inspection Engineers in day-to-day activities related to metallurgy, welding, and corrosion control.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Accountable for scheduled RBI re-assessments and OTR (On The Run) upkeep of RBI for individual equipment. Working with Inspection Engineers to develop and integrate recommendations into piping and equipment inspection strategies and active schedules.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Regular monitoring of identified IOWs (Integrity Operating Windows) within the process units that may affect degradation of Pressure Equipment. Make recommendations based on deviations from IOW limits. Update any IOWs using the site MOC process including Ensure Safe Production (ESP) work process.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Provide technical input to chemical inhibitor programs, boiler feed water, and cooling water treatment programs, and other chemical treatment programs.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Assist in performing root cause analysis, coordinate failure analysis activities, and recommend mitigation methods for corrosion and materials issues, including repair strategies and replacement decisions.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Network with other Corrosion &amp; Materials Engineers in Shell or professional organizations to learn from, share location experiences, assist in review and improvement of Shell’s documents and procedures.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> What we need from you<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p> To succeed in this role, you will have:<\u002Fp>\n  <ul>\n   <li><p> Bachelor’s degree in Engineering, Chemistry, or Material Science.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Minimum 3-5 years of relevant work experience.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Preferred experience in the field of metallurgy and\u002For corrosion control\u002Fmitigation Energy industry.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Candidate must possess excellent communication, analytical, and problem-solving skills and have the ability to work with people and facilitate small teams to deliver a specific task (e.g. root cause investigation).<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Knowledge of plant processes, damage mechanisms, and material properties.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Knowledge of RBI process for Pressure Equipment.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Knowledge of Pressure Equipment design principles and applicable repair techniques.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Knowledge of NDT (Non-Destructive Testing) techniques including selection for specific damage mechanisms.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Self-starter who can set own goals and direction with minimal supervision.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> Company Description<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p> Shell is one the largest foreign investors in Singapore and began operations in 1891. Today, we have more than 3,200 employees in Singapore alone. Shell Jurong Island (SJI) manufactures petrochemicals to meet the fast-growing demand for these products in the region. The Pulau Bukom Manufacturing Site today is the largest Shell refinery in the world in terms of crude distillation capacity, which makes Singapore a key regional supply and trading centre for Shell in the East. Singapore is the largest petrochemical production and export centre in the Asia Pacific region. We also have one of the largest single-branded retail networks in Singapore, providing customers with a wide range of quality products and services. When you join Shell in Singapore, you can count on our commitment to help you thrive and propel your career by means of our industry-leading development programme and our available and unrivalled pool of local and global experts. Our numerous global and local skill pools as well as our diversity are key to our success and continuing innovation.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> An innovative place to work <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p>There’s never been a more exciting time to work at Shell.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> Join us and you’ll be adding your talent and imagination to a business with the ambition to shape the future – whether by investing in oil, gas, and renewable energy to meet demand, exploring new ways to store energy, or developing technology that helps the world to use energy more efficiently, everyone at Shell does their part.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> An inclusive place to work <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p>To power progress, we need to attract and develop the brightest minds and make sure every voice is heard. Here are just some of the ways we are nurturing an inclusive environment – one where you can express your ideas, extend your skills, and reach your potential.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <ul>\n   <li><p> We’re creating a space where people with disabilities can excel through transparent recruitment process, workplace adjustments and ongoing support in their roles. Feel free to let us know about your circumstances when you apply, and we’ll take it from there.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> We’re closing the gender gap – whether that’s through action on equal pay or by enabling more women to reach senior roles in engineering and technology.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> We’re striving to be a pioneer of an inclusive and diverse workplace, promoting equality for employees regardless of sexual orientation or gender identity.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> We consider ourselves a flexible employer and want to support you finding the right balance. We encourage you to discuss this with us in your application.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> A rewarding place to work <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p>Combine our creative, collaborative environment and global operations with an impressive range of benefits and joining Shell becomes an inspired career choice.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> We’re huge advocates for career development. We’ll encourage you to try new roles and experience new settings. By pushing people to reach their potential, we frequently help them find skills they never knew they had, or make career moves they never thought possible.<\u002Fp>\n  <br> \n <\u002Fdiv>\n <p><\u002Fp> \n <div>\n  <h3 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><p>Disclaimer <\u002Fp><\u002Fh3>\n  <div>\n   <div>\n    Please note: We occasionally amend or withdraw Shell jobs and reserve the right to do so at any time, including prior to the advertised closing date. Anyone who demands such a fee is not an authorised Shell representative and you are strongly advised to refuse any such demand. <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b>The Role<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2> \n <div>\n  <p><b>What’s the role? <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p>As a Cost Engineer, your key accountabilities include the following:<\u002Fp>\n  <ul>\n   <li><p> Develop Projects, Maintenance &amp; Turnaround Event budgets (CAPEX &amp; OPEX), implement cost controls and responsible for its forecast at completion for all phases.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Provide Cost support to the Maintenance Turnaround Construction (MTAC) group and Project Group.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> More specifically, your accountabilities include the following: Must understand and is responsible for the practical application of Projects, Maintenance and Turnaround Downstream Standards including, but not limited to:<\u002Fp>\n    <ul>\n     <li><p> Downstream Projects and Turnaround Work Processes<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n     <li><p> Projects and Turnaround Estimating and Budgeting Recommended Practices<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n     <li><p> Projects and Turnaround Cost Control Recommended Practices<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n     <li><p> Projects and Turnaround Finance Standards<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n     <li><p> Maintenance Work Processes<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n    <\u002Ful><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Estimating, cost control, reporting and forecasting at the project portfolio level and provide management reports to the Project Team and Project Manager. Identify issues &amp; propose solution.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Responsible for the assembly of budgets for all assigned Turnaround Events for all phases from planning until Turnaround Completion, compliant with the recommended practice, including proratables for project allocation with Turnaround.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Compile and timely reporting of site\u002Fdepartment cost reports, KPI, Capex and project latest estimate.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> What we need from you<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p> To succeed in this role, you will have:<\u002Fp>\n  <ul>\n   <li><p> Bachelor’s degree (minimum and accredited) of any conventional Engineering Discipline, Project &amp; Construction Management or Quantity Surveying.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> 5 Years + Experience in planning &amp; executing projects and\u002For turnarounds.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Has experience with budgeting, contract, and procurement management.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Key Skills:<\u002Fp>\n    <ul>\n     <li><p> Written and verbal communication skills.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n     <li><p> Customer focus.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n     <li><p> Works effectively in a Team environment and build consensus.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n     <li><p> Computer skills - PowerPoint, Word, Outlook, GSAP, Excel, Project Controls Tools.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n     <li><p> Leadership and coaching skills.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n     <li><p> Create and manage change.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n    <\u002Ful><\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> Company description<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p> Shell is one the largest foreign investors in Singapore and began operations in 1891. Today, we have more than 3,200 employees in Singapore alone. The Pulau Bukom Manufacturing Site today is the largest Shell refinery in the world in terms of crude distillation capacity, which makes Singapore a key regional supply and trading centre for Shell in the East. Singapore is the largest petrochemical production and export centre in the Asia Pacific region. Shell Jurong Island (SJI) manufactures petrochemicals to meet the fast-growing demand for these products in the region. We also have one of the largest single-branded retail networks in Singapore, providing customers with a wide range of quality products and services. When you join Shell in Singapore, you can count on our commitment to help you thrive and propel your career by means of our industry-leading development programme and our available and unrivalled pool of local and global experts. Our numerous global and local skill pools as well as our diversity are key to our success and continuing innovation.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><b><br> An innovative place to work <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p>There’s never been a more exciting time to work at Shell.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> Join us and you’ll be adding your talent and imagination to a business with the ambition to shape the future – whether by investing in oil, gas and renewable energy to meet demand, exploring new ways to store energy, or developing technology that helps the world to use energy more efficiently, everyone at Shell does their part.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> An inclusive place to work <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p>To power progress, we need to attract and develop the brightest minds and make sure every voice is heard. Here are just some of the ways we are nurturing an inclusive environment – one where you can express your ideas, extend your skills, and reach your potential.<\u002Fp>\n  <ul>\n   <li><p> We’re creating a space where people with disabilities can excel through transparent recruitment process, workplace adjustments and ongoing support in their roles. Feel free to let us know about your circumstances when you apply, and we’ll take it from there.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> We’re closing the gender gap – whether that’s through action on equal pay or by enabling more women to reach senior roles in engineering and technology.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> We’re striving to be a pioneer of an inclusive and diverse workplace, promoting equality for employees regardless of sexual orientation or gender identity.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> We consider ourselves a flexible employer and want to support you finding the right balance. We encourage you to discuss this with us in your application.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> A rewarding place to work <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p>Combine our creative, collaborative environment and global operations with an impressive range of benefits and joining Shell becomes an inspired career choice.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> We’re huge advocates for career development. We’ll encourage you to try new roles and experience new settings. By pushing people to reach their potential, we frequently help them find skills they never knew they had, or make career moves they never thought possible.<\u002Fp>\n  <br> \n <\u002Fdiv>\n <p><\u002Fp> \n <div>\n  <h3 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><p>Disclaimer <\u002Fp><\u002Fh3>\n  <div>\n   <div>\n    Please note: We occasionally amend or withdraw Shell jobs and reserve the right to do so at any time, including prior to the advertised closing date. The Shell Group and its approved recruitment consultants will never ask you for a fee to process or consider your application for a career with Shell. Anyone who demands such a fee is not an authorised Shell representative and you are strongly advised to refuse any such demand.
