<h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b>The Role<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2> \n <div>\n  <p><b>Where you fit in<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> SLMT (Shell LNG Marketing &amp; Trading) is the global LNG marketing and trading arm of Shell where the Commercial Cargo Operator sits. Shell is the global leader in LNG industry with supply projects in both Atlantic\u002FAsia Pacific basins and customers spread across Asia, Europe, Middle East and South America. The nature of this high value trade is evolving fast with the mix of long and short-term contracts.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> Commercial Operations provides end to end commercial operations and logistical support to SLMT and is as such responsible on a day-to-day basis for the timely implementation and execution of commercial transactions to ensure that all obligations arising from the LNG contracts are met and carried out professionally. This requires working closely with traders to maximise the value-add for profitable operations and minimize the profit leakage from the flexibility and optionality embedded in the LNG contracts. Operations are also involved in the development of projects and new contracts.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> The LNG operations team is responsible on a day-to-day basis to be able to implement and execute commercial deals and review standard LNG contracts. In addition to cargo operations, this incumbent may be expected to cover freight operations and be able to operate LNG ships under SLMT’s responsibility working closely with the chartering team.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> What’s the role? <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p>Key Areas of Responsibility<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <ul>\n   <li><p> Ensure that LNG operations fully complies with Shell’s internal standards including compliance and HSSE, paying special attention to HSSE hazards and risks that may have impact on Shell’s license to operate.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Display visible leadership and commitment to HSSE within the team. Engage with external partners to echo and reinforce our strong focus on HSSE.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Ensure that all commercial and operational obligations\u002Fnominations arising from the contracts are carried out, and that any necessary requirements are complied with.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Deal with cargo\u002Ffreight counterparties and terminals on a regular basis regarding all pre and post deal activities.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Appoint independent inspectors and expeditors and be able to investigate matters relating to LNG quality.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Ensure that all operational information is entered timely and accurately into trading systems.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Execute timely cargo invoicing, reconciliations and clearances of accruals for both external and internal deals.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Liaise with counterparts and support the team to ensure smooth operations, avoid delays and minimise demurrage costs.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Multi-task on priorities and think on your feet to deal with contractual problems ensuring that they are managed professionally and optimally for the trading business.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Specifically seek to add value by exercising embedded commercial and logistical deal options and be pro-active with problem solving.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Support commercial colleagues on the feasibility of proposed contractual arrangements for new projects, new contracts and spot cargoes.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Agree supply schedules with third parties and calculate cargo pricing through understanding the mechanisms and indices employed.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Identify and exploit synergies with other parts of Shell Trading.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Support short term initiatives to continuously improve the efficiency of all aspects of the commercial operations.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Engage in highly complicated contract mechanisms for reconciliations involving large datasets to be completed in a timely fashion.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Manage relationships with external stakeholders, counterparties and service providers e.g. suppliers and customers, surveyors, and regulatory bodies.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Actively engage and support the global freight and cargo operations team across the other hubs to ensure the process alignment, business continuity and commercial added value.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Pro-actively close out operational related disputes or issues with external and internal counterparts.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Engage with external parties (outside of Shell) to gather best practices, digital solutions and exchangeable learnings.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Support LNG Ops and SLMT digitisation strategy in close liaison with the Project Lead. Drive continuous improvements and automation.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> The operator will handle global 24\u002F7 trading activities and whilst colleagues are available in other time zones, the operator is expected to respond flexibly to requests outside of normal office hours.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> What we need from you<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> A key criterion is to be able to operate within a non-standard environment where the counterparty requires and expects considerable support and at the same time be able to gently introduce standardisation and efficiency.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> Experience in commercial operations (preferably LNG) will be a strong advantage.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> Functional Competencies<\u002Fp>\n  <ul>\n   <li><p> Good understanding of international trade, maritime transportation, and commodity markets.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Strong understanding of value drivers in LNG trading, LNG operations, Gas markets and Gas operations.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Proven track record of experience in Commercial LNG and Commercial Gas Operations.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Ability to identify areas of operational and commercial risk in new and existing contracts, with a track record of successfully implementing changes to limit risk or increase optionality.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Ability to apply analytical competencies and critically analyse scenarios to best determine actions and decision making.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Able to gather and manage large data sets from different sources with complex relationships, streamline, develop reports and analyse using tools such as Excel, PowerBI, Alteryx etc.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Ability to analyse business challenges and formulate digital solutions using innovative technology.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Track record of continuous improvement and be able to identify and implement solutions to ruthlessly eliminate complexity and waste in terms of processes.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Deploy a commercial mindset in parallel with critical HSSE elements to achieve a balance of objectives.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Ability to identify risk and opportunity in complex operational circumstances.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Ability to leverage on functional support and provide high quality options and opinions to commercial stakeholders.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> Leadership competencies<\u002Fp>\n  <ul>\n   <li><p> Act with personal integrity, be guided by personal values and beliefs.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Resilient under pressure and ability to manage own well-being with consideration for others.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Strong sense of initiative to independently seek out information.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Effective verbal and written communication skills, adapting to varying audiences to clearly articulate key messages for influence.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Deal with conflicting priorities where managing difficult stakeholders must be conducted professionally.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Display a learner mindset and challenge commercial decisions where applicable.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Make decisions under time pressure based on best available information.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Ability to engage, listen and understand perspectives whilst providing effective feedback to peers and management.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Impeccable work ethic with exceptional work standards and the desire learn and grow through experiences.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Proven track record of building trust among peers, stakeholders and external counterparties.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Ability to understand diversity of thought and incorporate different views in decision making.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Capability to foster a positive work environment and lead by example even in challenging circumstances<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Shows care for colleagues.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> A high level of fluency in the English language, both written and spoken is required; others such as Mandarin, Japanese and Korean would also be an advantage.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> Company Description<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p> Shell is one the largest foreign investors in Singapore and began operations in 1891. Today, we have more than 3,200 employees in Singapore alone. The Pulau Bukom Manufacturing Site today is the largest Shell refinery in the world in terms of crude distillation capacity, which makes Singapore a key regional supply and trading centre for Shell in the East. Singapore is the largest petrochemical production and export centre in the Asia Pacific region. Shell Jurong Island (SJI) manufactures petrochemicals to meet the fast-growing demand for these products in the region. We also have one of the largest single-branded retail networks in Singapore, providing customers with a wide range of quality products and services. When you join Shell in Singapore, you can count on our commitment to help you thrive and propel your career by means of our industry-leading development programme and our available and unrivalled pool of local and global experts. Our numerous global and local skill pools as well as our diversity are key to our success and continuing innovation.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> An innovative place to work <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p>There’s never been a more exciting time to work at Shell.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> Join us and you’ll be adding your talent and imagination to a business with the ambition to shape the future – whether by investing in oil, gas, and renewable energy to meet demand, exploring new ways to store energy, or developing technology that helps the world to use energy more efficiently, everyone at Shell does their part.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> An inclusive place to work <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p>To power progress, we need to attract and develop the brightest minds and make sure every voice is heard. Here are just some of the ways we are nurturing an inclusive environment – one where you can express your ideas, extend your skills, and reach your potential.<\u002Fp>\n  <ul>\n   <li><p> We’re creating a space where people with disabilities can excel through transparent recruitment process, workplace adjustments and ongoing support in their roles. Feel free to let us know about your circumstances when you apply, and we’ll take it from there.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> We’re closing the gender gap – whether that’s through action on equal pay or by enabling more women to reach senior roles in engineering and technology.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> We’re striving to be a pioneer of an inclusive and diverse workplace, promoting equality for employees regardless of sexual orientation or gender identity.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> We consider ourselves a flexible employer and want to support you finding the right balance. We encourage you to discuss this with us in your application.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> A rewarding place to work <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p>Combine our creative, collaborative environment and global operations with an impressive range of benefits and joining Shell becomes an inspired career choice.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> We’re huge advocates for career development. We’ll encourage you to try new roles and experience new settings. By pushing people to reach their potential, we frequently help them find skills they never knew they had, or make career moves they never thought possible.<\u002Fp>\n  <br> \n  <p><\u002Fp> \n <\u002Fdiv>\n <p><\u002Fp> \n <div>\n  <h3 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><p>Disclaimer <\u002Fp><\u002Fh3>\n  <div>\n   <div>\n    Please note: We occasionally amend or withdraw Shell jobs and reserve the right to do so at any time, including prior to the advertised closing date. Anyone who demands such a fee is not an authorised Shell representative and you are strongly advised to refuse any such demand. Shell is an Equal Opportunity Employer.\n   <\u002Fdiv>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b>The Role<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2> \n <div>\n  <p><b>Where you fit in <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p>You will be responsible for the identification and realization of major business opportunities across the region. Opportunities include but not limited to partnership with players through end-to-end E-Mobility ecosystem to optimize investment and achieve speedy to markets; new domain in existing markets that brings scalable &amp; sustainable value; new markets to introduce Shell Recharge to support electrification progress of the community.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> This is an exciting &amp; demanding role to expand Shell’s ability to power mobility, strengthen Shell’s EV charging business and contribute to Shell Group’s net carbon footprint ambition.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> What’s the role? <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p>As Asia E-Mobility Business Development Manager, your key accountabilities include the following:<\u002Fp>\n  <ul>\n   <li><p> Responsible for identifying and realizing strategic growth opportunity based on Asia E-Mobility strategy, consumer insights and industry movements.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Work closely with global business development and strategy team to ensure alignment of priorities and leverage global resource and expertise.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Build and maintain relationship with key partners in priority markets, establish partnership model and create sustainable, win-win solution for both Shell and partners.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Develop a pipeline of opportunities, including leading the commercial negotiations &amp; contracting, managing opportunities across the various stages from initial assessment through to implementation &amp; operation.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Explore proven concepts of new business domain that integrate Shell’s E-Mobility offering and differentiate us from competitors.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Evaluate business opportunities in new markets and provide input for decision making.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Support global BD team to integrate new business and new market to Shell’s existing business during execution.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> What we need from you<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p> To succeed in this role, you will have:<\u002Fp>\n  <ul>\n   <li><p> Commercial experience and great negotiation skills, sales or account management experience is preferred.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Solid knowledge and proven experience in E-Mobility industry. Experience in China, Singapore, UK, Netherlands and Germany is an advantage.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Curiosity and an ability to seek out relevant new solutions to develop the future EV charging offers.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Ability to identify key issues among complex problems and seek relevant resource despite the complex and ambiguous factors to create solutions.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Excellent interpersonal skills, including the proven ability to manage relationship with stakeholders across different businesses functions and different cultural context, in both physical and virtual working environment.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Ability to use commercial acumen to qualify potential opportunities that drive incremental value to the business.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Ability to manage complex interfaces both internally and externally to create win-win outcomes for both Shell and external partners.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Data analysis and systematic thinking.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> Company Description<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p> Shell is one the largest foreign investors in Singapore and began operations in 1891. Today, we have more than 3,200 employees in Singapore alone. The Pulau Bukom Manufacturing Site today is the largest Shell refinery in the world in terms of crude distillation capacity, which makes Singapore a key regional supply and trading centre for Shell in the East. Singapore is the largest petrochemical production and export centre in the Asia Pacific region. Shell Jurong Island (SJI) manufactures petrochemicals to meet the fast-growing demand for these products in the region. We also have one of the largest single-branded retail networks in Singapore, providing customers with a wide range of quality products and services. When you join Shell in Singapore, you can count on our commitment to help you thrive and propel your career by means of our industry-leading development programme and our available and unrivalled pool of local and global experts. Our numerous global and local skill pools as well as our diversity are key to our success and continuing innovation.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> An innovative place to work <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p>There’s never been a more exciting time to work at Shell.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> Join us and you’ll be adding your talent and imagination to a business with the ambition to shape the future – whether by investing in oil, gas, and renewable energy to meet demand, exploring new ways to store energy, or developing technology that helps the world to use energy more efficiently, everyone at Shell does their part.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> An inclusive place to work <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p>To power progress, we need to attract and develop the brightest minds and make sure every voice is heard. Here are just some of the ways we are nurturing an inclusive environment – one where you can express your ideas, extend your skills, and reach your potential.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <ul>\n   <li><p> We’re creating a space where people with disabilities can excel through transparent recruitment process, workplace adjustments and ongoing support in their roles. Feel free to let us know about your circumstances when you apply, and we’ll take it from there.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> We’re closing the gender gap – whether that’s through action on equal pay or by enabling more women to reach senior roles in engineering and technology.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> We’re striving to be a pioneer of an inclusive and diverse workplace, promoting equality for employees regardless of sexual orientation or gender identity.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> We consider ourselves a flexible employer and want to support you finding the right balance. We encourage you to discuss this with us in your application.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> A rewarding place to work <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p>Combine our creative, collaborative environment and global operations with an impressive range of benefits and joining Shell becomes an inspired career choice.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> We’re huge advocates for career development. We’ll encourage you to try new roles and experience new settings. By pushing people to reach their potential, we frequently help them find skills they never knew they had, or make career moves they never thought possible.<\u002Fp>\n  <br> \n <\u002Fdiv>\n <p><\u002Fp> \n <div>\n  <h3 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><p>Disclaimer <\u002Fp><\u002Fh3>\n  <div>\n   <div>\n    Please note: We occasionally amend or withdraw Shell jobs and reserve the right to do so at any time, including prior to the advertised closing date. Anyone who demands such a fee is not an authorised Shell representative and you are strongly advised to refuse any such demand. <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b>The Role<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2> \n <div>\n  <p>We are looking for a motivated and passionate Commercial Operator with combined skills and experience in operations, conflict management and has commercial agility.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> What’s the role?<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <ul>\n   <li><p> Operators are the key executors of the ’life of the deal’, managing movements on bulk crude or product tankers from supply to delivery point in an operationally excellent and optimal manner, preventing profit leakage and looking for value add or optimization opportunities.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Some Operator roles will be more involved with running voyage charter vessels, operating Shell-leased terminals and or possibly involved in some blending activities. In these instances, Operators are expected to defend the P&amp;L and look out for opportunities to maximize margins through effective asset utilization, preventing unnecessary downtime\u002Fdemurrage or improving blend margins.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Ensure that all obligations arising from the contract and charter party are executed flawlessly, in compliance with governmental and industrial regulations as well as Shell’s HSSE guidelines.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Daily external interface with contractual counterparties, terminal operators, vessel owners\u002Fbrokers and contracted vendors such as cargo surveyors or port agents.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Daily internal interface with Cargo\u002FFreight Traders, Shipping &amp; Maritime, Manufacturing, Product Optimizers, Claims, Contracts, Demurrage, Legal and Trade Finance.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Expected to manage supply and delivery schedules with internal and external counterparties. Operators will need to appreciate the challenges and constraints of the end-to-end supply chain, and operationalize a plan to meet those objectives, while remaining profitable and compliant.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Timely and accurate ship\u002Fcargo and date range nominations to ensure supply integrity and successful implementation of commercial business\u002Fsupply intent.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Manage vessel operations, such as scheduling, routing, bunkering, stow planning &amp; optimization, issuing voyage orders and monitoring fleet of vessels under your charge.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Manage cargo operations, such as managing off-spec issues, cargo readiness, scheduling, blending (where applicable for more senior or specialized Operators roles), avoiding tank-top\u002Fstock-out situations and volume\u002Fdate-range optimization.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Support post-deal activities like settlements, customs clearance, demurrage and claims for example; ensuring that all necessary operational information is passed on in good time and documentary requirements are met.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Appoint independent cargo surveyors, expeditors, ship-to-ship service providers and ships agents.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Ensure that all operational data is updated into trading systems in timely and accurate manner, facilitating up-to-date and accurate information flow.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Ensure that adequate records are filed to meet the company’s legal and fiscal obligations.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Ensure that any necessary financial security is in place prior to transfer of title to customers.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Be available to manage critical out of regular office hour issues.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> The job may require after office hours or weekend attention from time to<br> time.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Attention to details, meticulousness and numeracy skills are a prerequisite.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> What we need from you<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <ul>\n   <li><p> Display relevant knowledge and or experience (2 – 3 years) in Commercial Operations. It will be advantageous to have some prior working experience in a Commercial (or similar) Operations-type environment.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Display some evidence of commerciality and ability to maximize margins or adding-value to the bottom line. For example: ability to participate in or positively contribute to end-to-end supply strategy plans as well as ability to identify\u002Fresolve potential blockers to successful operational execution.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Ability to contribute to successful implementation of an operations plan, identifying and managing supply\u002Foperational constraints independently.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Display some understanding of and ability to articulate the demands and nature of the commercial business.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Display evidence of effective teamwork, strong networking and influencing skills. Prospective candidates should be able to give evidence of effective stakeholder and relationship management.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Evidence of being able to manage multiple and conflicting priorities to achieve business intent and objectives with minimal supervision.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Evidence of ability to problem solve in uncertain circumstances or working with incomplete information.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Evidence of ability to function well in a fast-paced dynamic environment where changes are the norm.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Candidates are expected to be proactive self-starters, as well as demonstrable evidence of resilience in adversity, determination and drive to get things done.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Demonstrate a passion for operations excellence and evidence of participating in optimization initiatives or activities.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> Company Description<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p> Shell is one the largest foreign investors in Singapore and began operations in 1891. Today, we have more than 3,200 employees in Singapore alone. The Pulau Bukom Manufacturing Site today is the largest Shell refinery in the world in terms of crude distillation capacity, which makes Singapore a key regional supply and trading centre for Shell in the East. Singapore is the largest petrochemical production and export centre in the Asia Pacific region. Shell Jurong Island (SJI) manufactures petrochemicals to meet the fast-growing demand for these products in the region. We also have one of the largest single-branded retail networks in Singapore, providing customers with a wide range of quality products and services. When you join Shell in Singapore, you can count on our commitment to help you thrive and propel your career by means of our industry-leading development programme and our available and unrivalled pool of local and global experts. Our numerous global and local skill pools as well as our diversity are key to our success and continuing innovation.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> An innovative place to work<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p> There’s never been a more exciting time to work at Shell.<\u002Fp>\n  <p> Join us and you’ll be adding your talent and imagination to a business with the ambition to shape the future – whether by investing in oil, gas, and renewable energy to meet demand, exploring new ways to store energy, or developing technology that helps the world to use energy more efficiently, everyone at Shell does their part.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> An inclusive place to work<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p> To power progress, we need to attract and develop the brightest minds and make sure every voice is heard. Here are just some of the ways we are nurturing an inclusive environment – one where you can express your ideas, extend your skills, and reach your potential.<\u002Fp>\n  <ul>\n   <li><p> We’re creating a space where people with disabilities can excel through transparent recruitment process, workplace adjustments and ongoing support in their roles. Feel free to let us know about your circumstances when you apply, and we’ll take it from there.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> We’re closing the gender gap – whether that’s through action on equal pay or by enabling more women to reach senior roles in engineering and technology.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> We’re striving to be a pioneer of an inclusive and diverse workplace, promoting equality for employees regardless of sexual orientation or gender identity.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> We consider ourselves a flexible employer and want to support you finding the right balance. We encourage you to discuss this with us in your application.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> A rewarding place to work<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p> Combine our creative, collaborative environment and global operations with an impressive range of benefits and joining Shell becomes an inspired career choice.<\u002Fp>\n  <p> We’re huge advocates for career development. We’ll encourage you to try new roles and experience new settings. By pushing people to reach their potential, we frequently help them find skills they never knew they had, or make career moves they never thought possible.<\u002Fp>\n  <br> \n <\u002Fdiv>\n <p><\u002Fp> \n <div>\n  <h3 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><p>Disclaimer <\u002Fp><\u002Fh3>\n  <div>\n   <div>\n    Please note: We occasionally amend or withdraw Shell jobs and reserve the right to do so at any time, including prior to the advertised closing date. <p><b>What is the role <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n <p>This is a 2-year contract role. <\u002Fp>\n <p>1) As a Senior investigator - you are part of the Global HR Investigation Team. Your primary objective is to conduct and support investigations into potential breaches of the Company's Code of Conduct, General Business Principles, Ethics and Compliance manual, company policy and the law. Investigations may involve, but are not limited to, harassment, equal opportunity, protection of assets, data privacy, theft, conflict of interest, and may involve employees, contract employees, vendors\u002Fsuppliers, and others.<br> <\u002Fp>\n <p><\u002Fp>\n <br> \n <p>2) Manage the Company's Global Helpline (GHL) cases assigned to them, across regions \u002F countries, which will include the following: <\u002Fp>\n <p>(a) Conduct, i.e. plan and execute, investigations into possible violations of the Company's Code of Conduct, General Business Principles, Ethics and Compliance manual, company policies, and relevant laws; <\u002Fp>\n <p>(b) Collection and analysis of evidence; <\u002Fp>\n <p>(c) Conduct subject and witness interviews; <\u002Fp>\n <p>(d) Write high quality, fact-based, concise investigation reports, which should also meet the agreed Company's designated format and standards; <\u002Fp>\n <p>(e) Conduct closure meetings with the Reporter; <\u002Fp>\n <p>(f) Effective stakeholder management, including close-out meetings; <\u002Fp>\n <p>(g) Update and complete the information in the Company’s case management systems throughout the investigation and on case closure; and <\u002Fp>\n <p>(h) Post Investigations, ensure Learning From Incidents (LFI)\u002FSmarter actions (where required) are listed down by Business Stakeholder &amp; Country Employee Relations team.<br> <\u002Fp>\n <p><\u002Fp>\n <br> \n <p><b>What we need from you <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n <p>We are looking for a team player who is resilient, confident, a self-starter and has the ability to act as a role-model. <\u002Fp>\n <ul>\n  <li>A degree-level education <\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful>\n <ul>\n  <li>Human Resources \u002F Legal \u002F Audit \u002F Business Investigation background of 8 – 10 years. <\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful>\n <ul>\n  <li>Good experience in the lifecycle of investigations (complex case management, investigation interviews, report writing &amp; <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b>The Role<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2> \n <div>\n  <p><b>Where you fit in<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p> You will be responsible for the identification and implementation of across market EV projects that yield tangible, substantial outcome to Shell from both network and profitability perspectives. It’s a key enabler to achieve our growth ambition for the region and will set examples to replicate in local markets.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> This is an exciting &amp; demanding role to expand Shell’s ability to power mobility, strengthen Shell’s EV charging business and contribute to Shell Group’s net carbon footprint ambition.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> What’s the role? <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p>As Asia E-Mobility Project Manager, your key accountabilities include the following:<\u002Fp>\n  <ul>\n   <li><p> Responsible for identifying and leading strategic E-Mobility projects in existing and new Asia markets to deliver business growth strategy, multi-year growth plan and P&amp;L targets.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Form project team and implement projects per timeline and budget, deliverables including but not limited to charge point\u002Fbattery swap station, new offering and business model, capability setup in new markets etc.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Communicate with stakeholders and ensure priorities are aligned through the organization. Escalate issues and support needed on timely manner.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Establish a repository of key E-Mobility projects across Asia, identify synergies and share best practice to accelerate the growth.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Act as the owner of E-Mobility end-to-end process from sales lead identification, delivery, billing, reporting and post-delivery customer service; constantly seeking ways to optimize process and improve efficiency.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Responsible to set up regular E-Mobility performance review, ensure quality data is submitted on time and contribute to country-by-country discussions.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Stay connected with global and local team to ensure an alignment of priorities and effective replication of best practice, especially about new technologies and innovative projects in E-Mobility domain.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> What we need from you<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p> To succeed in this role, you will have:<\u002Fp>\n  <ul>\n   <li><p> Solid knowledge and proven experience in E-Mobility industry. Experience in China, Singapore, UK, Netherlands, and Germany is an advantage.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Tracked record of successful project management and results delivery, PMP or equivalent project management professional certification is preferred.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Great time management capability to prioritize tasks and manage delay risks, high say-do ratio with execution discipline.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Ability to identify key issues among complex problems and seek relevant resource despite the complex and ambiguous factors to create solutions.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Excellent interpersonal skills, including the proven ability to manage relationship with stakeholders across different businesses functions and different cultural context, in both physical and virtual working environment.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Ability to use commercial acumen to qualify potential opportunities that drive incremental value to the business.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Ability to manage complex interfaces both internally and externally to create win-win outcomes for both Shell and external partners.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> Company Description<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p> Shell is one the largest foreign investors in Singapore and began operations in 1891. Today, we have more than 3,200 employees in Singapore alone. The Pulau Bukom Manufacturing Site today is the largest Shell refinery in the world in terms of crude distillation capacity, which makes Singapore a key regional supply and trading centre for Shell in the East. Singapore is the largest petrochemical production and export centre in the Asia Pacific region. Shell Jurong Island (SJI) manufactures petrochemicals to meet the fast-growing demand for these products in the region. We also have one of the largest single-branded retail networks in Singapore, providing customers with a wide range of quality products and services. When you join Shell in Singapore, you can count on our commitment to help you thrive and propel your career by means of our industry-leading development programme and our available and unrivalled pool of local and global experts. Our numerous global and local skill pools as well as our diversity are key to our success and continuing innovation.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> An innovative place to work <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p>There’s never been a more exciting time to work at Shell.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> Join us and you’ll be adding your talent and imagination to a business with the ambition to shape the future – whether by investing in oil, gas, and renewable energy to meet demand, exploring new ways to store energy, or developing technology that helps the world to use energy more efficiently, everyone at Shell does their part.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> An inclusive place to work <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p>To power progress, we need to attract and develop the brightest minds and make sure every voice is heard. Here are just some of the ways we are nurturing an inclusive environment – one where you can express your ideas, extend your skills, and reach your potential.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <ul>\n   <li><p> We’re creating a space where people with disabilities can excel through transparent recruitment process, workplace adjustments and ongoing support in their roles. Feel free to let us know about your circumstances when you apply, and we’ll take it from there.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> We’re closing the gender gap – whether that’s through action on equal pay or by enabling more women to reach senior roles in engineering and technology.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> We’re striving to be a pioneer of an inclusive and diverse workplace, promoting equality for employees regardless of sexual orientation or gender identity.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> We consider ourselves a flexible employer and want to support you finding the right balance. We encourage you to discuss this with us in your application.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> A rewarding place to work <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p>Combine our creative, collaborative environment and global operations with an impressive range of benefits and joining Shell becomes an inspired career choice.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> We’re huge advocates for career development. We’ll encourage you to try new roles and experience new settings. By pushing people to reach their potential, we frequently help them find skills they never knew they had, or make career moves they never thought possible.<\u002Fp>\n  <br> \n <\u002Fdiv>\n <p><\u002Fp> \n <div>\n  <h3 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><p>Disclaimer <\u002Fp><\u002Fh3>\n  <div>\n   <div>\n    Please note: We occasionally amend or withdraw Shell jobs and reserve the right to do so at any time, including prior to the advertised closing date. <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b>The Role<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2> \n <div>\n  <p><b>What’s the role? <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p>As the Project Electrical Engineer, you will be part of the Shell Jurong Island (SJI) engineering team responsible for delivery of the SJI site projects in Singapore. This role will provide leadership and expertise on all electrical aspects to the projects. Also ensuring integration of the brown field projects into current facilities and other ongoing projects seamlessly.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> You will work in a SJI multidiscipline project engineering team. Once construction starts the engineer will act as a technical assurance engineer to ensure the implementations are carried out as per design and meets the project premise.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> Your accountabilities include the following:<\u002Fp>\n  <ul>\n   <li><p> Ensure compliance to the Site HSSE and Process Safety standards, local requirements i.e. Energy Market Authority Act, Electricity Act and local Code of Practices during execution of Engineering Design<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Ensure compliance to Shell Electrical requirements are met and adherence to Technical Assurance Process.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Raise\u002Freview deviations, derogation when required and stakeholders are engaged for proper approval.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> To support\u002Fexecute Site lead capital electrical projects when required.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Ensure Electrical engineering deliverables from EPC contractors are reviewed at different stages of the project and correct inputs\u002Fadvice are given when required.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Participate with site project team, EPC contractors and vendors during site walk to address the location plan, construction feasibility and brown field integration.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Attend project meeting to review the EPC deliverables as and when required.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Coordinate with relevant disciplines for integrating the new asset with the existing asset.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Participate and perform Technical bid evaluation of bid packages for Engineering Design and Equipment package.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Participate with the project team for the safety review when required.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Provide assurance during Electrical construction and participate\u002Fwitness the testing when required.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Develop work plan with contractors, operations, maintenance and all relevant parties for execution with minimum interruption to operating plant. Interface with Operations, Technologists, Engineering, Maintenance &amp; contractors \u002F vendors for smooth execution.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Attend FAT\u002FSAT and Functional testing to ensure electrical equipment’s are meeting the design intent &amp; project premise.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Prepare \u002F execute\u002Freview switching plan, method of statement, Job Hazard Assessment when required.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Provide electrical support during commissioning &amp; startup for the capital projects.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Review test packages submitted by contractors for completeness and ensure as built make up is done and submit DNF for final update.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Upon project completion, ensure projects have proper closure for all documentation as-built including GSAP and PM (Preventive Maintenance) plan.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Maintain high equipment reliability by ensuring Flawless Project Delivery is implemented in the project.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Initiate and contribute to improvements including plant safety and reliability.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Support continuous improvement in project and construction toward LEAN.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Participate during Pre Startup Safety Review to verify and declare the electrical installation are meetings the standards and safe to start-up.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Standby duty coverage, carry out any other related duties as required.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> What we need from you<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p> We are keen to speak to professionals with as many of the following:<\u002Fp>\n  <ul>\n   <li><p> Degree in Electrical engineering<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Minimum 5 years relevant working experience in the field of electrical engineering<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Attend HV Operation Course (EMA)<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Having LEW, and Oil\u002Fpetrochemical industry safety course for supervisors is an added advantage<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> High level of communication and inter-personal skills is required to interact with all parties\u002Fdiscipline (Shell and contractors)<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Ability to:<\u002Fp>\n    <ul>\n     <li><p> Execute work safely, accurately, and timely in accordance with the requirements<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n     <li><p> Handle interface amongst various disciplines within and outside the Department<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n     <li><p> Motivate all the executing parties to achieve the common objectives<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n     <li><p> Identify the weaknesses in the construction and make rectification<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n     <li><p> Secure timely availability of materials and resources to meet construction schedule<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n     <li><p> Ensure projects are constructed reliably &amp; right first time<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n     <li><p> Ability to manage interface between the various disciplines<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n     <li><p> Ensure HSE compliance by all parties in the execution<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n    <\u002Ful><\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> Company description<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p> Shell is one the largest foreign investors in Singapore and began operations in 1891. Today, we have more than 3,200 employees in Singapore alone. Shell Jurong Island (SJI) manufactures petrochemicals to meet the fast-growing demand for these products in the region. The Pulau Bukom Manufacturing Site today is the largest Shell refinery in the world in terms of crude distillation capacity, which makes Singapore a key regional supply and trading centre for Shell in the East. Singapore is the largest petrochemical production and export centre in the Asia Pacific region. We also have one of the largest single-branded retail networks in Singapore, providing customers with a wide range of quality products and services. When you join Shell in Singapore, you can count on our commitment to help you thrive and propel your career by means of our industry-leading development programme and our available and unrivalled pool of local and global experts. Our numerous global and local skill pools as well as our diversity are key to our success and continuing innovation.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><b><br> An innovative place to work <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p>There’s never been a more exciting time to work at Shell.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> Join us and you’ll be adding your talent and imagination to a business with the ambition to shape the future – whether by investing in oil, gas and renewable energy to meet demand, exploring new ways to store energy, or developing technology that helps the world to use energy more efficiently, everyone at Shell does their part.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> An inclusive place to work <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p>To power progress, we need to attract and develop the brightest minds and make sure every voice is heard. Here are just some of the ways we are nurturing an inclusive environment – one where you can express your ideas, extend your skills, and reach your potential.<\u002Fp>\n  <ul>\n   <li><p> We’re creating a space where people with disabilities can excel through transparent recruitment process, workplace adjustments and ongoing support in their roles. Feel free to let us know about your circumstances when you apply, and we’ll take it from there.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> We’re closing the gender gap – whether that’s through action on equal pay or by enabling more women to reach senior roles in engineering and technology.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> We’re striving to be a pioneer of an inclusive and diverse workplace, promoting equality for employees regardless of sexual orientation or gender identity.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> We consider ourselves a flexible employer and want to support you finding the right balance. We encourage you to discuss this with us in your application.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> A rewarding place to work <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p>Combine our creative, collaborative environment and global operations with an impressive range of benefits and joining Shell becomes an inspired career choice.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> We’re huge advocates for career development. We’ll encourage you to try new roles and experience new settings. <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b>The Role<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2> \n <div>\n  <p><b>Where you fit in<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p> Shell Energy Singapore (SES) is the entity in Shell Trading that runs the LNG import and gas marketing business for Singapore. Under the aggregator licenses granted in 2010, 2017 and 2021, it can import up to 4MTPA of LNG and holds GSAs for the sale of re-gasified LNG to 11 long-term customers including Shell Manufacturing. Collectively, SES holds a market share of ~80% of re-gasified LNG which is also ~30% of the entire gas demand in Singapore.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> SES has also offered various other products to the market over the past few years, such as spot gas supply, trading\u002Fdiversion opportunities, supply of LNG for LNG trucking and bunkering, for gas up and cooldown, and providing gas transportation service via onshore pipeline within Singapore. It delivers re-gasified LNG to customers using terminal facilities operated by Singapore LNG Terminal (SLNG) on a 24\u002F7 basis with hourly nomination flexibility. SLNG has transformed into a multi-user terminal, and this has created challenges in managing our portfolio as well as presenting new opportunities. Going forward, SES aspires to move into the Power space, pulling in New Energies and Own-use requirements into one integrated energy management business.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> What’s the role?<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p> A Commercial Operator is constantly expected to create value for the business, including but not limited to the following:<\u002Fp>\n  <ul>\n   <li><p> Engagement with external parties to test\u002Fpush boundaries of a contract during the operationalization of contracts to generate increment value for business.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Monitoring and investigation of operational issues to prevent profit leakage.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Negotiation with external parties to close any operational gaps which are not being expressly mentioned in the commercial agreements to prevent value leakage.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Ensure contractual obligations and rights are being adhered to protect\u002Fdefend commercial value of contracts.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> Key roles and responsibilities are as follows:<\u002Fp>\n  <ul>\n   <li><p> Ensure that the associated operations fully comply with Shell’s internal standards incl. compliance and HSSE, paying special attention to HSSE hazards and risks that may have impact on Shell’s license to operate.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Ensure that Shell meets its contractual obligations to customers, terminal and regulator, as well as compliance with shipper license obligations while protecting and optimizing Shell’s values.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Establish and sustain relationships with counterparts within the relevant energy community with a view to preserve Shell’s position in its targeted markets.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Monitor periodic (Annual\u002FMonthly\u002FWeekly\u002FDaily\u002FHourly) nominations\u002Fofftakes\u002Fschedules of gas buyers to support SES commercial team in the decision-making process to maximize flexibility in accessing terminal storage capacity.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Monitor LNG inventory and cargo schedules to ensure that there is enough inventory to meet Shell’s downstream obligations with storage constraint.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Maintain a thorough understanding of all contractual, license and regulatory obligations managed by the Commercial Operations Team, including but not limited to GSAs, TUA, TICA, SPA etc.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Design the relevant business processes\u002Fprocedures and keep them current.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Troubleshoot issues and work towards solving operational issues amicably with relevant counterparties, including but not limited to LNG terminal, LNG supplier\u002Fsite, Gas Buyers, Shell commercial team, regulatory bodies, Pipeline Operator, Vessel Owners etc.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Assist in coordinating day-to-day activities across all relevant operational activities, including working closely with relevant support functions to resolve any operational issues encountered.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Provide operational input to contractual arrangements for new projects, new contracts and spot cargoes proposed by commercial team.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Operate Shell’s nomination portal and systems; work closely with after-hours service provider, buyers, and necessary IT support as duty manager on a rotational basis.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Ensuring correct and timely billing\u002Finvoices for both receivables and payable.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> What we need from you<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <ul>\n   <li><p> Exposure in one or more of the following areas:<\u002Fp>\n    <ul>\n     <li><p> Singapore’s Gas and Power market<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n     <li><p> Physical pipeline network of Singapore<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n    <\u002Ful><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Commercial awareness of LNG trading and terminal operations will be a strong advantage.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Experience in operating Gas Sales Agreements, LNG SPAs, Terminal Use Agreements, Gas Transportation Agreements and the Singapore Gas Network Code will be a strong advantage.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Experience in commercial operations (preferably Gas and Power) will be a strong advantage.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Advanced Excel skills and familiarity with other analytical tools and\u002For programming language is a plus.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Exposure to managing and analyzing large volume of data and complex IT infrastructure is a plus.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Excellent relationship management skill to manage external relationships accompanied by the ability to adapt to the bespoke nature of business.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Self-starter with a proactive approach to problem solving.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Ability to integrate and achieve objectives through collaborations with other stakeholders.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Strong verbal and written communication skills.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Analytical skills and strong attention to detail.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Strong desire to develop a career in a fast-paced and evolving commercial environment.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Additional Information:<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n  <p> Role is expected to respond flexibly to requests out of normal office hours, and requires periodic\u002Fscheduled work during evenings, weekends &amp; holidays.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> Company Description<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p> Shell is one the largest foreign investors in Singapore and began operations in 1891. Today, we have more than 3,200 employees in Singapore alone. The Pulau Bukom Manufacturing Site today is the largest Shell refinery in the world in terms of crude distillation capacity, which makes Singapore a key regional supply and trading centre for Shell in the East. Singapore is the largest petrochemical production and export centre in the Asia Pacific region. Shell Jurong Island (SJI) manufactures petrochemicals to meet the fast-growing demand for these products in the region. We also have one of the largest single-branded retail networks in Singapore, providing customers with a wide range of quality products and services. When you join Shell in Singapore, you can count on our commitment to help you thrive and propel your career by means of our industry-leading development programme and our available and unrivalled pool of local and global experts. Our numerous global and local skill pools as well as our diversity are key to our success and continuing innovation.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> An innovative place to work <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p>There’s never been a more exciting time to work at Shell.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> Join us and you’ll be adding your talent and imagination to a business with the ambition to shape the future – whether by investing in oil, gas, and renewable energy to meet demand, exploring new ways to store energy, or developing technology that helps the world to use energy more efficiently, everyone at Shell does their part.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> An inclusive place to work <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p>To power progress, we need to attract and develop the brightest minds and make sure every voice is heard. Here are just some of the ways we are nurturing an inclusive environment – one where you can express your ideas, extend your skills, and reach your potential.<\u002Fp>\n  <ul>\n   <li><p> We’re creating a space where people with disabilities can excel through transparent recruitment process, workplace adjustments and ongoing support in their roles. Feel free to let us know about your circumstances when you apply, and we’ll take it from there.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> We’re closing the gender gap – whether that’s through action on equal pay or by enabling more women to reach senior roles in engineering and technology.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> We’re striving to be a pioneer of an inclusive and diverse workplace, promoting equality for employees regardless of sexual orientation or gender identity.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> We consider ourselves a flexible employer and want to support you finding the right balance. We encourage you to discuss this with us in your application.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> A rewarding place to work <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p>Combine our creative, collaborative environment and global operations with an impressive range of benefits and joining Shell becomes an inspired career choice.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> We’re huge advocates for career development. We’ll encourage you to try new roles and experience new settings. By pushing people to reach their potential, we frequently help them find skills they never knew they had, or make career moves they never thought possible.<\u002Fp>\n  <br> \n  <p><\u002Fp> \n <\u002Fdiv>\n <p><\u002Fp> \n <div>\n  <h3 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><p>Disclaimer <\u002Fp><\u002Fh3>\n  <div>\n   <div>\n    Please note: We occasionally amend or withdraw Shell jobs and reserve the right to do so at any time, including prior to the advertised closing date. Before applying, you are advised to read our data protection policy. This policy describes the processing that may be associated with your personal data and informs you that your personal data may be transferred to Shell\u002FShell Group companies around the world. The Shell Group and its approved recruitment consultants will never ask you for a fee to process or consider your application for a career with Shell. Anyone who demands such a fee is not an authorised Shell representative and you are strongly advised to refuse any such demand. Shell is an Equal Opportunity Employer.\n   <\u002Fdiv>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b>The Role<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2> \n <div>\n  <p><b>What is the role?<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p> The individual is responsible for reviewing and providing assurance on the reasonableness of the overall book representation of the Shell LNG business, ensuring that the price risk management activities of the desk are captured timely within the trading systems and that the resultant pricing exposures carry the relevant fair values consistent with internal mark to market standards.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> The individual is charged with understanding how the Shell LNG businesses generate returns, what resources are consumed in the process, what price risks are taken and associated trading strategies. The individual will need to be able to distill the key drivers of value generation and explain pricing exposures and P&amp;L generated by the desks. This requires close engagement with Commercial stakeholders as they start up in new markets and develop their business strategies.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> The individual will need to work with Commercial stakeholders in different markets to understand market fundamentals and be able to provide an independent assessment of appropriate marks for book representation, some of which may be illiquid markets.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> The individual will need to develop and execute fit-for-purpose risk control framework and processes for the entities. Effective collaboration with Commercial and Finance stakeholders and offshore teams is required for delivery of the controls.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> Strong technical skills (trading system knowledge and market risk functional competencies) are key as the individual will need to participate in trading system implementation projects to shape and execute market risk requirements (e.g. develop and implement forward price curves in trading system). Close collaboration with IT and other teams is required for such projects.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> The individual will also need to coach and guide junior team members (some of whom will not be in the same office location). Strong interpersonal skills will be important to provide effective coaching towards the overall risk team objectives in support of business outcomes.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><b><br> What we need from you?<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> We are keen to hear from candidates with the following experience and qualifications:<\u002Fp>\n  <ul>\n   <li><p> Degree in a quantitative discipline, preferably in Accounting, Business\u002FCommerce or a related field<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Strong understanding of trading, operations, risk and mid\u002Fback office business processes, policies, procedures and controls.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Relevant commodity risk experience, especially in LNG industry, is preferred<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Advanced grasp of trading deal structures, interpreting positions, P&amp;L, mark to market and financial analysis<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Self-motivated individual who functions well in an unstructured environment<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Ability to perform under tight deadlines in a very fast-paced trading environment<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Ability to multitask with a high level of attention to detail and accuracy<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Strong interpersonal and communication skills and an ability to build and maintain positive stakeholder relationships<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Strong trading systems knowledge. Trading systems implementation experience will be an advantage.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> A team player with the capability in working with virtual teams<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> An innovative place to work<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> About Shell Singapore <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p>Shell is one the largest foreign investors in Singapore and began operations in 1891. Today, we have more than 3,200 employees in Singapore alone. The Pulau Bukom Manufacturing Site today is the largest Shell refinery in the world in terms of crude distillation capacity, which makes Singapore a key regional supply and trading centre for Shell in the East. Singapore is the largest petrochemical production and export centre in the Asia Pacific region. Shell Jurong Island (SJI) manufactures petrochemicals to meet the fast-growing demand for these products in the region. We also have one of the largest single-branded retail networks in Singapore, providing customers with a wide range of quality products and services. When you join Shell in Singapore, you can count on our commitment to help you thrive and propel your career by means of our industry-leading development programme and our available and unrivalled pool of local and global experts. Our numerous global and local skill pools as well as our diversity are key to our success and continuing innovation.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><b><br> An innovative place to work<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p> There’s never been a more exciting time to work at Shell. Everyone here is helping solve one of the biggest challenges facing the world today: bringing the benefits of energy to everyone on the planet, whilst managing the risks of climate change.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> Join us and you’ll be adding your talent and imagination to a business with the ambition to shape the future – whether by investing in renewables, exploring new ways to store energy or developing technology that helps the world to use energy more efficiently, everyone at Shell does their part.<br> <br> <b>An inclusive place to work<\u002Fb><br> To power progress together, we need to attract and develop the brightest minds and make sure every voice is heard. Here are just some of the ways we are nurturing an inclusive environment – one where you can express your ideas, extend your skills and reach your potential<\u002Fp>\n  <ul>\n   <li> We’re creating a space where people with disabilities can excel through transparent recruitment process, workplace adjustments and ongoing support in their roles. Feel free to let us know about your circumstances when you apply, and we’ll take it from there.<\u002Fli>\n   <li> We’re closing the gender gap – whether that’s through action on equal pay or by enabling more women to reach senior roles in engineering and technology.<\u002Fli>\n   <li> We’re striving to be a pioneer of an inclusive and diverse workplace, promoting equality for employees regardless of sexual orientation or gender identity.<\u002Fli>\n   <li> We consider ourselves a flexible employer and want to support you finding the right balance. We encourage you to discuss this with us in your application.<\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n  <p><b><br> A rewarding place to work<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p> Combine our creative, collaborative environment and global operations with an impressive range of benefits and joining Shell becomes an inspired career choice.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> We’re huge advocates for career development. We’ll encourage you to try new roles and experience new settings. By pushing people to reach their potential, we frequently help them find skills they never knew they had, or make career moves they never thought possible.<\u002Fp>\n  <br> \n <\u002Fdiv>\n <p><\u002Fp> \n <div>\n  <h3 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><p>Disclaimer <\u002Fp><\u002Fh3>\n  <div>\n   <div>\n    Please note: We occasionally amend or withdraw Shell jobs and reserve the right to do so at any time, including prior to the advertised closing date. The Shell Group and its approved recruitment consultants will never ask you for a fee to process or consider your application for a career with Shell. Anyone who demands such a fee is not an authorised Shell representative and you are strongly advised to refuse any such demand. Shell is an Equal Opportunity Employer.\n   <\u002Fdiv>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b>The Role<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2> \n <div>\n  <p><b>Where you fit in<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> Shell has the ambition to deliver a significant new market for LNG as a transport fuel, with Shell DLNG (Downstream LNG) aspiring to be the global market leader in marine transport fuel. Shell has pioneered in this market since 2011 and has built a material Marine LNG presence in Rotterdam, Singapore, Mediterranean, and Americas (USEC, US GOM, and Caribbean) leveraging the global SLMT footprint.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> What’s the role?<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> This role is accountable for the development of innovative deal structures within DLNG portfolio requiring valuation &amp; creativity as well as analyzing the risk created to grow the portfolio comprising innovative supply deals and sale of LNG to third party marine customers.<\u002Fp>\n  <ul>\n   <li><p> Responsible for economic modelling, Risk analysis and managing exposures that are created upon execution. The individual will participate in deal structuring discussions and advice on purchase and sales prices for the mid &amp; long-term timeframe with an overview of the Supply &amp; demand fundamentals.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Responsible for ensuring that the SLMT deal process is followed for all deals and the resulting exposure from new deals is properly captured and represented in all systems.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> Specifically, this role requires:<\u002Fp>\n  <ul>\n   <li><p> Determining fit for purpose deal structures for mid &amp; long-term deals, connecting the business case for Marine LNG externally and leading to profitable deals.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Determining purchase and sales prices for mid &amp; long-term Supply as well as shorts into third parties.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Detailed economic analysis and risk assessments for mid &amp; long-term deals.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Structure mid &amp; long-term infrastructure solutions with a focus on Shipping and run calculations\u002Feconomics to justify investment case.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Structure mid &amp; long-term storage and reload solutions and run calculations\u002Feconomics.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Provide insight and steer on Infrastructure (Shipping, Storage Reload) portfolio anticipating future demand.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Identify exposure and recommend hedging strategies for term deals.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Provide exposure overview of the DLNG portfolio.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Liaise with Business Development, Short-Term Trading, Shipping and Risk Management.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Manage the interface between Short-Term and Mid-Term opportunities:<\u002Fp>\n    <ul>\n     <li><p> Leveraging our global footprint to tailor products for customer needs whilst extracting maximum value for Shell<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n     <li><p> Work closely with colleagues from Portfolio Trading (Conventional LNG) to align views, processes, market dynamics<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n    <\u002Ful><\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> What we need from you<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> A successful candidate will have a self-starter mentality; a person that can work in an uncertain environment and be curious enough to learn from all parts of the business and beyond to come up with resilient and value-added deal structures. Other key attributes include:<\u002Fp>\n  <ul>\n   <li><p> Excellent analytical and financial skills, business acumen, and demonstrated achievement<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Experience with trading and risk management tools and techniques<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Excellent written, oral communication and presentation skills<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Proven communication skills with third parties, and good interpersonal skills with all levels in the organization and across cultures<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Proven ability to work successfully in complex business dealings with a good attention to detail<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Commerciality is a key factor for success in this role, preferably in supply and trading<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Ideally a Trading LNG or Gas professional with some commercial experience. While it is recognized that candidates may not have Gas\u002FLNG experience, experience in and knowledge of a commercial role are important criteria.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Experience in a trading environment and\u002For Maritime environment will be a significant advantage<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Candidates with a strong quantitative background and an understanding of Trading will be prime candidates for shortlisting.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> Company Description<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> Shell is one the largest foreign investors in Singapore and began operations in 1891. Today, we have more than 3,200 employees in Singapore alone. The Pulau Bukom Manufacturing Site today is the largest Shell refinery in the world in terms of crude distillation capacity, which makes Singapore a key regional supply and trading centre for Shell in the East. Singapore is the largest petrochemical production and export centre in the Asia Pacific region. Shell Jurong Island (SJI) manufactures petrochemicals to meet the fast-growing demand for these products in the region. We also have one of the largest single-branded retail networks in Singapore, providing customers with a wide range of quality products and services. When you join Shell in Singapore, you can count on our commitment to help you thrive and propel your career by means of our industry-leading development programme and our available and unrivalled pool of local and global experts. Our numerous global and local skill pools as well as our diversity are key to our success and continuing innovation.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> An innovative place to work <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p>There’s never been a more exciting time to work at Shell.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> Join us and you’ll be adding your talent and imagination to a business with the ambition to shape the future – whether by investing in oil, gas, and renewable energy to meet demand, exploring new ways to store energy, or developing technology that helps the world to use energy more efficiently, everyone at Shell does their part.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> An inclusive place to work <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p>To power progress, we need to attract and develop the brightest minds and make sure every voice is heard. Here are just some of the ways we are nurturing an inclusive environment – one where you can express your ideas, extend your skills, and reach your potential.<\u002Fp>\n  <ul>\n   <li><p> We’re creating a space where people with disabilities can excel through transparent recruitment process, workplace adjustments and ongoing support in their roles. Feel free to let us know about your circumstances when you apply, and we’ll take it from there.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> We’re closing the gender gap – whether that’s through action on equal pay or by enabling more women to reach senior roles in engineering and technology.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> We’re striving to be a pioneer of an inclusive and diverse workplace, promoting equality for employees regardless of sexual orientation or gender identity.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> We consider ourselves a flexible employer and want to support you finding the right balance. We encourage you to discuss this with us in your application.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> A rewarding place to work <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p>Combine our creative, collaborative environment and global operations with an impressive range of benefits and joining Shell becomes an inspired career choice.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> We’re huge advocates for career development. We’ll encourage you to try new roles and experience new settings. By pushing people to reach their potential, we frequently help them find skills they never knew they had, or make career moves they never thought possible.<\u002Fp>\n  <br> \n  <p><\u002Fp> \n <\u002Fdiv>\n <p><\u002Fp> \n <div>\n  <h3 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><p>Disclaimer <\u002Fp><\u002Fh3>\n  <div>\n   <div>\n    Please note: We occasionally amend or withdraw Shell jobs and reserve the right to do so at any time, including prior to the advertised closing date.
