<h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b>The Role<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2> \n <div>\n  <p><b>Where you fit in<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p> You will work on Shell Jurong Island, together with a team of technologists supporting Production Unit 3 in reliable production, sustainability, and safety. You will also be involved in project design and implementation to keep Production Unit 3 ready for the future. Production Unit 3 includes Ethylene Oxide and Glycol (EOG) plants including High Purity Ethylene Oxide (HPEO) units as well as Ethoxylates units (EOD).<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> What’s the role? <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p>Your major responsibilities are to provide support to the plants in the following areas:<\u002Fp>\n  <ul>\n   <li><p> To contribute to the continuous improvement of the operational safety, operational reliability, efficiency, and unit performance at our plants. Provide on demand assistance, guidance, and advice such as troubleshooting to Operations leading to optimal operation of the assets.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Capture process data through daily and long-term monitoring and share\u002Freview these data with the integrated plant team. Where necessary, you develop and propose corrective actions in a drive for constant improvement for the plant.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Responsible for working in a safe manner and demonstrating a personal commitment to both personal and process safety.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Develop guidelines for operation within the design envelope of the process and equipment and to enhance the reliability of the facilities (operating windows, corrosion loops, Instrumented Protective Function classifications, operating manuals).<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Support and follow up (gap closure) of studies on process safety (such as Process Safety Analysis, Bowtie review, Safety Instrumented Systems review) and reliability (Integrity Operating Window review, Managing Threats, and Opportunities).<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Provide coaching to junior technologists, as well as showing a drive to develop yourself.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Responsible for working with and growing with the management systems used to run SJI.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Ensure technical assurance and technical integrity of proposed plant changes by leading multi-disciplinary team reviews, challenge sessions, etc. This includes leading or participating in project development or execution.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Plan, conduct, and document test runs to improve unit performance.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Contribute to the technology development plan for the asset by proposing and implementing process technology improvements and determining the economics of the proposed changes.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Generate, develop, and implement innovative solutions to technical or operational problems.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Contribute to multifunctional teams in site wide initiatives, such as participation in unit shutdown preparation and coordination. Support turnaround and catalyst change activities.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Build effective network in the EOG community via existing networks and evaluate best practices from other sites operating EOG units for deployment in SJI units.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> What we need from you<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p> We hope to see as many of the following:<\u002Fp>\n  <ul>\n   <li><p> Educated in technical or engineering discipline at tertiary level, preferably in Chemical Engineering.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Have around 6-8 years technology experience in manufacturing units and\u002For design office.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> EO and glycols experience, either in operations and\u002For technology is preferred but not required.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Possesses strong communication skills (both oral and written), and interpersonal \u002F stakeholder management skills.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> A team player with the ability to lead change and deliver results via teamwork.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Experience in providing supervision and mentorship to junior team members.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> Company description<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p> Shell is one the largest foreign investors in Singapore and began operations in 1891. Today, we have more than 3,200 employees in Singapore, and over 80,000 worldwide. Singapore is the largest petrochemical production and export centre in the Asia Pacific region. Shell Jurong Island (SJI) manufactures petrochemicals to meet the fast-growing demand for these products in the region. The Pulau Bukom Manufacturing Site is Shell’s largest refinery in terms of crude feed capacity, and together with SJI makes Singapore a key regional supply and trading centre for Shell in the East. We also have one of the largest single-branded retail networks in Singapore, providing customers with a wide range of quality products and services. When you join Shell in Singapore, you can count on our commitment to help you thrive and propel your career by means of our industry-leading development programme and our available and unrivalled pool of local and global experts. Our numerous global and local skill pools as well as our diversity are key to our success and continuing innovation.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><b><br> An innovative place to work <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p>There’s never been a more exciting time to work at Shell, especially as an engineer, there are few manufacturing sites globally that can challenge the diverse work you can find at Shell Singapore.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> Join us and you’ll be adding your talent and imagination to a business with the ambition to shape the future of energy – whether by investing in oil, gas and renewable energy to meet demand, exploring new ways to store energy, or developing technology that helps the world to use energy more efficiently. Everyone at Shell is playing a part in progressing the energy transition towards a sustainable future.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> An inclusive place to work <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p>To power progress, we need to attract and develop the brightest minds and make sure every voice is heard. Here are just some of the ways we are nurturing an inclusive environment – one where you can express your ideas, extend your skills, and reach your potential.<\u002Fp>\n  <ul>\n   <li><p> We’re creating a space where people with disabilities can excel through transparent recruitment process, workplace adjustments and ongoing support in their roles. Feel free to let us know about your circumstances when you apply, and we’ll take it from there.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> We’re closing the gender gap – whether that’s through action on equal pay or by enabling more women to reach senior roles in engineering and technology.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> We’re striving to be a pioneer of an inclusive and diverse workplace, promoting equality for employees regardless of sexual orientation or gender identity.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> We consider ourselves a flexible employer and want to support you finding the right balance. We encourage you to discuss this with us in your application.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> A rewarding place to work <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p>Combine our creative, collaborative environment and global operations with an impressive range of benefits and joining Shell becomes an inspired career choice.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> We’re huge advocates for career development. We’ll encourage you to try new roles and experience new settings. By pushing people to reach their potential, we frequently help them find skills they never knew they had, or make career moves they never thought possible.<\u002Fp>\n  <br> \n <\u002Fdiv>\n <p><\u002Fp> \n <div>\n  <h3 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><p>Disclaimer <\u002Fp><\u002Fh3>\n  <div>\n   <div>\n    Please note: We occasionally amend or withdraw Shell jobs and reserve the right to do so at any time, including prior to the advertised closing date. Before applying, you are advised to read our data protection policy. This policy describes the processing that may be associated with your personal data and informs you that your personal data may be transferred to Shell\u002FShell Group companies around the world. The Shell Group and its approved recruitment consultants will never ask you for a fee to process or consider your application for a career with Shell. Anyone who demands such a fee is not an authorised Shell representative and you are strongly advised to refuse any such demand. Shell is an Equal Opportunity Employer.\n   <\u002Fdiv>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b>The Role<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2> \n <div>\n  <p><b>What’s the role? <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p>You will deliver Turnaround premises via planning and execution of turnaround activities safely, efficiently and in accordance with applicable premises, AMS TA work processes, and applicable standards.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> You accountabilities include the following:<\u002Fp>\n  <ul>\n   <li><p> Develop in-depth familiarity with Shell Asset Management System TA Work Processes, and Recommended Practices and assist Event Manager in driving assigned associated deliverables.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Participate in TA Contracting Management.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Drive schedule reviews for critical operations and maintenance tasks.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> To ensure Shell Jurong Island (SJI)’s assets operate safely &amp; reliably, without suffering any process safety incident or causing life-changing events to person(s), the staff is accountable to ensure compliance to those Critical Activities assigned.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Ensures environmental plan (waste disposal, frac tanks, vac trucks, etc) is developed.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Coordinate risk assessments and mitigation implementation for high-risk activities. Communicates key issues and risks to the TA Event Manager.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Support MOC process for TA activities, including necessary temporary facilities, as required.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Act as Focal point in TA plan-the-plan tracking. Function as a Block Leader for high complexity event, or act as Night Shift Lead during TA execution, or lead a Low complexity TA. Perform deputy roles for Leads during the absence of the Leads or when assigned, as part of development and business expectations.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Organize and facilitate TA related workshops such as readiness reviews, scope challenge, cost\u002F financial reviews, team alignment, lookbacks etc.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Provides a critique of turnaround activities after completion of project, facilitate Continuous Improvement (CI) programs in TA, starting to development of initiatives to alignment throughout the event team to execution.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Organise review of TA related plans such as HSSE, Flawless Quality, Logistics, Pre-TA works etc.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Assesses job to understand the optimal plan to achieve turnaround premises including low cost and safety performance. Understand interfaces between TA Planning and other functions and facilitates communication between all work groups as appropriate.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Works with Master Scheduler to optimize the master schedule &amp; perform field verification of work described in approved work scope submissions and develops detailed Primavera work scope activities, with craft type and estimated hours, coding requirements etc.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Management of turnaround files and records. Participate in drafting of investment paper for submission.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Participate in development of event organization with Event Manager. Assembles work packages with detailed information for planning and execution.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Able to perform detail planning for mechanical discipline including piping &amp; static equipment &amp; identify resources for execution. Able to identify &amp; purchase materials required during planning phase.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Work with Contractor to develop Workpacks for execution. Assigned as Contract Holders for Medium and Low risk contract specific to the Production Unit.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> What we need from you<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <ul>\n   <li><p> Educated in technical or engineering discipline at tertiary level, preferably in Mechanical Engineering<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> 6-8 years of proven experience within an Oil and Gas or Process environment, or relevant industries<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Ability to work cohesively as part of a multi-disciplinary operations team<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Strong verbal, and written communication skills<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Demonstrated competency to provide a high standard of services to internal customers<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Awareness of environmental health and safety legislation as applicable to the operation and maintenance of facilities, commitment to safety, strong safety culture\u002Fleadership<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> Company description<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p> Shell is one the largest foreign investors in Singapore and began operations in 1891. Today, we have more than 3,200 employees in Singapore alone. The Pulau Bukom Manufacturing Site today is the largest Shell refinery in the world in terms of crude distillation capacity, which makes Singapore a key regional supply and trading centre for Shell in the East. Singapore is the largest petrochemical production and export centre in the Asia Pacific region. Shell Jurong Island (SJI) manufactures petrochemicals to meet the fast-growing demand for these products in the region. We also have one of the largest single-branded retail networks in Singapore, providing customers with a wide range of quality products and services. When you join Shell in Singapore, you can count on our commitment to help you thrive and propel your career by means of our industry-leading development programme and our available and unrivalled pool of local and global experts. Our numerous global and local skill pools as well as our diversity are key to our success and continuing innovation.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><b><br> An innovative place to work <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p>There’s never been a more exciting time to work at Shell.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> Join us and you’ll be adding your talent and imagination to a business with the ambition to shape the future – whether by investing in oil, gas and renewable energy to meet demand, exploring new ways to store energy, or developing technology that helps the world to use energy more efficiently, everyone at Shell does their part.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> An inclusive place to work <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p>To power progress, we need to attract and develop the brightest minds and make sure every voice is heard. Here are just some of the ways we are nurturing an inclusive environment – one where you can express your ideas, extend your skills, and reach your potential.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <ul>\n   <li><p> We’re creating a space where people with disabilities can excel through transparent recruitment process, workplace adjustments and ongoing support in their roles. Feel free to let us know about your circumstances when you apply, and we’ll take it from there.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> We’re closing the gender gap – whether that’s through action on equal pay or by enabling more women to reach senior roles in engineering and technology.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> We’re striving to be a pioneer of an inclusive and diverse workplace, promoting equality for employees regardless of sexual orientation or gender identity.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> We consider ourselves a flexible employer and want to support you finding the right balance. We encourage you to discuss this with us in your application.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> A rewarding place to work <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p>Combine our creative, collaborative environment and global operations with an impressive range of benefits and joining Shell becomes an inspired career choice.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> We’re huge advocates for career development. We’ll encourage you to try new roles and experience new settings. By pushing people to reach their potential, we frequently help them find skills they never knew they had, or make career moves they never thought possible.<\u002Fp>\n  <br> \n <\u002Fdiv>\n <p><\u002Fp> \n <div>\n  <h3 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><p>Disclaimer <\u002Fp><\u002Fh3>\n  <div>\n   <div>\n    Please note: We occasionally amend or withdraw Shell jobs and reserve the right to do so at any time, including prior to the advertised closing date. <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b>The Role<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2> \n <p><\u002Fp>\n <div>\n  <div>\n   <div>\n    <div>\n     <div>\n      <p>Shell Catalyst and Technologies (SC&amp;T) has an opening for a senior technical engineer to support its Hydrocracking catalyst business. In this role, the individual will work with SC&amp;T account managers as they develop technical and commercial proposals related to the refining catalyst business, as well as supporting third party customers in the operation of their hydrotreating applications.<br> <br> This role of Senior Technical Service Engineer (TSE) reports to the Hydro\u002FHC Tech Solutions Manager APR. The role is located at Singapore.<br> <br> <b>Where you fit in?<\u002Fb><br> <br> SC&amp;T is a customer facing organization that brings high value, differentiated technologies to the market. These technologies include a portfolio of hydrotreating and hydrocracking catalysts from its refining catalyst line. SC&amp;T supports these catalysts through their entire lifecycle by providing best-in-class technical service. It is the role of the Senior TSE to support the sales of these catalyst products as well as the customers who use them. The role is highly customer focused, requiring commercial skills in addition to technical capabilities. Our culture in SC&amp;T is one of Humility, Curiosity, Commercial Excellence, Determination, but above all putting the customer first.<br> <br> <b>What is the role?<\u002Fb><br> <br> The Senior Technical Service Engineer will be accountable for providing customer and sales support associated with refinery hydro-processing\u002Fhydrocracking catalyst customers. The Senior TSE will be a member of a larger technical support team and will work closely with the sales team on specific customer accounts. Specific role functions include:<\u002Fp>\n      <ul>\n       <li> Preparing catalyst performance estimates and complex technical proposals in response to customer requests.<\u002Fli>\n       <li> Supporting customers through the catalyst loading, activation and start-up process.<\u002Fli>\n       <li> Supporting customer’s hydrotreating\u002Fhydrocracking unit operation through analysis of data and assistance in troubleshooting efforts.<\u002Fli>\n       <li> Using and improving catalyst performance models as a tool to support the catalyst business.<\u002Fli>\n       <li> Documenting successes that customers achieve with SC&amp;T catalysts and technical support and sharing knowledge gained from these successes within the organization, helping to further strengthen SC&amp;T’s technical and commercial positions.<\u002Fli>\n       <li> Preparing complex technical proposals in response to refinery customer requests as well as engineering design firms and\u002For internal hydro-processing\u002Fhydrocracking process licensing teams.<\u002Fli>\n       <li> Building of positive working relationships with customer’s technical staff, achieving a position of trusted advisor with the customer.<\u002Fli>\n       <li> Supporting and mentoring junior TSE staff members.<\u002Fli>\n       <li> Supporting the sales staff by providing commercial insights on customer needs and drivers.<\u002Fli>\n      <\u002Ful>\n      <p><b><br> What we need from you<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n      <ul>\n       <li> BS Chemical Engineering or comparable science\u002Fengineering degree.<\u002Fli>\n       <li> At least 8 years’ experience in technical support of refinery operation, refinery planning, hydro processing process design, and\u002For refining catalysts support.<\u002Fli>\n       <li> Experience in hydrocracking preferred but general background in hydroprocessing and other catalytic processes will also be considered.<\u002Fli>\n       <li> Strong technical and problem-solving skills with the ability to diagnose unique and challenging operational issues.<\u002Fli>\n       <li> Strong writing, presentation and communication skills.<\u002Fli>\n       <li> Strong commercial skills in the area of 4D (discover, diagnose, develop, deliver).<\u002Fli>\n       <li> Ability to travel 30% of the time.<\u002Fli>\n       <li> Organizational skills to multi-task and manage several projects and customers at the same time.<\u002Fli>\n       <li> High degree of confidence with the ability to earn the status of trusted advisor with a customer base of experienced and knowledgeable refining personnel.<\u002Fli>\n      <\u002Ful>\n      <p><\u002Fp>\n      <p><b> Company Description<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n      <p><\u002Fp>\n      <p> Shell is one the largest foreign investors in Singapore and began operations in 1891. Today, we have more than 3,200 employees in Singapore alone. The Pulau Bukom Manufacturing Site today is the largest Shell refinery in the world in terms of crude distillation capacity, which makes Singapore a key regional supply and trading centre for Shell in the East. Singapore is the largest petrochemical production and export centre in the Asia Pacific region. Shell Jurong Island (SJI) manufactures petrochemicals to meet the fast-growing demand for these products in the region. We also have one of the largest single-branded retail networks in Singapore, providing customers with a wide range of quality products and services. When you join Shell in Singapore, you can count on our commitment to help you thrive and propel your career by means of our industry-leading development programme and our available and unrivalled pool of local and global experts. Our numerous global and local skill pools as well as our diversity are key to our success and continuing innovation.<\u002Fp>\n      <p><\u002Fp>\n      <p><b> An innovative place to work <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n      <p><\u002Fp>\n      <p>There’s never been a more exciting time to work at Shell.<\u002Fp>\n      <p><\u002Fp>\n      <p> Join us and you’ll be adding your talent and imagination to a business with the ambition to shape the future – whether by investing in oil, gas, and renewable energy to meet demand, exploring new ways to store energy, or developing technology that helps the world to use energy more efficiently, everyone at Shell does their part.<\u002Fp>\n      <p><\u002Fp>\n      <p><b> An inclusive place to work <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n      <p><\u002Fp>\n      <p>To power progress, we need to attract and develop the brightest minds and make sure every voice is heard. Here are just some of the ways we are nurturing an inclusive environment – one where you can express your ideas, extend your skills, and reach your potential.<\u002Fp>\n      <ul>\n       <li><p> We’re creating a space where people with disabilities can excel through transparent recruitment process, workplace adjustments and ongoing support in their roles. Feel free to let us know about your circumstances when you apply, and we’ll take it from there.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n       <li><p> We’re closing the gender gap – whether that’s through action on equal pay or by enabling more women to reach senior roles in engineering and technology.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n       <li><p> We’re striving to be a pioneer of an inclusive and diverse workplace, promoting equality for employees regardless of sexual orientation or gender identity.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n       <li><p> We consider ourselves a flexible employer and want to support you finding the right balance. We encourage you to discuss this with us in your application.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n      <\u002Ful>\n      <p><\u002Fp>\n      <p><b> A rewarding place to work <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n      <p><\u002Fp>\n      <p>Combine our creative, collaborative environment and global operations with an impressive range of benefits and joining Shell becomes an inspired career choice.<\u002Fp>\n      <p><\u002Fp>\n      <p> We’re huge advocates for career development. We’ll encourage you to try new roles and experience new settings. By pushing people to reach their potential, we frequently help them find skills they never knew they had, or make career moves they never thought possible.<\u002Fp>\n     <\u002Fdiv>\n    <\u002Fdiv>\n   <\u002Fdiv>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <br> \n <\u002Fdiv>\n <p><\u002Fp> \n <div>\n  <h3 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><p>Disclaimer <\u002Fp><\u002Fh3>\n  <div>\n   <div>\n    Please note: We occasionally amend or withdraw Shell jobs and reserve the right to do so at any time, including prior to the advertised closing date. <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b>The Role<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2> \n <div>\n  <p><b>Where you fit in<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> The Acquisitions, Divestments and New Business Development (“<b>Deal Making<\u002Fb>”) team focused on the Renewables and Energy Solutions (“<b>RES<\u002Fb>”) business is seeking a <b>Deal Lead<\u002Fb> to join the team with a specific focus on the Asia region. Deal Making is at the heart of the portfolio transformations and complex negotiations required to deliver Shell’s strategic intent.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> This is a senior position that plays a key role in originating and executing direct equity investments in RES projects and companies covering power generation (onshore and offshore renewables, and gas), power trading and retail, hydrogen, nature-based solutions and carbon, capture and storage.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> This role is ideal for highly motivated experienced candidates who enjoy working in a fast-paced international environment and have a passion for new business development within the energy industry. The candidate should possess a strong network of contacts, and experience in the renewables and energy solutions space in Asia.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> The Team<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> The regional team headquartered in Singapore covers potential investments across APAC and Australia and works on an integrated basis with teams based in London, the Hague and Houston. The team closed several transactions in 2022 such as acquisition of Powershop (a B2C retailer) in Australia, set-up of a solar JV in the Philippines and the acquisition of Sprng Energy (solar and wind developer) in India. This position will be expected to collaborate closely with teams in Europe and the US while participating in groupwide activities and support of broader deal execution processes. If you excel in an integrative project environment, have strong commercial acumen and a passion for learning and end-to-end entrepreneurial spirit that drives value and manages risk, this team is for you.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> What's the role?<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <ul>\n   <li><b><i> Investment Strategy (Origination)<\u002Fi><\u002Fb><b> – <\u002Fb>Based on a strong sector understanding and relationships, the candidate will develop and pursue investment ideas. They will manage the investment screening process in coordination with other regional and business teams. They will be able to apply investment judgement and rigor to deal pipeline and have a strong understanding of value creation strategies, portfolio construction, risk-reward sharing etc.<\u002Fli>\n   <li><b><i> Direct Investments (Execution)<\u002Fi><\u002Fb> – The candidate will lead due diligence, structuring, negotiation and closing of RES investment opportunities in Asia. In addition to representing Shell externally for negotiation and execution of transaction documentation, the candidate leads communications with internal committees, identifies and manages external advisors for due diligence and process management. They can oversee internal valuation of sophisticated investment opportunities and can identify and mitigate risks while making clear investment recommendations to senior management. The candidate is focused on long-term value creation including set-up of value tracking KPIs at the investment stage.<\u002Fli>\n   <li><b><i> Relationships &amp; team building (Leadership)<\u002Fi><\u002Fb> – The candidate will help manage and build global and regional relationships with external stakeholders on behalf of Shell. Further, as a senior member of the RES Deal Making team in the East, the candidate will play a key role in fostering an entrepreneurial, closely knit and collaborating culture within the team. The candidate is resourceful and works constructively with internal and external stakeholders and can switch easily between a “hands-on” style (steps in to achieve results) and “delivering through others” (influence\u002Fcoach other deal team members).<\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> What we need from you? <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <ul>\n   <li>10+ years of experience in corporate development, renewables fund, developer, project finance, investment banking or other energy transition focused roles<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Strong network within Asia across renewable energy and energy transition sectors providing a basis for origination activity<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Proven experience in leading successful deals (sourcing, analysis, due diligence, execution and implementation) including direct experience in geographies across Asia.<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Demonstrated relationship building experience with target management teams, external stakeholders (investment partners, funds, investment banks, due diligence advisors etc.).<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Strong analytical, commercial and financial skills with attention to detail &amp; a hands-on approach (willing to originate and lead transactions on a day-to-day basis)<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Outstanding project management, risk identification and mitigation capabilities, and organizational engagement skills to execute efficiently on multiple opportunities<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Strong believer and compliance with Health, Safety, Security and Environment, and Ethics &amp; Compliance standards.<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Skilled communicator with ability to persuade multicultural teams with internal and external members. Ability to distil complexity into clear and actionable ideas, make investment or divestment recommendations with courage and conviction.<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Team player with strong interpersonal skills and entrepreneurial spirit willing to assume additional responsibilities<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Willingness and ability to travel as needed<\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> None of us has all the skills, so we look for those who want to learn and grow our community capability.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> COMPANY DESCRIPTION<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> Shell is one the largest foreign investors in Singapore and began operations in 1891. Today, we have more than 3,200 employees in Singapore alone. The Pulau Bukom Manufacturing Site today is the largest Shell refinery in the world in terms of crude distillation capacity, which makes Singapore a key regional supply and trading centre for Shell in the East. Singapore is the largest petrochemical production and export centre in the Asia Pacific region. Shell Jurong Island (SJI) manufactures petrochemicals to meet the fast-growing demand for these products in the region. We also have one of the largest single-branded retail networks in Singapore, providing customers with a wide range of quality products and services. When you join Shell in Singapore, you can count on our commitment to help you thrive and propel your career by means of our industry-leading development programme and our available and unrivalled pool of local and global experts. Our numerous global and local skill pools as well as our diversity are key to our success and continuing innovation.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> An innovative place to work<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> There’s never been a more exciting time to work at Shell. Everyone here is helping solve one of the biggest challenges facing the world today: bringing the benefits of energy to everyone on the planet, whilst managing the risks of climate change.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> Join us and you’ll add your talent and imagination to a business with the power to shape the future – whether by investing in renewables, exploring new ways to store energy or developing technology that helps the world to use energy more efficiently.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> An inclusive place to work<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> To power progress together, we need to attract and develop the brightest minds and make sure every voice is heard. Here are just some of the ways we’re nurturing an inclusive environment – one where you can express your ideas, extend your skills and reach your potential.<\u002Fp>\n  <ul>\n   <li> We’re creating a space where people with disabilities can excel through transparent recruitment process, workplace adjustments and ongoing support in their roles. Feel free to let us know about your circumstances when you apply and we’ll take it from there.<\u002Fli>\n   <li> We’re closing the gender gap – whether that’s through action on equal pay or by enabling more women to reach senior roles in engineering and technology.<\u002Fli>\n   <li> We’re striving to be a pioneer of an inclusive and diverse workplace, promoting equality for employees regardless of sexual orientation or gender identity.<\u002Fli>\n   <li> We consider ourselves a flexible employer and want to support you finding the right balance. We encourage you to discuss this with us in your application.<\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> A rewarding place to work<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> Combine our creative, collaborative environment and global operations with an impressive range of benefits and joining Shell becomes an inspired career choice.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> We’re huge advocates for career development. We’ll encourage you to try new roles and experience new settings. By pushing people to reach their potential, we frequently help them find skills they never knew they had, or make career moves they never thought possible.<\u002Fp>\n  <br> \n <\u002Fdiv>\n <p><\u002Fp> \n <div>\n  <h3 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><p>Disclaimer <\u002Fp><\u002Fh3>\n  <div>\n   <div>\n    Please note: We occasionally amend or withdraw Shell jobs and reserve the right to do so at any time, including prior to the advertised closing date. Before applying, you are advised to read our data protection policy. This policy describes the processing that may be associated with your personal data and informs you that your personal data may be transferred to Shell\u002FShell Group companies around the world. The Shell Group and its approved recruitment consultants will never ask you for a fee to process or consider your application for a career with Shell. <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b>The Role<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2> \n <div>\n  <p><b>What’s the role?<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> Reporting to the Manager Compliance Controls, the Specialist Compliance Controls is a member of the T&amp;S Compliance Controls team which has responsibility for the design and documentation of all LOD2 Compliance controls across the T&amp;S compliance risks, as well as support and advice to the business (LOD1) in relation to the design and documentation of LOD1 compliance controls.<\u002Fp>\n  <p> The initial focus of the role includes Financial Crime (AML\u002FKYC, Sanctions and ABC) is expected to expand into the other T&amp;S Compliance Risks (market abuse, licencing etc).<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> The Specialist Compliance Controls will be expected to:<\u002Fp>\n  <ul>\n   <li><p> Develop and maintain of key elements of the T&amp;S Compliance Control Framework for LOD1 (or the business lines);<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Provide SME support and guidance to LOD1 with relation to the design and documentation of Compliance Controls;<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Critically assess the design and suitability of T&amp;S LOD1 Compliance controls, identifying gaps and areas for improvements;<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Support the roll-out and implementation of the LOD1 Compliance Controls;<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Partner as a Compliance Controls SME with other parts of Compliance and other Functions, including Operational Risk, Legal, Finance, Business Excellence and Audit.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Support the embedding of the relevant modules of Metricstream as compliance controls SME.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Be a key member of the compliance team of the Risk Task Force’s controls project working group (LOD1).<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Support the Compliance Controls team with LOD2 Compliance Control work.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> What we need from you<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <ul>\n   <li><p> Experience in supporting the design and maintenance of a robust Compliance Control Framework within a Financial Services or trading firm.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Knowledge of the global Energy markets (Gas, Power, Carbon and Oil) and markets is desirable.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Clear understanding of the “3 Lines of Defence” model and segregation of duties for each LOD.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Understanding of categorisation of Compliance controls and the ability to design and implement a comprehensive Compliance Controls library is desirable.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Excellent written and verbal communication skills.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Ability to interact with a wide range of stakeholders. Credible and persuasive in ensuring the needs of our complex business are fully understood, resolve conflict and deliver tough messages.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Demonstrated ability to collaborate and partner effectively within a global team. Compliance is a foundation of the way in which T&amp;S does business and therefore integrity is one of the fundamental values that we are seeking as part of the T&amp;S Compliance team. We believe integrity is the hallmark of a person who demonstrates sound moral and ethical principles during their work. Integrity is the foundation on which coworkers build relationships, trust, and effective interpersonal relationships. It is essential that the successful candidate will be able to give clear examples of integrity as one of their core values.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> Company Description<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p> Shell is one the largest foreign investors in Singapore and began operations in 1891. Today, we have more than 3,200 employees in Singapore alone. The Pulau Bukom Manufacturing Site today is the largest Shell refinery in the world in terms of crude distillation capacity, which makes Singapore a key regional supply and trading centre for Shell in the East. Singapore is the largest petrochemical production and export centre in the Asia Pacific region. Shell Jurong Island (SJI) manufactures petrochemicals to meet the fast-growing demand for these products in the region. We also have one of the largest single-branded retail networks in Singapore, providing customers with a wide range of quality products and services. When you join Shell in Singapore, you can count on our commitment to help you thrive and propel your career by means of our industry-leading development programme and our available and unrivalled pool of local and global experts. Our numerous global and local skill pools as well as our diversity are key to our success and continuing innovation.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> An innovative place to work <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p>There’s never been a more exciting time to work at Shell.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> Join us and you’ll be adding your talent and imagination to a business with the ambition to shape the future – whether by investing in oil, gas, and renewable energy to meet demand, exploring new ways to store energy, or developing technology that helps the world to use energy more efficiently, everyone at Shell does their part.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> An inclusive place to work <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p>To power progress, we need to attract and develop the brightest minds and make sure every voice is heard. Here are just some of the ways we are nurturing an inclusive environment – one where you can express your ideas, extend your skills, and reach your potential.<\u002Fp>\n  <ul>\n   <li><p> We’re creating a space where people with disabilities can excel through transparent recruitment process, workplace adjustments and ongoing support in their roles. Feel free to let us know about your circumstances when you apply, and we’ll take it from there.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> We’re closing the gender gap – whether that’s through action on equal pay or by enabling more women to reach senior roles in engineering and technology.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> We’re striving to be a pioneer of an inclusive and diverse workplace, promoting equality for employees regardless of sexual orientation or gender identity.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> We consider ourselves a flexible employer and want to support you finding the right balance. We encourage you to discuss this with us in your application.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> A rewarding place to work <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p>Combine our creative, collaborative environment and global operations with an impressive range of benefits and joining Shell becomes an inspired career choice.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> We’re huge advocates for career development. We’ll encourage you to try new roles and experience new settings. By pushing people to reach their potential, we frequently help them find skills they never knew they had, or make career moves they never thought possible.<\u002Fp>\n  <br> \n  <p><\u002Fp> \n <\u002Fdiv>\n <p><\u002Fp> \n <div>\n  <h3 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><p>Disclaimer <\u002Fp><\u002Fh3>\n  <div>\n   <div>\n    Please note: We occasionally amend or withdraw Shell jobs and reserve the right to do so at any time, including prior to the advertised closing date. The Shell Group and its approved recruitment consultants will never ask you for a fee to process or consider your application for a career with Shell. Anyone who demands such a fee is not an authorised Shell representative and you are strongly advised to refuse any such demand. Shell is an Equal Opportunity Employer.\n   <\u002Fdiv>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b>The Role<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2> \n <div>\n  <p><b>What’s the role? <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p>As Facilities Engineering Manager, your key accountabilities include the following:<\u002Fp>\n  <ul>\n   <li><p> Deliver Yearly Mobility Engineering Program in FM (Facility Management) and EPCM (Engineering Procurement Construction Management) through Engineering Partner(s) in a safe manner as per committed cost, time and quality.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Pro-actively drive performance of Opex and Capex programme delivery through business partners to the agreed outcomes (cost, time and quality) without compromising HSSE and Mobility business objectives; drive and run regular performance reviews with the Engineering Partner(s).<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Manage strategic partnership via Engineering companies in supporting Mobility business.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Ensure compliance of E2E Project Management system during project execution.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Support Engineering Partner service Contract Holder (Engineering Manager) to review and optimise Engineering Partner management strategy and KPI scorecard mechanism to drive performance.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Develop and Implement Maintenance plan strategies and targets through Engineering Partner.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Share long-term capital plans with and strive for continuous improvement in the construction delivery in terms of quality, cost, cycle time and HSSE improvement in alignment with the Global Engineering teams.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Develop and manage key stakeholder relationships with other Network functions, Sales &amp; Ops, Marketing, and other internal and external third parties and pro-actively communicate with them in order to deliver the programme through the business partners in an integrated way and in line with Mobility business priority.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Lead and drive HSSE mindset such as Goal Zero and Lifesaving rules within the business partner organization and through them to contractors.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Ensure compliance with and assurance of HSSE policies by business partners and through them, by contractors and support engineering HSSE programs.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Implementation of global best practices and fit for purpose policies and processes for engineering and maintenance in his\u002Fher responsibility area in line with Engineering Strategy for this geography.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> What we need from you<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p> To succeed in this role, you will have:<\u002Fp>\n  <ul>\n   <li><p> Bachelor’s degree in Engineering, preferably Electrical, Civil and Mechanical.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Minimum 3-5 years of relevant experience in engineering or project management.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Extensive experience in managing external parties and proven skills in project management.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Excellent problem-solving and communication skills.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Strong leadership and business acumen.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> A learner mindset and ability to multitask.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> Company Description<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p> Shell is one the largest foreign investors in Singapore and began operations in 1891. Today, we have more than 3,200 employees in Singapore alone. The Pulau Bukom Manufacturing Site today is the largest Shell refinery in the world in terms of crude distillation capacity, which makes Singapore a key regional supply and trading centre for Shell in the East. Singapore is the largest petrochemical production and export centre in the Asia Pacific region. Shell Jurong Island (SJI) manufactures petrochemicals to meet the fast-growing demand for these products in the region. We also have one of the largest single-branded retail networks in Singapore, providing customers with a wide range of quality products and services. When you join Shell in Singapore, you can count on our commitment to help you thrive and propel your career by means of our industry-leading development programme and our available and unrivalled pool of local and global experts. Our numerous global and local skill pools as well as our diversity are key to our success and continuing innovation.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> An innovative place to work <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p>There’s never been a more exciting time to work at Shell.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> Join us and you’ll be adding your talent and imagination to a business with the ambition to shape the future – whether by investing in oil, gas, and renewable energy to meet demand, exploring new ways to store energy, or developing technology that helps the world to use energy more efficiently, everyone at Shell does their part.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> An inclusive place to work <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p>To power progress, we need to attract and develop the brightest minds and make sure every voice is heard. Here are just some of the ways we are nurturing an inclusive environment – one where you can express your ideas, extend your skills, and reach your potential.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <ul>\n   <li><p> We’re creating a space where people with disabilities can excel through transparent recruitment process, workplace adjustments and ongoing support in their roles. Feel free to let us know about your circumstances when you apply, and we’ll take it from there.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> We’re closing the gender gap – whether that’s through action on equal pay or by enabling more women to reach senior roles in engineering and technology.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> We’re striving to be a pioneer of an inclusive and diverse workplace, promoting equality for employees regardless of sexual orientation or gender identity.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> We consider ourselves a flexible employer and want to support you finding the right balance. We encourage you to discuss this with us in your application.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> A rewarding place to work <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p>Combine our creative, collaborative environment and global operations with an impressive range of benefits and joining Shell becomes an inspired career choice.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> We’re huge advocates for career development. We’ll encourage you to try new roles and experience new settings. By pushing people to reach their potential, we frequently help them find skills they never knew they had, or make career moves they never thought possible.<\u002Fp>\n  <br> \n <\u002Fdiv>\n <p><\u002Fp> \n <div>\n  <h3 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><p>Disclaimer <\u002Fp><\u002Fh3>\n  <div>\n   <div>\n    Please note: We occasionally amend or withdraw Shell jobs and reserve the right to do so at any time, including prior to the advertised closing date. Maintenance Engineer, your key accountabilities include the following:<\u002Fp>\n  <ul>\n   <li><p> Deliver maintenance execution of rotating equipment in the production unit. Perform equipment troubleshooting and providing feedback to custodian.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Implementation of LEAN. Ensure Safety, Reliability\u002Fquality &amp; optimum cost during maintenance execution. Ensure compliance of mechanical engineering practices and assets with statutory obligations, Engineering Codes of Practices and Shell Design and Engineering Practices (DEP). Monitor and feedback on the maintenance effectiveness process and take corrective action if required.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Use Computerized Maintenance Management System (CMMS) as a tool to manage maintenance execution. Plan \u002F execute \u002F obtain resources, materials, services, and equipment for Emergency and Schedule Breaker priority work repairs. CMMS administration of time sheets, service, purchase, and material orders.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Use TRACK system to enter all the resources man hrs. Review and communicate daily \u002F weekly schedule assignments with workforce; ensure safe and efficient completion of assigned work.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Field presence and be the focal point of maintenance contractor (craft productivity and quality of work) for effective and efficient execution.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Feedback jobs that roll-over into next week(s) to the scheduler. Feedback to maintenance planning and scheduling. Identify risks for not achieving schedule and taking mitigating action, keeping maintenance team lead informed.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Timely request to operations for maintenance permitting. Work with Execution contractors to verify permit to work and timely submission for review.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Perform shutdown management - planning, preparation &amp; execution.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> What we need from you<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p> To succeed in this role, you will have:<\u002Fp>\n  <ul>\n   <li><p> Diploma\u002FDegree in Mechanical Engineering or equivalent.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Minimum 2-5 years’ experience in engineering\u002Fmaintenance of rotating &amp; static equipment.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Good troubleshooting skills.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Good understanding of the various international mechanical engineering standards.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Able to work independently and yet participate as a member of a multidiscipline team.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> Company Description<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p> Shell is one the largest foreign investors in Singapore and began operations in 1891. Today, we have more than 3,200 employees in Singapore alone. The Pulau Bukom Manufacturing Site today is the largest Shell refinery in the world in terms of crude distillation capacity, which makes Singapore a key regional supply and trading centre for Shell in the East. Singapore is the largest petrochemical production and export centre in the Asia Pacific region. Shell Jurong Island (SJI) manufactures petrochemicals to meet the fast-growing demand for these products in the region. We also have one of the largest single-branded retail networks in Singapore, providing customers with a wide range of quality products and services. When you join Shell in Singapore, you can count on our commitment to help you thrive and propel your career by means of our industry-leading development programme and our available and unrivalled pool of local and global experts. Our numerous global and local skill pools as well as our diversity are key to our success and continuing innovation.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> An innovative place to work <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p>There’s never been a more exciting time to work at Shell.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> Join us and you’ll be adding your talent and imagination to a business with the ambition to shape the future – whether by investing in oil, gas, and renewable energy to meet demand, exploring new ways to store energy, or developing technology that helps the world to use energy more efficiently, everyone at Shell does their part.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> An inclusive place to work <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p>To power progress, we need to attract and develop the brightest minds and make sure every voice is heard. Feel free to let us know about your circumstances when you apply, and we’ll take it from there.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> We’re closing the gender gap – whether that’s through action on equal pay or by enabling more women to reach senior roles in engineering and technology.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> We’re striving to be a pioneer of an inclusive and diverse workplace, promoting equality for employees regardless of sexual orientation or gender identity.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> We consider ourselves a flexible employer and want to support you finding the right balance. We encourage you to discuss this with us in your application.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> A rewarding place to work <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p>Combine our creative, collaborative environment and global operations with an impressive range of benefits and joining Shell becomes an inspired career choice.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> We’re huge advocates for career development. <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b>The Role<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2> \n <div>\n  <p><b>Where you fit in<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p> The Contracts team within the Business Integration &amp; Assurance organisation in the East provides a commercially driven service to the Crude, Products, and SLMT trading teams in, amongst others, SIETCO in Singapore, SELNG in Singapore, SITME in Dubai and various downstream supply business units in the East. The Commercial Advisors in the Contracts team are responsible for the management of the entire trading and supply Contracts process from pre-deal to post-deal contractual activities, providing commercial\u002Fcontractual advice on drafting and reviewing of contracts (including master agreements and confirmations for the derivatives and emissions trading business), and ad hoc problem-solving involving trading and supply contracts. As the Contracts team functions as an integrated team supporting a myriad of activities carried out by various businesses within Trading &amp; Supply, you will be called upon to provide support to various businesses in conjunction with resourcing optimisation and personal development. These businesses include the physical crude and products trading and supply business, the emissions trading business, the derivatives and risk marketing business, the LNG trading business and the downstream LNG business.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> What’s the role? <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p>Accountabilities:<\u002Fp>\n  <ul>\n   <li><p> Provide pre and post deal commercial advice plus general LNG, emissions, derivatives and freight contractual advice to support the Business objectives.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Advise traders of the commercial, contractual and financial risks associated with their business, identifying areas where there are opportunities for value creation as well as areas where the exposure to value leakage exists.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Combine commercial knowledge with contracts expertise to deliver tangible value to Shell's bottom line.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Draft, review and negotiate term deals, tenders, storage agreements, master agreements, single trade agreements, confirmation notices and side letters with customers with an emphasis on negotiating terms and conditions that maximises value and mitigates contractual exposures to minimise profit leakage.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Review and authorise all contracts\u002Fresponses, making modifications where necessary to ensure contracts accurately reflect the terms agreed and to ensure all contracts are fit for purpose prior to dispatch.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Review 3rd party terms and conditions and negotiate amendments as required to minimise contractual exposure and ensure they are acceptable and comply with Shell Group policy and standards whilst at the same time maintaining a keen sense of commercial acumen in empowering the business objectives of creating new and additional channels for trade.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Help find opportunities to increase value by working intimately with trading desks and closely with other businesses across the value chain and advise the trading desks in negotiating complex contractual arrangements and structured contracts in close consultation and collaboration with various functional subject matter experts such as Finance, Credit, Legal etc.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Provide contractual support in drafting and negotiating ad hoc agreements to facilitate new business development\u002Fgrowth projects.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Provide advice, help and commercially astute options in achieving win-win resolutions of contractual disputes with counterparties, liaising with legal counsels as necessary.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Must be accessible to the trading floor and available to engage and collaborate with traders, commercial operations and other functions, taking part in commercial discussions to help deliver the greatest value for Shell. Close collaboration and integration with the business is critical to success.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Maintain an awareness of any new trade opportunities and regulatory restrictions that may involve changes to existing procedures or support processes and remain constantly adaptable towards procedural changes necessary to facilitate such new opportunities without compromising on internal policies and overall governance and risk control framework.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Lead\u002Factively participate in running the Contracts Workshop and administering the Contracts assessment as part of the Trader Development Program and in training new commercial operators and Trading &amp; Supply staff.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Maintain mastery in undertaking the comprehensive role played within Shell's Control Framework and protect Shell's license to operate by ensuring that all contracts comply with all local implementation policies, manual of authorities, business controls, Shell Group policy and standards as well as meet all regulatory and regulated market environments.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Provide cover for the contracts support analyst supporting the environmental products business in the East, where required.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> What we need from you<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p> We hope to see the following in your CV:<\u002Fp>\n  <ul>\n   <li><p> (a) LLB (Hons) degree with at least 5 years post-qualification experience in a (i) law firm; (ii) in-house legal position; or (iii) energy\u002Fcommodity trading or shipping environment in a commercial, operational or legal\u002Fcontract administration role; or (b) Degree with at least 10 years of experience in an energy\u002Fcommodity trading environment in a contract administration role.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Possess strong negotiating skills and be able to manage the expectations of various stakeholders to a contract and across the organisation.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Must have a flexible approach and be commercially focused with the ability to work independently and as part of a team.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Must have the ability to prioritise workload, adhere to tight deadlines and be able to operate under minimal supervision.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Must have strong commercial skills with strong corporate and\u002For transactional experience.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Must be meticulous with a keen eye for detail and able to work in a fast-paced and challenging environment.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Must have good interpersonal skills and be able to communicate effectively with both internal and external customers\u002Fstakeholders.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Must be competent with presentations to a commercial audience and be able to independently undertake face to face collaborations and negotiations with both internal and external<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Must be highly organised and be able to take on records management responsibilities independently.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Must be prepared to undertake Business travel, where required.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Must be fluent in English (verbal &amp; written).<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> Company Description<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p> Shell is one the largest foreign investors in Singapore and began operations in 1891. Today, we have more than 3,200 employees in Singapore alone. The Pulau Bukom Manufacturing Site today is the largest Shell refinery in the world in terms of crude distillation capacity, which makes Singapore a key regional supply and trading centre for Shell in the East. Singapore is the largest petrochemical production and export centre in the Asia Pacific region. Shell Jurong Island (SJI) manufactures petrochemicals to meet the fast-growing demand for these products in the region. We also have one of the largest single-branded retail networks in Singapore, providing customers with a wide range of quality products and services. When you join Shell in Singapore, you can count on our commitment to help you thrive and propel your career by means of our industry-leading development programme and our available and unrivalled pool of local and global experts. Our numerous global and local skill pools as well as our diversity are key to our success and continuing innovation.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> An innovative place to work <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p>There’s never been a more exciting time to work at Shell.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> Join us and you’ll be adding your talent and imagination to a business with the ambition to shape the future – whether by investing in oil, gas, and renewable energy to meet demand, exploring new ways to store energy, or developing technology that helps the world to use energy more efficiently, everyone at Shell does their part.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> An inclusive place to work <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p>To power progress, we need to attract and develop the brightest minds and make sure every voice is heard. Here are just some of the ways we are nurturing an inclusive environment – one where you can express your ideas, extend your skills, and reach your potential.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <ul>\n   <li><p> We’re creating a space where people with disabilities can excel through transparent recruitment process, workplace adjustments and ongoing support in their roles. Feel free to let us know about your circumstances when you apply, and we’ll take it from there.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> We’re closing the gender gap – whether that’s through action on equal pay or by enabling more women to reach senior roles in engineering and technology.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> We’re striving to be a pioneer of an inclusive and diverse workplace, promoting equality for employees regardless of sexual orientation or gender identity.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> We consider ourselves a flexible employer and want to support you finding the right balance. We encourage you to discuss this with us in your application.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> A rewarding place to work <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p>Combine our creative, collaborative environment and global operations with an impressive range of benefits and joining Shell becomes an inspired career choice.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> We’re huge advocates for career development. We’ll encourage you to try new roles and experience new settings. By pushing people to reach their potential, we frequently help them find skills they never knew they had, or make career moves they never thought possible.<\u002Fp>\n  <br> \n <\u002Fdiv>\n <p><\u002Fp> \n <div>\n  <h3 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><p>Translated Company Description <\u002Fp><\u002Fh3>\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <p><\u002Fp>\n <div>\n  <h3 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><p>Disclaimer <\u002Fp><\u002Fh3>\n  <div>\n   <div>\n    Please note: We occasionally amend or withdraw Shell jobs and reserve the right to do so at any time, including prior to the advertised closing date. Before applying, you are advised to read our data protection policy. This policy describes the processing that may be associated with your personal data and informs you that your personal data may be transferred to Shell\u002FShell Group companies around the world. The Shell Group and its approved recruitment consultants will never ask you for a fee to process or consider your application for a career with Shell. Anyone who demands such a fee is not an authorised Shell representative and you are strongly advised to refuse any such demand. Shell is an Equal Opportunity Employer.\n   <\u002Fdiv>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b>The Role<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2> \n <div>\n  <p><b>Where you fit in<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p> Refers to developing, directing, problem solving, and applying technical, scientific, and mathematical knowledge and methods to design, implement, and achieve specified characteristics and criteria for products, processes, or events in the process engineering refining discipline.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> To provide process technological support and assurance to assigned unit(s)- cold and hot utilities for refinery section. Support operational excellence from technology lens. To be the technological conscience for her\u002Fhis unit(s), working with PUDT to ensure the unit is operated optimally within the operating window and works on systematic improvement.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> What’s the role? <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p>As Utilities Technologist, your key accountabilities include the following:<\u002Fp>\n  <ul>\n   <li><p> Monitor unit performance and actively contribute to PU cadence touchpoints.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Perform proactive technological (performance) monitoring.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Perform second-line, more complex troubleshooting RCA's and investigations and delivering simple fit-for-purpose solutions.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Monitor, review, and update unit basic data performance.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Monitor, review and improve unit energy efficiency and environmental performance.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Monitor, review and report out unit performance.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Provide technology support for preparation of (e.g., right scope) and executing turnarounds.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Understand, monitor, and document the technological operating windows of units.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Identify and realize opportunities for improvement of the process in HSSE, capacity, yields, margin, energy, costs, and quality to have the Right Molecule in Right Place all the time.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Define and support development of projects and plant changes. Prepare, support and evaluate test runs.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Fit-for-purpose networking with P&amp;T and sister M-sites to share and keep abreast of best practices.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Demonstrate strong learner mindset and commits to be digitally literate to drive value creation through digitalisation.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Close working relationship with production team and interaction with many different disciplines including P&amp;T.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Develop, maintain, and retain critical technological knowledge.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Own and drive change (e.g., technology, ways of working, opportunity) from initiate to sustain and embed.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> What we need from you<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p> To succeed in this role, you will have:<\u002Fp>\n  <ul>\n   <li><p> Bachelor’s degree in Chemical Engineering or equivalent.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Minimum 3 years of experience in supporting utility systems.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Must have knowledge in utility systems, proven skills in process engineering and strong process safety orientation.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> Company Description<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p> Shell is one the largest foreign investors in Singapore and began operations in 1891. Today, we have more than 3,200 employees in Singapore alone. The Pulau Bukom Manufacturing Site today is the largest Shell refinery in the world in terms of crude distillation capacity, which makes Singapore a key regional supply and trading centre for Shell in the East. Singapore is the largest petrochemical production and export centre in the Asia Pacific region. Shell Jurong Island (SJI) manufactures petrochemicals to meet the fast-growing demand for these products in the region. We also have one of the largest single-branded retail networks in Singapore, providing customers with a wide range of quality products and services. When you join Shell in Singapore, you can count on our commitment to help you thrive and propel your career by means of our industry-leading development programme and our available and unrivalled pool of local and global experts. Our numerous global and local skill pools as well as our diversity are key to our success and continuing innovation.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> An innovative place to work <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p>There’s never been a more exciting time to work at Shell.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> Join us and you’ll be adding your talent and imagination to a business with the ambition to shape the future – whether by investing in oil, gas, and renewable energy to meet demand, exploring new ways to store energy, or developing technology that helps the world to use energy more efficiently, everyone at Shell does their part.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> An inclusive place to work <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p>To power progress, we need to attract and develop the brightest minds and make sure every voice is heard. Here are just some of the ways we are nurturing an inclusive environment – one where you can express your ideas, extend your skills, and reach your potential.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <ul>\n   <li><p> We’re creating a space where people with disabilities can excel through transparent recruitment process, workplace adjustments and ongoing support in their roles. Feel free to let us know about your circumstances when you apply, and we’ll take it from there.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> We’re closing the gender gap – whether that’s through action on equal pay or by enabling more women to reach senior roles in engineering and technology.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> We’re striving to be a pioneer of an inclusive and diverse workplace, promoting equality for employees regardless of sexual orientation or gender identity.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> We consider ourselves a flexible employer and want to support you finding the right balance. We encourage you to discuss this with us in your application.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> A rewarding place to work <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p>Combine our creative, collaborative environment and global operations with an impressive range of benefits and joining Shell becomes an inspired career choice.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> We’re huge advocates for career development. We’ll encourage you to try new roles and experience new settings. By pushing people to reach their potential, we frequently help them find skills they never knew they had, or make career moves they never thought possible.<\u002Fp>\n  <br> \n <\u002Fdiv>\n <p><\u002Fp> \n <div>\n  <h3 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><p>Disclaimer <\u002Fp><\u002Fh3>\n  <div>\n   <div>\n    Please note: We occasionally amend or withdraw Shell jobs and reserve the right to do so at any time, including prior to the advertised closing date.
