<h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b>The Role<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2> \n <div>\n  <p><b>What is the role?<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> Electrical Technician resides in Shell Jurong Island (SJI) Maintenance Department.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> The primary role is to execute Electrical maintenance to the optimum level of performance for safe, reliable, and efficient operation of the plant.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> Your principal accountabilities include:<\u002Fp>\n  <ul>\n   <li><p> Provides day-to-day hands-on maintenance and troubleshooting including contractor\u002Fspecialist management for all Electrical maintenance related matters, delivered with high safety standards, comply to authorities such as EMA ACT, Electricity ACT, local industrial and company HSE standards to ensure the equipment validity and availability.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Adhere to HSSE compliance standards and requirements so as to ensuring that Shell Jurong Island (SJI) a safe place to work, and accountable for all assigned Critical activities<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Participate in FAT\u002FSAT and Functional testing<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Responsible for carrying out preventive and corrective maintenance works and ensuring plant equipment availability.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Prepares job specifications and costing for works involved and apply work clearance \u002F permit for work execution.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Participate and execute for Turnaround\u002F pitstop events in the related Process Units (PUs)<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Perform electrical equipment condition monitoring whenever required &amp; liaise with relevant subject matter experts\u002Fspecialist\u002FOEM to address any arising issues, problems &amp; concerns<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Ensure SJI’s assets operate safely and reliably<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Provide good documentation to ensure all equipment technical records and drawings are updated to reflect the latest changes<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Maintains work requests and records on maintenance works using computerized maintenance management systems<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Attend to callout for the Emergency work upon request<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Carry out electrical QC checks including insulation resistance test, continuity test, loop check, motor winding resistance test.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Report timely to Lead engineer on the progress of work and issues encountered.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> What we need from you<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p> We are keen to hear from candidates with the following experience and qualifications:<\u002Fp>\n  <ul>\n   <li><p> Diploma\u002FITE or equivalent.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> 1-3 years relevant experience in Electrical construction\u002F installation. Those with related work experience in oil &amp; gas, chemical &amp; petrochemical industry will be a plus.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Capable to perform electrical safeguarding checks and capable to assist instrument<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Experience in Plant Turnaround detail planning, preparation, and field execution, as well as Field work interaction and stakeholder’s management<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Experience with Brown field constructions include administration, HSSE and detail field technical work methods will be a plus<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Knowledge of Electrical equipment: switch houses, sub-station, motors, and pumps.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Conversant with HSE and Permit to work requirements in petroleum and petrochemical industry is a plus<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> More about Shell in Singapore<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p> Shell is one the largest foreign investors in Singapore and began operations in 1891. Today, we have more than 3,200 employees in Singapore alone. The Pulau Bukom Manufacturing Site today is the largest Shell refinery in the world in terms of crude distillation capacity, which makes Singapore a key regional supply and trading centre for Shell in the East. Singapore is the largest petrochemical production and export centre in the Asia Pacific region. Shell Jurong Island (SJI) manufactures petrochemicals to meet the fast-growing demand for these products in the region. We also have one of the largest single-branded retail networks in Singapore, providing customers with a wide range of quality products and services. When you join Shell in Singapore, you can count on our commitment to help you thrive and propel your career by means of our industry-leading development programme and our available and unrivalled pool of local and global experts. Our numerous global and local skill pools as well as our diversity are key to our success and continuing innovation.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><b><br> An innovative place to work <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p>There’s never been a more exciting time to work at Shell.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> Join us and you’ll be adding your talent and imagination to a business with the ambition to shape the future – whether by investing in oil, gas and renewable energy to meet demand, exploring new ways to store energy, or developing technology that helps the world to use energy more efficiently, everyone at Shell does their part.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> An inclusive place to work <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p>To power progress, we need to attract and develop the brightest minds and make sure every voice is heard. Here are just some of the ways we are nurturing an inclusive environment – one where you can express your ideas, extend your skills, and reach your potential.<\u002Fp>\n  <ul>\n   <li><p> We’re creating a space where people with disabilities can excel through transparent recruitment process, workplace adjustments and ongoing support in their roles. Feel free to let us know about your circumstances when you apply, and we’ll take it from there.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> We’re closing the gender gap – whether that’s through action on equal pay or by enabling more women to reach senior roles in engineering and technology.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> We’re striving to be a pioneer of an inclusive and diverse workplace, promoting equality for employees regardless of sexual orientation or gender identity.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> We consider ourselves a flexible employer and want to support you finding the right balance. We encourage you to discuss this with us in your application.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> A rewarding place to work <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p>Combine our creative, collaborative environment and global operations with an impressive range of benefits and joining Shell becomes an inspired career choice.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> We’re huge advocates for career development. We’ll encourage you to try new roles and experience new settings. By pushing people to reach their potential, we frequently help them find skills they never knew they had, or make career moves they never thought possible.<\u002Fp>\n  <br> \n  <p><\u002Fp> \n <\u002Fdiv>\n <p><\u002Fp> \n <div>\n  <h3 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><p>Disclaimer <\u002Fp><\u002Fh3>\n  <div>\n   <div>\n    Please note: We occasionally amend or withdraw Shell jobs and reserve the right to do so at any time, including prior to the advertised closing date. Before applying, you are advised to read our data protection policy. This policy describes the processing that may be associated with your personal data and informs you that your personal data may be transferred to Shell\u002FShell Group companies around the world. The Shell Group and its approved recruitment consultants will never ask you for a fee to process or consider your application for a career with Shell. Anyone who demands such a fee is not an authorised Shell representative and you are strongly advised to refuse any such demand. Shell is an Equal Opportunity Employer.\n   <\u002Fdiv>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b>The Role<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2> \n <div>\n  <p><b>Where you fit in<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p> MRTA (Maintenance, Reliability, Turnaround) is about understanding and maintaining our equipment as effectively and efficiently as possible, making sure it performs as intended. The Maintenance discipline covers the development of Maintenance strategies and the planning, coordination, and execution of Maintenance activities. It ensures safe, defect free and efficient operations through the regular upkeep of equipment and tools in the most cost efficient and timely manner.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> What’s the role? <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p>As Maintenance Assistant Engineer (Instrumentation), you will provide technical support, carry out hands-on maintenance and coordinates maintenance work related to QMI in the Production Unit.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> The role assures that activities on the weekly schedule, emergencies or assigned non routine maintenance work are executed with quality and efficiency and in compliance to the site Health, Safety and Environment requirements.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> Your key accountabilities include the following:<\u002Fp>\n  <ul>\n   <li><p> Provide day-to-day hands-on maintenance\u002Ftroubleshooting to QMI related matters in in the Production Unit.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Ensure compliance of engineering practices and assets with statutory obligations.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Engineering Codes of Practices and Shell Design Engineering Practices (DEP) standards. Reviews and communicate daily \u002F weekly schedule assignments with workforce.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Ensure compliance with HSSE standards.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Liaise with\u002Fconsults Operations, Technology, other Engineering and Procurement departments as part of the execution of jobs.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> What we need from you<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p> To succeed in this role, you will have:<\u002Fp>\n  <ul>\n   <li><p> Degree \u002F Diploma in Control \u002F Electronic \u002F Mechatronics \u002F Instrumentation or NITEC in control \u002F Electronic \u002F Mechatronics qualification.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Minimum 3 years of related experience in Instrumentation Engineering \u002F Maintenance field.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Knowledge of DCS\u002FIPS\u002FPRM\u002FGSAP and Foundation fieldbus, Gas Chromatograph (GC) maintenance, and Chemical Processes would be an added advantage.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Able to work independently and yet participate as a member of a multi-discipline team.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Troubleshooting skills and problem-solving skill.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> Company Description<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p> Shell is one the largest foreign investors in Singapore and began operations in 1891. Today, we have more than 3,200 employees in Singapore alone. The Pulau Bukom Manufacturing Site today is the largest Shell refinery in the world in terms of crude distillation capacity, which makes Singapore a key regional supply and trading centre for Shell in the East. Singapore is the largest petrochemical production and export centre in the Asia Pacific region. Shell Jurong Island (SJI) manufactures petrochemicals to meet the fast-growing demand for these products in the region. We also have one of the largest single-branded retail networks in Singapore, providing customers with a wide range of quality products and services. When you join Shell in Singapore, you can count on our commitment to help you thrive and propel your career by means of our industry-leading development programme and our available and unrivalled pool of local and global experts. Our numerous global and local skill pools as well as our diversity are key to our success and continuing innovation.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> An innovative place to work <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p>There’s never been a more exciting time to work at Shell.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> Join us and you’ll be adding your talent and imagination to a business with the ambition to shape the future – whether by investing in oil, gas, and renewable energy to meet demand, exploring new ways to store energy, or developing technology that helps the world to use energy more efficiently, everyone at Shell does their part.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> An inclusive place to work <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p>To power progress, we need to attract and develop the brightest minds and make sure every voice is heard. Here are just some of the ways we are nurturing an inclusive environment – one where you can express your ideas, extend your skills, and reach your potential.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <ul>\n   <li><p> We’re creating a space where people with disabilities can excel through transparent recruitment process, workplace adjustments and ongoing support in their roles. Feel free to let us know about your circumstances when you apply, and we’ll take it from there.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> We’re closing the gender gap – whether that’s through action on equal pay or by enabling more women to reach senior roles in engineering and technology.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> We’re striving to be a pioneer of an inclusive and diverse workplace, promoting equality for employees regardless of sexual orientation or gender identity.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> We consider ourselves a flexible employer and want to support you finding the right balance. We encourage you to discuss this with us in your application.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> A rewarding place to work <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p>Combine our creative, collaborative environment and global operations with an impressive range of benefits and joining Shell becomes an inspired career choice.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> We’re huge advocates for career development. We’ll encourage you to try new roles and experience new settings. By pushing people to reach their potential, we frequently help them find skills they never knew they had, or make career moves they never thought possible.<\u002Fp>\n  <br> \n <\u002Fdiv>\n <p><\u002Fp> \n <div>\n  <h3 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><p>Disclaimer <\u002Fp><\u002Fh3>\n  <div>\n   <div>\n    Please note: We occasionally amend or withdraw Shell jobs and reserve the right to do so at any time, including prior to the advertised closing date. The Shell Group and its approved recruitment consultants will never ask you for a fee to process or consider your application for a career with Shell. Anyone who demands such a fee is not an authorised Shell representative and you are strongly advised to refuse any such demand. Shell is an Equal Opportunity Employer.\n   <\u002Fdiv>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b>The Role<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2> \n <div>\n  <p><b>Where you fit in<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p> You will be responsible for Execution Planning of Capital Projects and Non-Routine Maintenance (NRM), and you will manage the execution activities through construction contractors.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> What’s the role? <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p>As Construction Engineer, your key accountabilities include the following:<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <ul>\n   <li><p> Engineer support site work process and from construction standpoint to ensure no disruption to continuous production and no unnecessary shutdown extension.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Maintain safety compliance to ensure Goal Zero. Engineer needs to keep all the safety measures in mind so that it is needed to work in compliance with the necessary safety norms.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Acquire requisite knowledge about safety hazards and associated risk mitigation steps for process industry.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Ensure quality plan is accordance to business requirement and any non-conformances are close out promptly.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Ensure strategy development for site relating to capital investment is achieved by delivering projects\u002FNRM\u002FPlant Change Request (PCR) on time to cost and to sponsor expectation.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> The position requires the engineer to liaise with Production, HSSE, Inspection, Engineering, Technology, Finance, Logistic, project services department.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> The engineer will also need to manage contractors and third parties completing work at sites.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> The engineer is expected to act independently leading and managing tasks with minimum supervision from lead engineer.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Participate in round table meeting with Production Unit Manager (PUM) to review\u002Fcomment PCRs that are classified as Non-Routine Maintenance tasks.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Participate engineering work review at early stage of the project and Plant Change Request PCR to provide constructive input to design team to prevent rework and optimize execution.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> To manage Plant Change Request (PCR) portfolio to ensure cost and schedule are well within budget and timeline are within RFSU date.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> What we need from you<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p> To succeed in this role, you will have:<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <ul>\n   <li><p> Bachelor’s degree in Engineering<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Minimum of 10 years’ relevant work experience<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p><b> Has proven ability to apply project management principle in execution of capital projects. Has deep capability to assess and evaluate cost, schedule, safety\u002Fintegrity benefits of activities funded through capex\u002Frevex budget.<\u002Fb><\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Has the ability to identify material require to purchase, understand P&amp;ID and evaluate proposal from contractors.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Ability to scope, plan and coordinate non routine maintenance activities on process equipment associated with shutdown, pitstop, catalyst changeout.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p><b> Ability to work and prioritize in a demanding environment.<\u002Fb><\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> Company Description<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p> Shell is one the largest foreign investors in Singapore and began operations in 1891. Today, we have more than 3,200 employees in Singapore alone. The Pulau Bukom Manufacturing Site today is the largest Shell refinery in the world in terms of crude distillation capacity, which makes Singapore a key regional supply and trading centre for Shell in the East. Singapore is the largest petrochemical production and export centre in the Asia Pacific region. Shell Jurong Island (SJI) manufactures petrochemicals to meet the fast-growing demand for these products in the region. We also have one of the largest single-branded retail networks in Singapore, providing customers with a wide range of quality products and services. When you join Shell in Singapore, you can count on our commitment to help you thrive and propel your career by means of our industry-leading development programme and our available and unrivalled pool of local and global experts. Our numerous global and local skill pools as well as our diversity are key to our success and continuing innovation.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> An innovative place to work <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p>There’s never been a more exciting time to work at Shell.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> Join us and you’ll be adding your talent and imagination to a business with the ambition to shape the future – whether by investing in oil, gas, and renewable energy to meet demand, exploring new ways to store energy, or developing technology that helps the world to use energy more efficiently, everyone at Shell does their part.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> An inclusive place to work <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p>To power progress, we need to attract and develop the brightest minds and make sure every voice is heard. Here are just some of the ways we are nurturing an inclusive environment – one where you can express your ideas, extend your skills, and reach your potential.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <ul>\n   <li><p> We’re creating a space where people with disabilities can excel through transparent recruitment process, workplace adjustments and ongoing support in their roles. Feel free to let us know about your circumstances when you apply, and we’ll take it from there.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> We’re closing the gender gap – whether that’s through action on equal pay or by enabling more women to reach senior roles in engineering and technology.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> We’re striving to be a pioneer of an inclusive and diverse workplace, promoting equality for employees regardless of sexual orientation or gender identity.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> We consider ourselves a flexible employer and want to support you finding the right balance. We encourage you to discuss this with us in your application.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> A rewarding place to work <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p>Combine our creative, collaborative environment and global operations with an impressive range of benefits and joining Shell becomes an inspired career choice.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> We’re huge advocates for career development. We’ll encourage you to try new roles and experience new settings. By pushing people to reach their potential, we frequently help them find skills they never knew they had, or make career moves they never thought possible.<\u002Fp>\n  <br> \n <\u002Fdiv>\n <p><\u002Fp> \n <div>\n  <h3 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><p>Disclaimer <\u002Fp><\u002Fh3>\n  <div>\n   <div>\n    Please note: We occasionally amend or withdraw Shell jobs and reserve the right to do so at any time, including prior to the advertised closing date. <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b>The Role<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2> \n <div>\n  <p><b>What is the role?<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p> The role will work with Trading &amp; Supply Commercial representatives to identify fit for purpose second line of defense processes to ensure complete portfolio integrity and determining where and how best to operate these controls.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> In addition, this role will have responsibility for running certain other Market Risk processes and controls as deemed appropriate and necessary.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> The role will lead a team of direct reports, and the role will report to the Global Manager of Market Risk Operations.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> This role will ensure consistent policies, controls, metrics, and systems are in place to ensure compliance with the global Risk Management framework. The role works closely with risk leads for all parts of the risk management spectrum including a significant Business Operations component, the Business Integration organizations, and others with risk management and control responsibilities.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> As a Market Risk Operations Manager, you will be responsible of the following duties:<\u002Fp>\n  <ul>\n   <li><p> The Market Risk Operations group ensures Market Risk processes and controls are run accurately, reliably, and right first time.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> The Market Risk Operations group is also responsible for maintaining observable valuation inputs e.g., exchange prices, broker quotes, derivable volatilities, and correlations to risk calculations.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Understand physical spot price assessments and the construction of forward curves.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Carry out the review and execution of SOX controls and manage communications with auditors after they are completed.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Manage user testing of systems functionality and enhancements while providing feedback to key stakeholders.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Must be a systems and data expert ensuring that knowledge around market risk reference data &amp; forward curve construction is well documented for the benefit of the wider Market Risk team.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Promote a culture of continuous improvement across all levels of the organization by having courage to challenge established processes. This includes identifying inefficiencies in local and global operations and opportunities to streamline and automate shared processes and interfaces.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Ensure process excellence, identifying bottlenecks in Risk processes. Ensuring that error-checking is a natural part of all processes, so output is ‘Right First Time’.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Drive a vision for the team to aspire to and define a clear path to get there, with milestone achievement steps along the way.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Map and document processes, clarify accountabilities, and simplify interfaces to allow the smooth running of the Risk organization.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Accelerate digitalization and automation to smooth the flow of information across the business and to remove manual tasks.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Actively manage resources &amp; processes to optimize the efficient analysis of risk across the portfolio, manage change and prioritize accordingly.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Be an end-to-end deal expert understanding risk at all parts during the life of a deal interacting with the functional experts to help identify and suggest remediation to those risks<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Responsibility for managing and directing team members both as direct reports and some which aren’t direct reports.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> What we need from you<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> We are keen to hear from candidates with the following qualifications\u002Fskills touched by their work experience:<\u002Fp>\n  <ul>\n   <li><p> At least ten (10) years experience within a trading and risk management organization, including a strong understanding of trading, operations, risk, compliance and mid\u002Fback-office business processes, policies, procedures, and controls<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Degree in Business, Economics, Mathematics, Science, Engineering, or IT; or relevant workplace experience in the energy trading industry is required<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Thorough understanding of financial, commodity and energy markets; derivative instruments and hedging techniques<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> About Shell Singapore<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p> Shell is one the largest foreign investors in Singapore and began operations in 1891. Today, we have more than 3,200 employees in Singapore alone. The Pulau Bukom Manufacturing Site today is the largest Shell refinery in the world in terms of crude distillation capacity, which makes Singapore a key regional supply and trading centre for Shell in the East. Singapore is the largest petrochemical production and export centre in the Asia Pacific region. Shell Jurong Island (SJI) manufactures petrochemicals to meet the fast-growing demand for these products in the region. We also have one of the largest single-branded retail networks in Singapore, providing customers with a wide range of quality products and services. When you join Shell in Singapore, you can count on our commitment to help you thrive and propel your career by means of our industry-leading development programme and our available and unrivalled pool of local and global experts. Our numerous global and local skill pools as well as our diversity are key to our success and continuing innovation.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><b><br> An innovative place to work <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p>There’s never been a more exciting time to work at Shell. Everyone here is helping solve one of the biggest challenges facing the world today: bringing the benefits of energy to everyone on the planet, whilst managing the risks of climate change.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> Join us and you’ll be adding your talent and imagination to a business with the ambition to shape the future – whether by investing in renewables, exploring new ways to store energy, or developing technology that helps the world to use energy more efficiently, everyone at Shell does their part.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> An inclusive place to work <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p>To power progress together, we need to attract and develop the brightest minds and make sure every voice is heard. Here are just some of the ways we are nurturing an inclusive environment – one where you can express your ideas, extend your skills, and reach your potential…<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <ul>\n   <li> We’re creating a space where people with disabilities can excel through transparent recruitment process, workplace adjustments and ongoing support in their roles. Feel free to let us know about your circumstances when you apply, and we’ll take it from there.<\u002Fli>\n   <li> We’re closing the gender gap – whether that’s through action on equal pay or by enabling more women to reach senior roles in engineering and technology.<\u002Fli>\n   <li> We’re striving to be a pioneer of an inclusive and diverse workplace, promoting equality for employees regardless of sexual orientation or gender identity.<\u002Fli>\n   <li> We consider ourselves a flexible employer and want to support you finding the right balance. We encourage you to discuss this with us in your application.<\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> A rewarding place to work <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p>Combine our creative, collaborative environment and global operations with an impressive range of benefits and joining Shell becomes an inspired career choice.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> We’re huge advocates for career development. We’ll encourage you to try new roles and experience new settings. By pushing people to reach their potential, we frequently help them find skills they never knew they had, or make career moves they never thought possible.<\u002Fp>\n  <br> \n <\u002Fdiv>\n <p><\u002Fp> \n <div>\n  <h3 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><p>Disclaimer <\u002Fp><\u002Fh3>\n  <div>\n   <div>\n    Please note: We occasionally amend or withdraw Shell jobs and reserve the right to do so at any time, including prior to the advertised closing date. <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b>The Role<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2> \n <div>\n  <p><b>What’s the role?<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> This role will be based in Singapore Jurong Island (SJI).<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <ul>\n   <li> Operate the process units in accordance to Operating Plan, Daily Operating Instructions, Standing Instructions and Site Health, Safety, Security, Environment procedures<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Work with the team to operate the plant within Design-Operating-Window and the Integrity-Operating-Window<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Upon completion of the training and guidance from team, you will perform the structured rounds and take corrective action to maintain equipment and plant operations within safe operating windows.<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Responsible for managing plant and equipment upsets, abnormal conditions and subsequent troubleshooting including incidents\u002Fplant emergencies and subsequent follow-up<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Assist in coordination of daily maintenance planning and participating in shutdown and start-up of units<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Help to update the operating procedures and prepare job pack documentation for equipment repair<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Keeping log records of operational activities for thorough handover to incoming shifts and sharing plant info with other disciplines of the company<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Participating in minor maintenance activities<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Perform the role of Auxiliary Fire Fighter if assigned in the event of emergency situations<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Operate robotic and automation technologies to perform plant surveillances and inspections<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Perform routine field data logging and reporting<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Use new data technologies to monitor plant and equipment performance<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Carry out\u002FPerform other related duties when required\u002Fassigned<\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> What we need from you?<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <ul>\n   <li> Nitec\u002FHigher Nitec in Chemical Process Technology or Diploma in Chemical Engineering \u002F Chemical &amp; Green Technology \u002F Clean Energy<\u002Fli>\n   <li><b> Fresh graduates are welcome to apply as we have a structured In-house training program<\u002Fb><\u002Fli>\n   <li> Strong passion to pursue a career with a forward-looking and dynamic organization<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Team player and keen interest for continual learning<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Ability to perform both Shift work and Day work when the need arises<\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> Shell is one the largest foreign investors in Singapore and began operations in 1891. Today, we have more than 3,200 employees in Singapore alone. The Pulau Bukom Manufacturing Site today is the largest Shell refinery in the world in terms of crude distillation capacity, which makes Singapore a key regional supply and trading centre for Shell in the East. Singapore is the largest petrochemical production and export centre in the Asia Pacific region. Shell Jurong Island (SJI) manufactures petrochemicals to meet the fast-growing demand for these products in the region. We also have one of the largest single-branded retail networks in Singapore, providing customers with a wide range of quality products and services. When you join Shell in Singapore, you can count on our commitment to help you thrive and propel your career by means of our industry-leading development programme and our available and unrivalled pool of local and global experts. Our numerous global and local skill pools as well as our diversity are key to our success and continuing innovation.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><b><br> An innovative place to work <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p>There’s never been a more exciting time to work at Shell. Everyone here is helping solve one of the biggest challenges facing the world today: bringing the benefits of energy to everyone on the planet, whilst managing the risks of climate change.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> Join us and you’ll be adding your talent and imagination to a business with the ambition to shape the future – whether by investing in renewables, exploring new ways to store energy, or developing technology that helps the world to use energy more efficiently, everyone at Shell does their part.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> An inclusive place to work <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p>To power progress together, we need to attract and develop the brightest minds and make sure every voice is heard. Here are just some of the ways we are nurturing an inclusive environment – one where you can express your ideas, extend your skills, and reach your potential…<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <ul>\n   <li> We’re creating a space where people with disabilities can excel through transparent recruitment process, workplace adjustments and ongoing support in their roles. Feel free to let us know about your circumstances when you apply, and we’ll take it from there.<\u002Fli>\n   <li> We’re closing the gender gap – whether that’s through action on equal pay or by enabling more women to reach senior roles in engineering and technology.<\u002Fli>\n   <li> We’re striving to be a pioneer of an inclusive and diverse workplace, promoting equality for employees regardless of sexual orientation or gender identity.<\u002Fli>\n   <li> We consider ourselves a flexible employer and want to support you finding the right balance. We encourage you to discuss this with us in your application.<\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> A rewarding place to work <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p>Combine our creative, collaborative environment and global operations with an impressive range of benefits and joining Shell becomes an inspired career choice.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> We’re huge advocates for career development. We’ll encourage you to try new roles and experience new settings. By pushing people to reach their potential, we frequently help them find skills they never knew they had, or make career moves they never thought possible.<\u002Fp>\n  <br> \n <\u002Fdiv>\n <p><\u002Fp> \n <div>\n  <h3 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><p>Disclaimer <\u002Fp><\u002Fh3>\n  <div>\n   <div>\n    Please note: We occasionally amend or withdraw Shell jobs and reserve the right to do so at any time, including prior to the advertised closing date. The Shell Group and its approved recruitment consultants will never ask you for a fee to process or consider your application for a career with Shell. Anyone who demands such a fee is not an authorised Shell representative and you are strongly advised to refuse any such demand. Shell is an Equal Opportunity Employer.\n   <\u002Fdiv>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b>The Role<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2> \n <div>\n  <p><b>Where you fit in<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p> The Global Freight Trading Analyst position offers the opportunity to join Shell Global Products Freight Trading Team with its challenging, dynamic and fast paced Physical &amp; Paper Freight Trading business environment. The role also offers the ability to develop cutting edge, innovative analysis models to gain the most accurate forward view of the products freight market.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> The role is expected to work closely with Products Freight Traders, Crude Freight team, Freight Forward Agreement (FFA) Traders, Global LR\u002FMR\u002FChemicals\u002FVLGC Book Leads, oil trading desk, oil analysts, STMA team and other parts of Shell to develop first class freight trading analysis. This role together with STASCO based Global Freight Analyst shall form a small analytical team accountable and responsible for global freight trading intel works and at the same time, co-own the FFA analytical book. The role also provides the candidate with further development opportunity into FFA derivatives trading.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> What’s the role? <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p>Accountabilities:<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> Freight Trading Physical Analysis<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <ul>\n   <li><p> Leverage on Shell T&amp;S Strength to consolidate STMA, Oil Trading, Chemicals Trading data and produce fundamental analysis of physical freight trading per vessel segment.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Leverage on external Freight analytical tools for ship counting \u002F tracking for LR2\u002FLR1\u002FVLGC segment.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Worldwide fleet balancing tracking &amp; Trend analysis.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Join weekly LR\u002FMR\u002FChemicals\u002FVLGC book calls to provide analytical update.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Work as a team with STASCO based Freight analyst for global Freight analytical initiatives with primary focus on East of Suez markets.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n  <p><b> FFA Derivatives Analysis &amp; Execution<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <ul>\n   <li><p> Develop TC5, TC17 predicting model.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Incorporating Refining Margins, Cracks forward curve, Fixing Pace, Main Oil Arbitrage projection and other fundamental factors into FFA recommendations.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Co-Run and contribute to the weekly Cross-Book FFA calls.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> When requested, cover TC5, TC17 FFA trading activities under Senior FFA traders supervision<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Develop methodology on Implied shorts exposure calculation.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Manage LR\u002FMR implied shorts exposure together with the trading team.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Interact with Oil desks to generate\u002Faggregate T&amp;S FFA internal interest.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Work as a team with STASCO based freight analyst for SPEC FFA trading analysis.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Enrolled in traders readiness program and upon graduation, be able to trade\u002Fexecute FFAs independently.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n  <p><b> Risk Reporting<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <ul>\n   <li><p> Work closely with Global Market Risk Team.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Develop freight specific var methodology by working with Book Leads and Risk Team.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Support freight book with no forward FFA curve to develop ways of quantifying forward value into economic P&amp;L.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n  <p><b> Bunker Hedge <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <ul>\n   <li><p>Interface with Crude EED team and FO trading team on their latest market view.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Work closely with STASCO based freight analyst and all global book leads on overall Bunker Hedge Strategy\u002Fexecution.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Work as a team to further improve\u002Fdevelop technical analysis.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n  <p><b> Physical Freight Chartering\u002FOperations (optional):<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <ul>\n   <li><p> Act as cover for CPP\u002FChemicals charter-in activities when required (this can only be performed under senior traders supervision).<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> A 2 to 4 month Operations coverage will form part of the traders readiness program (unless candidate already has operations experience).<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> What we need from you<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <ul>\n   <li><p> Possess at least 5 to 10 years in Commodity \u002F Freight Trading analysis<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Candidates with freight trading \u002F broking freight analysis experience will be preferred.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Background in Tanker\u002FChartering and Oil &amp; Gas is advantageous.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> It is essential that you can show you are a self-starter and can work well as part of a team.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> An awareness \u002F understanding of paper instruments utilized for hedging and speculative trading would be valuable.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> Company Description<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p> Shell is one the largest foreign investors in Singapore and began operations in 1891. Today, we have more than 3,200 employees in Singapore alone. The Pulau Bukom Manufacturing Site today is the largest Shell refinery in the world in terms of crude distillation capacity, which makes Singapore a key regional supply and trading centre for Shell in the East. Singapore is the largest petrochemical production and export centre in the Asia Pacific region. Shell Jurong Island (SJI) manufactures petrochemicals to meet the fast-growing demand for these products in the region. We also have one of the largest single-branded retail networks in Singapore, providing customers with a wide range of quality products and services. When you join Shell in Singapore, you can count on our commitment to help you thrive and propel your career by means of our industry-leading development programme and our available and unrivalled pool of local and global experts. Our numerous global and local skill pools as well as our diversity are key to our success and continuing innovation.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> An innovative place to work <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p>There’s never been a more exciting time to work at Shell.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> Join us and you’ll be adding your talent and imagination to a business with the ambition to shape the future – whether by investing in oil, gas, and renewable energy to meet demand, exploring new ways to store energy, or developing technology that helps the world to use energy more efficiently, everyone at Shell does their part.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> An inclusive place to work <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p>To power progress, we need to attract and develop the brightest minds and make sure every voice is heard. Here are just some of the ways we are nurturing an inclusive environment – one where you can express your ideas, extend your skills, and reach your potential.<\u002Fp>\n  <ul>\n   <li><p> We’re creating a space where people with disabilities can excel through transparent recruitment process, workplace adjustments and ongoing support in their roles. Feel free to let us know about your circumstances when you apply, and we’ll take it from there.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> We’re closing the gender gap – whether that’s through action on equal pay or by enabling more women to reach senior roles in engineering and technology.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> We’re striving to be a pioneer of an inclusive and diverse workplace, promoting equality for employees regardless of sexual orientation or gender identity.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> We consider ourselves a flexible employer and want to support you finding the right balance. We encourage you to discuss this with us in your application.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> A rewarding place to work <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p>Combine our creative, collaborative environment and global operations with an impressive range of benefits and joining Shell becomes an inspired career choice.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> We’re huge advocates for career development. We’ll encourage you to try new roles and experience new settings. By pushing people to reach their potential, we frequently help them find skills they never knew they had, or make career moves they never thought possible.<\u002Fp>\n  <br> \n <\u002Fdiv>\n <p><\u002Fp> \n <div>\n  <h3 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><p>Disclaimer <\u002Fp><\u002Fh3>\n  <div>\n   <div>\n    Please note: We occasionally amend or withdraw Shell jobs and reserve the right to do so at any time, including prior to the advertised closing date. <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b>The Role<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2> \n <div>\n  <p><b>Where you fit in<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p> The chosen candidate will work as part of a global team in the IDT (Information &amp; Digital Technology) organization. IDT drives business value through providing world class technical, functional, and consulting expertise to deliver the right skills, at the right time.<\u002Fp>\n  <p> As a Business Analyst, you will support Shell LNG Marketing &amp; Trading teams working in the D&amp;A team (providing support to the Data &amp; Analytics capability for the SLMT business area), the Freight for the future team (working on IMOS\u002FFreight improvements) or in the Salesforce team (delivering digital transformation to a variety of business areas on the Salesforce platform). The teams all share the objective of empowering enhanced trading decisions through access to trusted data and robust, scalable analytical models and visualizations along with automating business processes and integrating existing tools. Business teams using this data include short- and long-term LNG and freight trading teams for a range of analysis including forecasting and LNG trading decisions. You will experience a great opportunity to participate in delivering IT solutions in support of Shell’s Energy Transformation.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> What’s the role? <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p>Working as a subject matter expert in Shell LNG Trading, Freight, and Operations, you would lead the identification and documentation of business requirements, working with technical teams to determine feasible solution options. As a Business Analyst, you would bring Subject Matter Expertise and domain knowledge to help organize and interpret requirements from a diverse range of stakeholders. You would actively manage the requirements through the end-to-end solution delivery lifecycle, from detailed design to implementation, testing and release, and ultimately the transition of expertise to the support teams.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> Your role will vary depending on the projects in your portfolio, typically you would perform the following day to day activities:<\u002Fp>\n  <ul>\n   <li><p> Responsible for the successful planning and delivery of the project(s) business analysis methods, tools, and technology.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Acts as product SME for the associated delivery teams, developing a position as trusted advisor.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Close alignment with Business and IT Manager teams to align on product roadmap, demand pipeline, capacity, and capability requirements.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Ability to travel to business hubs (Singapore\u002F Dubai\u002F UK\u002F India) depending on business needs to meet with SLMT Business stakeholders.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Responsible for assuring functional design, resolves technical and solution design issues collaboratively.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Ability to coach and mentor wider business analysis team - playing a key role in elevating the overall capabilities around the Business domain and product knowledge.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Provide leadership to the teams and be responsible for each team members development plan and performance management.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Point of escalation for issues which adversely affect systems performance, design, or functionalities.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Strong leadership, sound analytical skill and change management capabilities to work independently on transformation, improvement initiatives, liaising effectively with senior stakeholders and vendors on complex problems etc.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Describe technology in terms easily understood by business customers and set realistic customer expectations for the project outcome. Adjust customer expectations in accordance with changes in scope.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Generate innovative approaches to existing problems or new opportunities.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Work closely with stakeholders to build trust and understand their goals, motivations, constraints, risks, and operating environment.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> What we need from you<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <ul>\n   <li><p> Bachelors Degree in Engineering is a must.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Minimum of 4+ years of IT Business Analysis experience or 6+ years IT experience.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Knowledge of physical commodities, trading markets and organizations (LNG, physical gas or oil).<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Detailed knowledge of the LNG Market.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Able to demonstrate a wide variety of skills including Freight &amp; IMOS or Salesforce or strong Data and Analysis (SQL\u002FMigration, Analytics etc.) capabilities.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Experience working in fast-paced project delivery using AGILE methods.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> CBAP, CSM, CSPO and PSPO Certifications would be nice to have.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Knowledge of Business Analysis techniques and tools with significant experience in project deliverables including the ability to:<\u002Fp>\n    <ul>\n     <li><p> Precisely capture business problems, value drivers, and functional\u002Fnon-functional requirements.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n     <li><p> Translate business requirements into functionality and assess the risks, feasibility, opportunities, and business impacts of various solution options.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n     <li><p> Visualize, articulate, and solve complex problems and concepts.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n    <\u002Ful><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> A delivery focus in terms of closing out tasks effectively in addition to realizing planned business benefits alongside users. Consistent business case\u002Fsolution cost-benefit awareness to ensure the right focus is being given to each task to provide maximum benefit to stakeholders.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Experience working in geographically distributed teams with strong Stakeholder Management skills.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Good to have experience of working directly with traders on trader models.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Experience in Oil &amp; Gas, Energy, Power and Investment Banking industries are preferred.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Proficient in English communication verbal and written.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> Company Description<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p> Shell is one the largest foreign investors in Singapore and began operations in 1891. Today, we have more than 3,200 employees in Singapore alone. The Pulau Bukom Manufacturing Site today is the largest Shell refinery in the world in terms of crude distillation capacity, which makes Singapore a key regional supply and trading centre for Shell in the East. Singapore is the largest petrochemical production and export centre in the Asia Pacific region. Shell Jurong Island (SJI) manufactures petrochemicals to meet the fast-growing demand for these products in the region. We also have one of the largest single-branded retail networks in Singapore, providing customers with a wide range of quality products and services. When you join Shell in Singapore, you can count on our commitment to help you thrive and propel your career by means of our industry-leading development programme and our available and unrivalled pool of local and global experts. Our numerous global and local skill pools as well as our diversity are key to our success and continuing innovation.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> An innovative place to work <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p>There’s never been a more exciting time to work at Shell.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> Join us and you’ll be adding your talent and imagination to a business with the ambition to shape the future – whether by investing in oil, gas, and renewable energy to meet demand, exploring new ways to store energy, or developing technology that helps the world to use energy more efficiently, everyone at Shell does their part.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> An inclusive place to work <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p>To power progress, we need to attract and develop the brightest minds and make sure every voice is heard. Here are just some of the ways we are nurturing an inclusive environment – one where you can express your ideas, extend your skills, and reach your potential.<\u002Fp>\n  <ul>\n   <li><p> We’re creating a space where people with disabilities can excel through transparent recruitment process, workplace adjustments and ongoing support in their roles. Feel free to let us know about your circumstances when you apply, and we’ll take it from there.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> We’re closing the gender gap – whether that’s through action on equal pay or by enabling more women to reach senior roles in engineering and technology.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> We’re striving to be a pioneer of an inclusive and diverse workplace, promoting equality for employees regardless of sexual orientation or gender identity.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> We consider ourselves a flexible employer and want to support you finding the right balance. We encourage you to discuss this with us in your application.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> A rewarding place to work <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p>Combine our creative, collaborative environment and global operations with an impressive range of benefits and joining Shell becomes an inspired career choice.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> We’re huge advocates for career development. We’ll encourage you to try new roles and experience new settings. By pushing people to reach their potential, we frequently help them find skills they never knew they had, or make career moves they never thought possible.<\u002Fp>\n  <br> \n <\u002Fdiv>\n <p><\u002Fp> \n <div>\n  <h3 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><p>Disclaimer <\u002Fp><\u002Fh3>\n  <div>\n   <div>\n    Please note: We occasionally amend or withdraw Shell jobs and reserve the right to do so at any time, including prior to the advertised closing date. Anyone who demands such a fee is not an authorised Shell representative and you are strongly advised to refuse any such demand. <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b>The Role<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2> \n <div>\n  <p><b>Where you fit in<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p> Shell Fleet Solutions is one of the world's largest B2B fuel payments SaaS solution for commercial fleets globally, with the fleet management platform as the hub, and complimentary value-added mobility solutions at the spoke. Include the business profile<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> We currently lead Shell in Singapore by supporting our B2B mobility Fleet customers with a suite of business mobility offers over a menu of alternative energy solutions (i.e EV charging, Carbon neutral fuels, mobile energy infrastructure, solar and plastics to waste conversion programs) and digital transformation solutions (i.e Telematics, Freight Brokerage, Fleet data API) designed to help them through the energy transition. Currently we are the one of the B2B business in Shell that has demonstrated consistent commercial profitability in our alternative bucket of solutions.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> Fleet Solutions Key Account Manager role requires exceptional skill and focus on customer portfolio\u002Frelationship management while hunting of new business within your market. This is a role for someone with passion for customers and sales that want to help their customers to navigate through the energy transition. It is one of the most important roles in the company because it is at the customer interface that the purpose of the company takes place.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> What’s the role? <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p>Your key accountabilities include the following:<\u002Fp>\n  <ul>\n   <li><p> Experience adhering to a sales excellence framework process (i.e Sales first) and role modeling Sales 1st behaviors.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Develop and execute sales plans and key account plans to deliver year on year financial growth.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Guide your customers through the energy transition and their de-carbonization agenda.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Develop and maintain long term commercial relationships with key accounts to support them through a tailored decarbonization framework plan.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Hunt for new accounts as well as farm your existing account base through referrals or by solution selling our alternative energy portfolio menu.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> High level of customer ownership and work with Customer Operations, Marketing, Mobility, New Energies and e2e partner functions (e.g. Credit), to ensure highest standard of service for your customers.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Be responsible for the P&amp;L for your designated set of accounts.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> What we need from you<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p> To succeed in this role, you will have:<\u002Fp>\n  <ul>\n   <li><p> 4-7 years doing B2B Sales in fuel mobility payments environment would be highly advantageous.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Demonstrated track record of consistent top sales performance.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Entrepreneurial “self-starter” mindset with a passion for sales, customer and closing deals.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Customer obsession with genuine curiosity and courage to understand customers’ real needs and to challenge them to offer the right solutions.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Excellent communication and networking skills.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Experience in big data\u002Fdigital sales lead generation, value selling, and negotiation of high value contracts is preferred.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Basic knowledge in EV charging, carbon credits, solar, telematics, last mile solutions, freight brokerage, API and plastics to waste conversion programs but not necessary.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> A team player with all parts of the E2E supply chain, including Operations, our partners in Commercial Road Transport, Mobility and New Energies.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Learner mindset, daring to fall and get up again stronger and quickly.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Innovative mind to always be ahead of competition.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> Company Description<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p> Shell is one the largest foreign investors in Singapore and began operations in 1891. Today, we have more than 3,200 employees in Singapore alone. The Pulau Bukom Manufacturing Site today is the largest Shell refinery in the world in terms of crude distillation capacity, which makes Singapore a key regional supply and trading centre for Shell in the East. Singapore is the largest petrochemical production and export centre in the Asia Pacific region. Shell Jurong Island (SJI) manufactures petrochemicals to meet the fast-growing demand for these products in the region. We also have one of the largest single-branded retail networks in Singapore, providing customers with a wide range of quality products and services. When you join Shell in Singapore, you can count on our commitment to help you thrive and propel your career by means of our industry-leading development programme and our available and unrivalled pool of local and global experts. Our numerous global and local skill pools as well as our diversity are key to our success and continuing innovation.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> An innovative place to work <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p>There’s never been a more exciting time to work at Shell.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> Join us and you’ll be adding your talent and imagination to a business with the ambition to shape the future – whether by investing in oil, gas, and renewable energy to meet demand, exploring new ways to store energy, or developing technology that helps the world to use energy more efficiently, everyone at Shell does their part.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> An inclusive place to work <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p>To power progress, we need to attract and develop the brightest minds and make sure every voice is heard. Here are just some of the ways we are nurturing an inclusive environment – one where you can express your ideas, extend your skills, and reach your potential.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <ul>\n   <li><p> We’re creating a space where people with disabilities can excel through transparent recruitment process, workplace adjustments and ongoing support in their roles. Feel free to let us know about your circumstances when you apply, and we’ll take it from there.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> We’re closing the gender gap – whether that’s through action on equal pay or by enabling more women to reach senior roles in engineering and technology.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> We’re striving to be a pioneer of an inclusive and diverse workplace, promoting equality for employees regardless of sexual orientation or gender identity.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> We consider ourselves a flexible employer and want to support you finding the right balance. We encourage you to discuss this with us in your application.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> A rewarding place to work <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p>Combine our creative, collaborative environment and global operations with an impressive range of benefits and joining Shell becomes an inspired career choice.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> We’re huge advocates for career development. <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b>The Role<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2> \n <p><\u002Fp>\n <div>\n  <p>If you have a passion for technology that upgrades customers’ environmental, production efficiency and CO2 performance and if you put the customer at the heart of everything you do, this could be the role for you!<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> Where you fit in<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> Shell Catalysts &amp; Technologies is a customer facing organization that brings high value, differentiating catalysts and technologies to the market.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> As a Licensing Sales Manager, you will lead selected technology licensing deals in Asia across a variety of industrial customers working with other commercial and technical experts. You will also support the efforts of account managers by joining or leading natural teams bringing the capabilities needed to differentiate Shell from other offerings. You will demonstrate excellent negotiating skills and deliver contracts that manage Shell’s risks and meet our ethics and compliance obligations.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> Our culture in Shell Catalysts &amp; Technologies is one of Humility, Curiosity, Commercial Excellence, Determination, but above all putting the customer first.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> The role does not have direct reports, but it does require great collaboration, teamwork and influencing skills. This role will report to the Licensing Sales Team Manager Asia.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> What’s the role? <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p>You will create and deliver opportunities to deploy and bring back learnings from licensing Shell’s technologies to other companies. You will be accountable for executing the strategy to add customer value through deployment of Shell’s extensive technology portfolio and to bring back what we learn from them.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> You will be a deal maker, developing account strategies or supporting account managers in doing so, generating profitable sales using the full range of Shell’s wide-ranging capabilities.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> Key Responsibilities:<\u002Fp>\n  <ul>\n   <li> Develop and lead selected complex accounts and deals for Shell Catalysts &amp; Technologies in Asia in line with Shell’s wider ambitions<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Develop and execute annual sales and marketing plans for the selected customers and managing sales and margin delivery and develop and grow a future sales pipeline in the region for continued sales and business growth<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Prepare commercial proposals and negotiate contracts<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Coordinate and manage complex internal interfaces with P&amp;T and wider Shell<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Work closely with alliance partners to ensure resource availability and effective\u002Fseamless delivery to Licensing clients<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Ensure compliance with the HSSE requirements, all Export, SGBP and code of conduct requirements and the Deal Development Process. Ensure that Shell’s knowledge, Intellectual Property, Patents, and Information are managed effectively. Apply Diagnostic ‘4D’ sales processes and behaviours<\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> What we need from you<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <ul>\n   <li> Degree or equivalent in a technical or business discipline<\u002Fli>\n   <li> 5+ years of B2B deal-making experience, ideally in technically oriented areas<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Commercial acumen and mindset. Ability to develop multi-level customer relations, negotiate commercial deals and grow the business<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Project management skills and perseverance to drive through challenging opportunities<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Capability to assemble and inspire high performance natural teams of high caliber commercial and technical staff, adaptable across cultures, and to develop broad networks<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Track record of delivering large complex, technical deals<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Well-developed understanding of Refining and Petrochemical markets and an enthusiasm to learn more about the Energy Transition and opportunities for our customers<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Willing to travel 30 % of time<\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> Company Description<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> Shell is one of the largest foreign investors in Singapore and began operations in 1891. Today, we have more than 3,200 employees in Singapore alone. The Pulau Bukom Manufacturing Site today is the largest Shell refinery in the world in terms of crude distillation capacity, which makes Singapore a key regional supply and trading centre for Shell in the East. Singapore is the largest petrochemical production and export centre in the Asia Pacific region. Shell Jurong Island (SJI) manufactures petrochemicals to meet the fast-growing demand for these products in the region. We also have one of the largest single-branded retail networks in Singapore, providing customers with a wide range of quality products and services. When you join Shell in Singapore, you can count on our commitment to help you thrive and propel your career by means of our industry-leading development programme and our available and unrivalled pool of local and global experts. Our numerous global and local skill pools as well as our diversity are key to our success and continuing innovation.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> An innovative place to work <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p>There’s never been a more exciting time to work at Shell.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> Join us and you’ll be adding your talent and imagination to a business with the ambition to shape the future – whether by investing in oil, gas, and renewable energy to meet demand, exploring new ways to store energy, or developing technology that helps the world to use energy more efficiently, everyone at Shell does their part.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> An inclusive place to work <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p>To power progress, we need to attract and develop the brightest minds and make sure every voice is heard. Here are just some of the ways we are nurturing an inclusive environment – one where you can express your ideas, extend your skills, and reach your potential.<\u002Fp>\n  <ul>\n   <li> We’re creating a space where people with disabilities can excel through transparent recruitment process, workplace adjustments and ongoing support in their roles. Feel free to let us know about your circumstances when you apply, and we’ll take it from there.<\u002Fli>\n   <li> We’re closing the gender gap – whether that’s through action on equal pay or by enabling more women to reach senior roles in engineering and technology.<\u002Fli>\n   <li> We’re striving to be a pioneer of an inclusive and diverse workplace, promoting equality for employees regardless of sexual orientation or gender identity.<\u002Fli>\n   <li> We consider ourselves a flexible employer and want to support you finding the right balance. We encourage you to discuss this with us in your application.<\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> A rewarding place to work <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p>Combine our creative, collaborative environment and global operations with an impressive range of benefits and joining Shell becomes an inspired career choice.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> We’re huge advocates for career development. We’ll encourage you to try new roles and experience new settings. By pushing people to reach their potential, we frequently help them find skills they never knew they had, or make career moves they never thought possible.<\u002Fp>\n  <br> \n <\u002Fdiv>\n <p><\u002Fp> \n <div>\n  <h3 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><p>Disclaimer <\u002Fp><\u002Fh3>\n  <div>\n   <div>\n    Please note: We occasionally amend or withdraw Shell jobs and reserve the right to do so at any time, including prior to the advertised closing date. Before applying, you are advised to read our data protection policy. The Shell Group and its approved recruitment consultants will never ask you for a fee to process or consider your application for a career with Shell. Anyone who demands such a fee is not an authorised Shell representative and you are strongly advised to refuse any such demand. Shell is an Equal Opportunity Employer.\n   <\u002Fdiv>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n
