<h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b>The Role<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2> \n <div>\n  <p><b>Where you fit in<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p><br> Shell’s global Trading and Supply business is one of the largest energy trading operations in the world with key hubs in Singapore, Dubai, Houston, London, and Rotterdam, trading in crude oil, natural gas, LNG, electrical power etc. Our business in Asia has set huge growth targets for the coming years with major focus on green and sustainable energy.<\u002Fp>\n  <p> To accelerate our ambitious delivery goals and energy transition targets in Asia, our power trading division in the region is looking for digital power (electricity) domain subject matter expert (SME).<\u002Fp>\n  <p> If you are:<\u002Fp>\n  <ul>\n   <li><p> Seeking an opportunity to use your knowledge of the power domain digital technology to drive an ambitious vision for growth and net zero<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Committed to being the best version of yourself and helping others to learn and generate new ideas that make life better for you, your colleagues, and our business<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Commercially minded, self-starter with the energy and commitment to drive opportunities from identification to realization<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> Read on to find out more!<br> <br> <b>What’s the role?<\u002Fb><br> <br> As an IDT Advisor – Power , you will touch the whole spectrum of IT delivery – identifying and defining the business needs of the users and stakeholders, guiding solution design to meet those business needs in line with both, business and IT, strategic roadmaps, ensuring seamless fit between processes, training, and solutions, protecting and exploiting value realization of product and information management investments, all in close alignment with the natural team (i.e. group of team members from different parts of Shell working on a common project\u002Fproduct delivery). You will also play a leadership role within the natural team through coaching, teaching and supporting other team members, participating in the delivery team leadership discussions, and for those coming with technical expertise, serving as the Tech Lead for the domain. You will report to the IT and Digital Manager for Asia based in Singapore<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> Your further accountabilities include the following:<\u002Fp>\n  <ul>\n   <li><p> Influencing, helping shape, and ensuring all delivery preserves or aligns to the portfolio \u002F product roadmap and strategies.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Developing and maintaining a strong domain expertise with deep process, data, and tools knowledge within the portfolio.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Creating a collaborative and learner mindset environment to spread business\u002Ftechnical knowledge across natural teams.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> In association with the IT support organization, ensuring the stability, integrity and performance of the operational environments and the realization of identified improvement opportunities and requirements.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Handing over knowledge to the IT support organization to enable supportability of operational environments<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Facilitating seamless integration with other product\u002Fapplication delivery teams to enable end to end delivery of services to the Business.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Initiating and driving the execution of small enhancement activities.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Building trusted partnerships across multiple stakeholders such as Business Interface Managers, business partners, suppliers, project\u002Fproduct team members, and the IT support organization.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Providing consultancy and occasionally leading initiatives to support operations in security, incident\u002Fproblem management, change management and other run and maintain activities.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Partnering with Data and Solution Architects to ensure correct translation of specifications\u002Fdesign into high level design and technical specifications.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Ensuring compliance of design with the principles of simplification and standardization.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Supporting the development of Training Material.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> In some cases, play a lead role to manage delivery of enhancements and small projects.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> You will also be expected to focus on a specific product or project where you will play both a key delivery and strategic role. You’ll thrive as the expert and go-to person in the area for many of the design, strategy and other ongoing activities and initiatives alluded to in the accountabilities list above.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> What we need from you<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> We’re keen to hear from individuals who have extensive experience within a power \u002F electricity domain, who aspire to embed themselves in our team, grow into an SME as outlined above and contribute to the growth of Shell’s journey towards net zero.<\u002Fp>\n  <p> Suitable candidates will come with deep experience working as an IT advisor in the power industry, with knowledge of end-to-end technology capability of the integrated power value chain. You would have experience working in some of these environments:<\u002Fp>\n  <ul>\n   <li><p> Power generation<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Power and\u002For environmental products trading<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Power retail businesses<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Experience with applying market analysis and fundamentals technology capabilities to power products markets<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> Further requirements are as follows:<\u002Fp>\n  <ul>\n   <li><p> 7+ years of total experience in IT with at least 2+ years in close partnership with development teams and businesses.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> 3+ years of experience in the power domain businesses, with a deep knowledge of IT and business landscape.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Strong analytical and problem-solving skills.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Committed to learning and staying abreast to internal and external trends and best practices<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Capacity to cultivate and continuously expand expertise in a domain.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Able to act as a focal point for a specialized area (technical or business), able to lead teams without formal authority, while managing multiple competing priorities.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Excellent communication skills, being comfortable interacting with and able to communicate clearly with senior stakeholders.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Proven ability to deal with conflict and ambiguity effectively.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Team player. Able to work effectively with all levels and parts of business and IT organization.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Ability to work effectively in virtual, geographically dispersed, cross-cultural environments.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> More about Shell!<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> An innovative place to work<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p> There’s never been a more exciting time to work at Shell. Everyone here is helping solve one of the biggest challenges facing the world today: bringing the benefits of energy to everyone on the planet, whilst managing the risks of climate change.<\u002Fp>\n  <p> Join us and you’ll add your talent and imagination to a business with the power to shape the future – whether by investing in renewables, exploring new ways to store energy or developing technology that helps the world to use energy more efficiently.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> An inclusive place to work<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p> To power progress together, we need to attract and develop the brightest minds and make sure every voice is heard. Here are just some of the ways we’re nurturing an inclusive environment – one where you can express your ideas, extend your skills and reach your potential.<\u002Fp>\n  <ul>\n   <li><p> We’re creating a space, where people with disabilities can excel through transparent recruitment process, workplace adjustments and ongoing support in their roles. Feel free to let us know about your circumstances when you apply and we’ll take it from there.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> We’re closing the gender gap – whether, that’s through action on equal pay or by enabling more women to reach senior roles in engineering and technology.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> We’re striving to be a pioneer of an inclusive and diverse workplace, promoting equality for employees regardless of sexual orientation or gender identity.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> We consider ourselves a flexible employer and want to support you finding the right balance. We encourage you to discuss this with us in your application.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> A rewarding place to work<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p> Combine our creative, collaborative environment and global operations with an impressive range of benefits and joining Shell becomes an inspired career choice.<\u002Fp>\n  <p> We’re huge advocates for career development. We’ll encourage you to try new roles and experience new settings. By pushing people to reach their potential, we frequently help them find skills they never knew they had, or make career moves they never thought possible.<\u002Fp>\n  <br> \n  <p><\u002Fp> \n <\u002Fdiv>\n <p><\u002Fp> \n <div>\n  <h3 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><p>Disclaimer <\u002Fp><\u002Fh3>\n  <div>\n   <div>\n    Please note: We occasionally amend or withdraw Shell jobs and reserve the right to do so at any time, including prior to the advertised closing date. Anyone who demands such a fee is not an authorised Shell representative and you are strongly advised to refuse any such demand. <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b>The Role<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2> \n <div>\n  <p><b>Where you fit in?<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p> The size and complexity of Shell Trading &amp; Supply (T&amp;S) has increased substantially over the past few years and the expectations around risk management from a regulatory perspective have also shifted for Energy trading, for example, with the FCA’s Senior Managers and Certification Regime (SMCR) applying in the UK from December 2019. As a result and recognising the potential to unlock additional value from enhanced risk management of our trading activities, a strategic decision has been made to make a major, multi-year investment to strengthen the risk management capabilities of the organisation from a people, process, data and systems perspective in both the first and second lines of defence. A new Chief Risk Officer (CRO) was brought into the organisation in 2020 to lead the efforts for the second line of defence.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> The new Credit Data &amp; Analytics (CDA) team will focus on the delivery of regular and ad hoc credit risk reporting and portfolio analytics to the commercial teams, the risk management teams and various other stakeholders such as the T&amp;S Leadership Team (TSLT), Executive Committee (EC) and the production of risk information which will flow into external financial reporting.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> The Senior Credit Reporting Analyst role relates to T&amp;S. Primary stakeholders are commercial teams, risk managers located in T&amp;S hubs in London, Houston, Rotterdam, Dubai, and Singapore, with global activities. The role is focused primarily on providing support for credit reporting and analytics activities in the Asia and Europe regions.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> What’s the role? <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p>Successful candidate will be accountable for the following:<\u002Fp>\n  <ul>\n   <li> Support the development and operations of global credit risk reporting activities within T&amp;S, including working with IT and other organisations to resolve issues where they arise.<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Develop and conduct credit risk analytics on both a pre- and post-deal basis; including portfolio analytics, expected credit loss (ECL), credit value adjustment (CVA), credit reserves and cost of credit analysis.<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Combine business understanding with logical data modelling and process design skills to integrate new and enhanced T&amp;S businesses and activities into CRA’s global operations.<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Ensure reporting and analytical tools have clear and appropriate documentation.<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Develop and enhance appropriate data visualisations to support the use of credit reporting and analytics – e.g., Spotfire, Power BI and\u002For Qlik Sense<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Understand the key ETRMs of T&amp;S, with in-depth knowledge of how systems in their region interact with Risk systems and tools.<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Train users on how to conduct analysis in CRA developed and supported tools and reports.<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Provide support and direction to CRA colleagues, including the SBO team based in Chennai and Manila.<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Collaborate with and support Commercial \u002F Credit \u002F Market Risk \u002F Valuation teams with production reporting, transformation projects and other ad-hoc requests.<\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> What we need from you?<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> While a strong knowledge of credit risk fundamentals is required, we are also keen to hear from candidates with the following qualities touched by their work experience:<\u002Fp>\n  <ul>\n   <li> Experience with advanced Excel, SQL, Python, Alteryx and\u002For database knowledge desirable<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Experience in data visualisation – Power BI, Spotfire, QlikSense or other desirable.<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Finance or Mathematics Degree preferred<\u002Fli>\n   <li> CFA or GARP certificates preferred<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Prior risk experience within commodity markets, such as LNG, Oil, Gas, Power and\u002For Carbon preferred.<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Exposure to the types of conceptual, quantitative and data challenges faced in a complex trading environment with multiple ETRM’s, and sources of data is important.<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Excellent attention to detail, methodical, organized, and able to plan to meet deadlines.<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Resilient when working under pressure, with the ability to prioritise tasks to meet deadlines<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Self-starter, highly motivated, outcome driven.<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Good judgement to provide advice, question discrepancies, escalate issues.<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Learner mindset: innovative and creative, excellent problem-solving capabilities including the ability to analyse, model and interpret data.<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Strong interpersonal and team working skills to communicate with various different stakeholders across Risk, IT and Commercial, all with varying needs.<\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> About Shell Singapore<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p> Shell is one the largest foreign investors in Singapore and began operations in 1891. Today, we have more than 3,200 employees in Singapore alone. The Pulau Bukom Manufacturing Site today is the largest Shell refinery in the world in terms of crude distillation capacity, which makes Singapore a key regional supply and trading centre for Shell in the East. Singapore is the largest petrochemical production and export centre in the Asia Pacific region. Shell Jurong Island (SJI) manufactures petrochemicals to meet the fast-growing demand for these products in the region. We also have one of the largest single-branded retail networks in Singapore, providing customers with a wide range of quality products and services. When you join Shell in Singapore, you can count on our commitment to help you thrive and propel your career by means of our industry-leading development programme and our available and unrivalled pool of local and global experts. Our numerous global and local skill pools as well as our diversity are key to our success and continuing innovation.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> An innovative place to work <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p>There’s never been a more exciting time to work at Shell. Everyone here is helping solve one of the biggest challenges facing the world today: bringing the benefits of energy to everyone on the planet, whilst managing the risks of climate change.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> Join us and you’ll be adding your talent and imagination to a business with the ambition to shape the future – whether by investing in renewables, exploring new ways to store energy, or developing technology that helps the world to use energy more efficiently, everyone at Shell does their part.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> An inclusive place to work <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p>To power progress together, we need to attract and develop the brightest minds and make sure every voice is heard. Here are just some of the ways we are nurturing an inclusive environment – one where you can express your ideas, extend your skills, and reach your potential…<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <ul>\n   <li> We’re creating a space where people with disabilities can excel through transparent recruitment process, workplace adjustments and ongoing support in their roles. Feel free to let us know about your circumstances when you apply, and we’ll take it from there.<\u002Fli>\n   <li> We’re closing the gender gap – whether that’s through action on equal pay or by enabling more women to reach senior roles in engineering and technology.<\u002Fli>\n   <li> We’re striving to be a pioneer of an inclusive and diverse workplace, promoting equality for employees regardless of sexual orientation or gender identity.<\u002Fli>\n   <li> We consider ourselves a flexible employer and want to support you finding the right balance. We encourage you to discuss this with us in your application.<\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> A rewarding place to work <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p>Combine our creative, collaborative environment and global operations with an impressive range of benefits and joining Shell becomes an inspired career choice.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> We’re huge advocates for career development. We’ll encourage you to try new roles and experience new settings. By pushing people to reach their potential, we frequently help them find skills they never knew they had, or make career moves they never thought possible.<\u002Fp>\n  <br> \n <\u002Fdiv>\n <p><\u002Fp> \n <div>\n  <h3 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><p>Disclaimer <\u002Fp><\u002Fh3>\n  <div>\n   <div>\n    Please note: We occasionally amend or withdraw Shell jobs and reserve the right to do so at any time, including prior to the advertised closing date. <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b>The Role<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2> \n <div>\n  <p>The energy landscape is changing fast, and Shell is transitioning as well – not only to keep up with the external pace, but also to anticipate and shape a different future. The Corporate Relations function protects and grows value by supporting businesses’ growth and decarbonisation strategies through a sectoral approach, and by improving policy and advocacy outcomes. We will bring in the external perspectives, secure and drive Shell’s reputation, and values. Drawing on a strong base of professional excellence, we aspire to achieve integrated outcomes through effective engagement and communication with external and internal stakeholders.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> Where you fit in<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p> The Corporate Relations (CR) Adviser, Mobility, will report to the Deputy Head and Media Relations Lead, and is a key member of the CR Team for Shell Singapore. The CR Adviser works closely with the relevant businesses to enable the wider Mobility strategy, including the related Lubricants, Sectors &amp; Decarbonisation – Construction &amp; Road strategies, through the delivery of all aspects of strategic external and internal communications, government relations and advocacy. You will also manage media relations, as well as digital and social media for your business portfolio.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> What’s the role? <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <ul>\n   <li><p>Establish strong relationships with Shell Mobility, Lubricants and Sectors &amp; Decarbonisation – Construction &amp; Road business leaders and provide strategic CR counsel.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n  <ul>\n   <li><p> Develop, own, and execute the corporate relations strategies and plans for these businesses, while ensuring consistency with the overall objectives of Shell Singapore’s country reputation plan for the sectors involved as well as the company’s global plans. This will also involve management of government relations, as well as policy &amp; regulatory advocacy where needed.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Delivery and implementation of the corporate relations strategies and plans would include defining:<\u002Fp>\n    <ul>\n     <li><p> Objectives of engagement<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n     <li><p> Narratives and messaging<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n     <li><p> Relevant internal and external stakeholders (public, government, staff, media etc.)<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n     <li><p> Risks, mitigation, and issues that may impact reputation<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n    <\u002Ful><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Support communications needs arising from issues and country crisis management.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> What we need from you<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p> Skills &amp; Experience<\u002Fp>\n  <ul>\n   <li><p> Advanced degree preferred.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Strong knowledge of trends shaping the energy industry, energy transition, and climate change issues.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Proven experience in developing and implementing integrated communications and government engagement strategies and programmes;<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Proven experience in managing the media, as well as digital and social media channels.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Proven experience in stakeholder management and engagement.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Minimum of 15 years of professional experience with at least 9 years in corporate communications or corporate affairs role (in-house or PR consultancy).<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Excellence in listening, influencing, and communication, including writing and engagement skills.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Excellent interpersonal skills that build positive and trust-based relationships with external and internal stakeholders.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Strong experience in handling sensitive and confidential matters with integrity and discretion.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Strong ability to maintain level-headedness in the event of crisis.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Ability to work independently, balance competing priorities and manage workload.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Possess a learner and growth mindset:<\u002Fp>\n    <ul>\n     <li><p> Maximise value and performance by being collaborative, nimble, adaptable, having willingness to experiment and innovate.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n     <li><p> Engage and inspire everyone to learn from mistakes and successes through role-modelling.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n     <li><p> Inclusive and grow trust so people feel safe to speak up.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n     <li><p> Support self and team’s well-being and maintain the highest standards of safety and care.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n    <\u002Ful><\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> Flexible working:<\u002Fb><br> We are keen to support flexible working arrangements, subject to local regulations and legislative frameworks. If this is of interest to you, please describe in your application the type of flexible working arrangements for which you would like to be considered (e.g., part-time, job share).<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> Company Description<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p> Shell is one the largest foreign investors in Singapore and began operations in 1891. Today, we have more than 3,200 employees in Singapore alone. The Pulau Bukom Manufacturing Site today is the largest Shell refinery in the world in terms of crude distillation capacity, which makes Singapore a key regional supply and trading centre for Shell in the East. Singapore is the largest petrochemical production and export centre in the Asia Pacific region. Shell Jurong Island (SJI) manufactures petrochemicals to meet the fast-growing demand for these products in the region. We also have one of the largest single-branded retail networks in Singapore, providing customers with a wide range of quality products and services. When you join Shell in Singapore, you can count on our commitment to help you thrive and propel your career by means of our industry-leading development programme and our available and unrivalled pool of local and global experts. Our numerous global and local skill pools as well as our diversity are key to our success and continuing innovation.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> An innovative place to work <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p>There’s never been a more exciting time to work at Shell.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> Join us and you’ll be adding your talent and imagination to a business with the ambition to shape the future – whether by investing in oil, gas, and renewable energy to meet demand, exploring new ways to store energy, or developing technology that helps the world to use energy more efficiently, everyone at Shell does their part.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> An inclusive place to work <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p>To power progress, we need to attract and develop the brightest minds and make sure every voice is heard. Here are just some of the ways we are nurturing an inclusive environment – one where you can express your ideas, extend your skills, and reach your potential.<\u002Fp>\n  <br> \n <\u002Fdiv>\n <p><\u002Fp> \n <div>\n  <h3 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><p>Disclaimer <\u002Fp><\u002Fh3>\n  <div>\n   <div>\n    Please note: We occasionally amend or withdraw Shell jobs and reserve the right to do so at any time, including prior to the advertised closing date. Before applying, you are advised to read our data protection policy. This policy describes the processing that may be associated with your personal data and informs you that your personal data may be transferred to Shell\u002FShell Group companies around the world. The Shell Group and its approved recruitment consultants will never ask you for a fee to process or consider your application for a career with Shell. Anyone who demands such a fee is not an authorised Shell representative and you are strongly advised to refuse any such demand. Shell is an Equal Opportunity Employer.\n   <\u002Fdiv>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b>The Role<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2> \n <div>\n  <p>The Electrical Field Execution Engineer is part of the site Maintenance, Turnaround and Construction (MTAC) team, executing electrical related activities safely and defect free to ensure efficient and reliable operations of our production units. <\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b>What's the role?<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <ul>\n   <li><p> Be the Project Engineering Lead (PEL) and be responsible for leading and executing the site electrical projects\u002Fprograms, including construction activities when required.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Ensure the delivery of project from start to completion as per Shell process, including but not limited to the roles of Pre-startup Safety Review (PSSR) Handover Leader and its associated responsibilities (Electrical installation meet required standards and is safe for start-up).<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Attend FAT\u002FSAT and Functional testing to ensure electrical equipment met the design intent and the project premise.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> As an Electrical Construction Engineer (ECE), you will provide construction input to Project Engineering stage where requested, and to plan (e.g., Switching plan, Method Statement, JHA) and execute the scope based on approved construction designs\u002Fdrawings, up till handover to operations and start-up.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Be part of the team joining the Site project team, EPC contractors and vendors during the site walk to address the location plan, construction feasibility and brown field integration. <\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p>Work close with various stakeholders (Operations, Technologists, vendors, etc.) to develop the work plan for execution with minimum operation interruption and smooth execution to the plant.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Ensure compliance to Shell HSSE, Technical, and Process Safety Standards, and local requirements i.e., Energy Market Authority Act, Electricity Act, and local Code of Practices during execution of work.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Maintain high equipment reliability by ensuring Flawless Project Delivery is implemented in the project.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Initiate and contribute to work\u002Fprocess improvements including plant safety and reliability.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Execute role of standby electrical engineer for purpose of supporting the running plant in troubleshooting of electrical related problems after office hours. (On Scheduled rotation).<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Execute role of Authorized Engineer for works within Shell Permit to work system.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Carry out any other related duties as required, including temporary assignments in other sections within the MTAC department on site.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> What we need from you<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p> We are keen to speak to individuals with the following:<\u002Fp>\n  <ul>\n   <li><p> Diploma\u002Fdegree in Electrical engineering or equivalent.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Relevant working experience in electrical construction\u002Fmaintenance will be highly desirable.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Authorized Electrical Person (AEP) in Manufacturing site or equivalent Completed HV Operation Course by EMA advantage, LEW qualification will be an advantage.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Oil\u002Fpetrochemical industry safety course certification for supervisor will be a plus.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> More about Shell<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> An innovative place to work <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p>There’s never been a more exciting time to work at Shell.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> Join us and you’ll be adding your talent and imagination to a business with the ambition to shape the future – whether by investing in oil, gas and renewable energy to meet demand, exploring new ways to store energy, or developing technology that helps the world to use energy more efficiently, everyone at Shell does their part.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> An inclusive place to work <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p>To power progress, we need to attract and develop the brightest minds and make sure every voice is heard. Here are just some of the ways we are nurturing an inclusive environment – one where you can express your ideas, extend your skills, and reach your potential.<\u002Fp>\n  <ul>\n   <li><p> We’re creating a space where people with disabilities can excel through transparent recruitment process, workplace adjustments and ongoing support in their roles. Feel free to let us know about your circumstances when you apply, and we’ll take it from there.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> We’re closing the gender gap – whether that’s through action on equal pay or by enabling more women to reach senior roles in engineering and technology.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> We’re striving to be a pioneer of an inclusive and diverse workplace, promoting equality for employees regardless of sexual orientation or gender identity.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> We consider ourselves a flexible employer and want to support you finding the right balance. We encourage you to discuss this with us in your application.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> A rewarding place to work <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p>Combine our creative, collaborative environment and global operations with an impressive range of benefits and joining Shell becomes an inspired career choice.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> We’re huge advocates for career development. We’ll encourage you to try new roles and experience new settings. By pushing people to reach their potential, we frequently help them find skills they never knew they had, or make career moves they never thought possible.<\u002Fp>\n  <br> \n  <p><\u002Fp> \n <\u002Fdiv>\n <p><\u002Fp> \n <div>\n  <h3 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><p>Disclaimer <\u002Fp><\u002Fh3>\n  <div>\n   <div>\n    Please note: We occasionally amend or withdraw Shell jobs and reserve the right to do so at any time, including prior to the advertised closing date. <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b>The Role<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2> \n <div>\n  <p><b>Where you fit in?<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p> Shell Mobility represents the single largest customer-facing business in the group serving more than 30mln Mobility and over 250,000 Fleet customers per day through 500,000 service champions in over 45,000 sites across cca 80 countries. This role is part of the Mobility Network Development team. We are the network future-proofers, creating sites that will deliver for our customers and our business today and in years to come building on deep expertise in Network strategy and portfolio management, Mobility solutions, data driven &amp; customer centric planning, new fuels planning and capital investment.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> The purpose of the Mobility Network Development Team is to deliver sustainable world class investment and enable the Energy Transition both in Mobility and beyond through effective capital deployment, cash maximization from existing network footprint and development of Network strategies integrated into one consistent branded footprint deployed to markets to ensure a balanced and resilient Global Network portfolio of assets.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> Our network is constantly evolving. We’re entering new territories. We’re transforming the charging experience for today’s growing army of EV drivers. We’re adapting to meet the needs of customers who often want more than a quick top-up. All of this change is being driven by our Global Mobility Network Development team.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> What the role is?<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p> Global Mobility Network Deployment Team contributes to a network-enabled, frontline-empowered approach to operationalize the accelerated growth agenda. We are the champions of integration of global and local Network priorities and projects. The team is a team of trusted advisors who enable the execution of Network plans and strategy in the markets and protect License to Operate via leading\u002Fcoordinating cross-business\u002Fmulti-market projects to unleash global-local value of Shell across cca 80 countries. The coordination across businesses is ever more important with growing portfolio of our customer-facing branded assets and increased variety of channels to serve our customers’ mobility needs.<\u002Fp>\n  <p> The role of Mobility Network Change Management Lead is to take network teams through these developments and changes and ensure integration between functions, processes and tools.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> Accountabilities: <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <ul>\n   <li>Enabling the pursuit of network accelerated growth during Energy Transition through driving change management in Mobility Network Teams,<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Working closely with numerous stakeholders in global and local Mobility Network and Sectors &amp; Decarbonization teams, to deliver change management programs that ensure successful implementation of integrated network strategy, projects and ways of working,<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Delivering Network Development agenda beyond Mobility, deploying change management approaches and methodologies to drive effective buy-in and adoption of Network Development tools and processes across teams and functions, integrated for Mobility and other functions across multiple markets,<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Driving change to ensure Network Teams are well equipped to build and maintain profitable and resilient network during Energy Transition; providing input and support the design and delivery of training programs and communication,<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Ensuring right network expertise is provided to other teams, responding to growing demand from other businesses in Network Development,<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Supporting knowledge transfer to markets and replication of best practices to accelerate local deployment of strategies.<\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> The role is instrumental in driving change across multiple projects and stakeholders, which requires using change management techniques and models:<\u002Fp>\n  <ul>\n   <li> Demonstrating where we are today and what we can learn from experience to guide people and deliver the outcomes,<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Stakeholder mapping and management of change,<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Designing experimentation and new ways of thinking, acting, and interacting, creating ownership of the changes,<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Keeping the changes on track to understand the readiness of individuals and the whole system to deliver the desired outcome,<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Determining if different path is available, to create or move in the right direction and ensure that people take full ownership of the changes,<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Capturing and sharing new lessons and best practices based on change experience; continuously improving project delivery.<\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> What we need from you<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <ul>\n   <li> Master’s degree in Business or Economics<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Substantial professional experience in Change Management<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Mastery in applying change management techniques, models and processes to different change contexts<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Demonstrating mastery in promoting a ‘human-centered’ approach to large scale\u002Forganizational change to ensure it is embedded and sustained and in building strategic coalitions to deliver change<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Experience in creating the organisational environment and culture (e.g. psychological safety, trust and resilience) to enable successful large-scale change<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Excellence in project delivery - planning and operationalising a programme of people or business change<\u002Fli>\n   <li> The candidate needs to cope with ambiguity and draw conclusions from complex set of information and relations<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Good knowledge of CI methodologies (CI green belt certificate welcomed)<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Strong influencing and stakeholder engagement skills<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Personal persuasion, ability to influence and engage without direct authority, outside functional lines and virtually<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Excellent communication skills<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Experience in working\u002Fleading in a multicultural and multi-country environment<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Please note that experience in Mobility Network, Energy Transition, New Fuels and Decarbonization would be additional advantage<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Role is a virtual role, part of a global team. Successful candidate is expected to work virtually from the base location<\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> Company Description<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p> Shell started operations in the United Kingdom more than 110 years ago. Since then, we have grown into a leading innovative Oil &amp; Energy company that rewards its employees by investing heavily in their careers and learning. Our people are our greatest asset, and our commitment to your career will see you thrive in a work environment that offers an industry-leading development programme. When your ideas travel, Shell will benefit, and innovation will thrive. Shell has a key role to play in helping meet the UK’s growing energy demand, whilst using innovative technologies to develop cleaner energy. We are the largest FTSE 100 company in the UK by market capitalisation and make a significant contribution to the UK economy. As well as processing 35% of the gas coming into the UK, we serve more than four million customers at our filling stations each week. Shell employs some 6,400 skilled staff as well as many contractors.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> An innovative place to work <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p>There’s never been a more exciting time to work at Shell.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> Join us and you’ll be adding your talent and imagination to a business with the ambition to shape the future – whether by investing in oil, gas and renewable energy to meet demand, exploring new ways to store energy, or developing technology that helps the world to use energy more efficiently, everyone at Shell does their part.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> An inclusive place to work <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p>To power progress, we need to attract and develop the brightest minds and make sure every voice is heard. Here are just some of the ways we are nurturing an inclusive environment – one where you can express your ideas, extend your skills, and reach your potential.<\u002Fp>\n  <ul>\n   <li> We’re creating a space where people with disabilities can excel through transparent recruitment process, workplace adjustments and ongoing support in their roles. Feel free to let us know about your circumstances when you apply, and we’ll take it from there.<\u002Fli>\n   <li> We’re closing the gender gap – whether that’s through action on equal pay or by enabling more women to reach senior roles in engineering and technology.<\u002Fli>\n   <li> We’re striving to be a pioneer of an inclusive and diverse workplace, promoting equality for employees regardless of sexual orientation or gender identity.<\u002Fli>\n   <li> We consider ourselves a flexible employer and want to support you finding the right balance. We encourage you to discuss this with us in your application.<\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> A rewarding place to work <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p>Combine our creative, collaborative environment and global operations with an impressive range of benefits and joining Shell becomes an inspired career choice.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> We’re huge advocates for career development. We’ll encourage you to try new roles and experience new settings. By pushing people to reach their potential, we frequently help them find skills they never knew they had, or make career moves they never thought possible.<\u002Fp>\n  <br> \n <\u002Fdiv>\n <p><\u002Fp> \n <div>\n  <h3 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><p>Disclaimer <\u002Fp><\u002Fh3>\n  <div>\n   <div>\n    Please note: We occasionally amend or withdraw Shell jobs and reserve the right to do so at any time, including prior to the advertised closing date. <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b>The Role<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2> \n <div>\n  <p><b>Where you fit in <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p>The role is as a Senior Environmental Products Trader within the Global Environmental Products Trading Business (EPTB) based in Singapore. You will be expected to work alongside colleagues to build a profitable trade book, seeking out exposures that add structure, build flow and embed optionality across the short and medium term. You will be working in a rapidly evolving business area, often in challenging regulatory and legal environments, requiring you to be innovative and capable of building deep commercial relationships with customers and counterparties.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> Shell Energy Trading is an industry leader and the key face to the market for Integrated Gas, providing more and cleaner energy across a global portfolio of LNG, gas, power and environmental products to meet our suppliers’ and customers’ current and future energy needs. Shell Energy is positioned to play a significant role at the heart of Shell’s Energy Transition. Through the growth of our gas, LNG, power and environmental products businesses, we are supporting our customers’ desire for more and cleaner energy. Shell Energy’s Ambition is to be the Leading Global Provider of Energy Products and Services; the Leader in Cleaner Energy Solutions; the Most Trusted Energy Partner; and a Winning Team.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> What’s the role? <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p>The Environmental Products Trading Business (EPTB) operates in environmental product markets across the globe and has the following objectives:<\u002Fp>\n  <p> Build Portfolios and Optimize: We leverage deep understanding of compliance and voluntary markets – and the connections between them – to capture opportunities across market mechanisms, geographies, methodologies, vintages, contract duration and type. We integrate perspectives from all demand sinks and supply sources in real time to take proprietary positions across the environmental value chain. This leads us to build portfolios that warehouse significant optionality, structure and risk, with the objective of optimizing returns. Risk Manage, Develop Structure, Take Positions: We warehouse risk – price, volume, credit, liquidity, reputation, technical, quality, operational, regulatory to name several – and pursue diversification &amp; mitigation of these in our portfolio construction, structure development and option creation. This informs our proprietary position take, leading us to capture outright price movements from intraday through to multiple years. Manage External Relationships: We are experienced in building long lasting relationships with third parties, from ideation through to start up and into material production or offtake. We are proficient in connecting the financing, commercial terms, operations, systems and platforms that enable sustained delivery, continuously refining these in the pursuit of efficiencies and scale. Agility: We anticipate new products and opportunities, pivot quickly and build positions ahead of market evolution. As examples: adapting to new restrictions, reinventing business models, commercializing emergent technologies and interpreting regulatory changes in and across the markets we participate in.<\u002Fp>\n  <p> EPTB is a highly capable and creative global team with collaboration, humility and a quiet determination at the core of our culture and identity. The role will require the individual to lead by example within this community and beyond, fostering effective relationships throughout the global team and across functions within Shell Energy Trading (SET).<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> EPTB Southeast Asia &amp; Oceania is responsible for trading environmental products in Regulated markets of Australia and New Zealand; new emerging trading schemes in South East Asia; as well as originating deals in international Voluntary markets.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> Reporting into the Regional Team Lead for Southeast Asia &amp; Oceania, you will primarily be responsible for meeting targets for Gross Margin, seeking out exposures that add structure, build flow and embed and manage optionality across the short and medium with an emphasis on material and sustainable contributions.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> Your primary focus will be to accelerate book building in markets of existing capability; namely, New Zealand and Australia as well as developing secondary market trading capabilities in the International Voluntary Markets from the Asian time zone. The emphasis is on growing new, scalable and sustainable income streams. Further, you will be expected to contribute to EPTB’s expansion into new products and new markets as they develop within the region, which will be within the coming few years.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> What we need from you<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> We require a creative, profit focused individual with excellent analytical skills and capable of contributing to our team ethos. Working under tight deadlines and conflicting pressures, the candidate will prove able to continue delivering to an excellent standard, with clear focus on the bottom line and priorities in hand.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> Candidates are required to have a wide set of multidisciplinary skills including:<\u002Fp>\n  <ul>\n   <li><p> Significant frontline trading in illiquid markets is ideal, with experience in options modelling and management particularly desirable. Strong quantitative skills, the ability to progress complex negotiations and to structure\u002Fmonetise optionality are essential.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Ability to build trade books, develop\u002Fstructure exposures, manage price risk and monetize opportunity. Experience in trade execution, managing trading exposures and generating value from optionality essential. Knowledge of “life-of-the-deal” process should be part of your toolkit. Conduct and professionalism in line with Shell’s compliance and principles to be part of successful candidates DNA.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Excellent communication, relationship building and presentation skills. To illustrate, the ability to present a compelling business case to senior management detailing the opportunity space, implementation plan, resources needed and the expected returns. Be able to build deep relationships with key stakeholders: customers, counterparties, senior leaders, exchanges and regulators.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> To be able to originate and structure the first deals, then “industrialize” the process so the deals can be easily repeated in scale.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> This role is a challenging position with excellent development opportunities across T&amp;S and the wider Shell group. Shell expects to play its part in contributing to the global effort to tackle climate change. This role is at the sharp edge of that challenge, requiring a confident and self-motivated individual with a strong passion for pursuing Shell’s Net Carbon Footprint ambition. We are interested in attracting people to our business who share our core working values of honesty, integrity and have respect for others. We also want those who can build on our business vision, are prepared to accept accountability, and can achieve great results through teamwork<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> Company Description<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p> Shell is one the largest foreign investors in Singapore and began operations in 1891. Today, we have more than 3,200 employees in Singapore alone. The Pulau Bukom Manufacturing Site today is the largest Shell refinery in the world in terms of crude distillation capacity, which makes Singapore a key regional supply and trading centre for Shell in the East. Singapore is the largest petrochemical production and export centre in the Asia Pacific region. Shell Jurong Island (SJI) manufactures petrochemicals to meet the fast-growing demand for these products in the region. We also have one of the largest single-branded retail networks in Singapore, providing customers with a wide range of quality products and services. When you join Shell in Singapore, you can count on our commitment to help you thrive and propel your career by means of our industry-leading development programme and our available and unrivalled pool of local and global experts. Our numerous global and local skill pools as well as our diversity are key to our success and continuing innovation.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> An innovative place to work <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p>There’s never been a more exciting time to work at Shell.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> Join us and you’ll be adding your talent and imagination to a business with the ambition to shape the future – whether by investing in oil, gas, and renewable energy to meet demand, exploring new ways to store energy, or developing technology that helps the world to use energy more efficiently, everyone at Shell does their part.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> An inclusive place to work <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p>To power progress, we need to attract and develop the brightest minds and make sure every voice is heard. Here are just some of the ways we are nurturing an inclusive environment – one where you can express your ideas, extend your skills, and reach your potential.<\u002Fp>\n  <ul>\n   <li><p> We’re creating a space where people with disabilities can excel through transparent recruitment process, workplace adjustments and ongoing support in their roles. Feel free to let us know about your circumstances when you apply, and we’ll take it from there.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> We’re closing the gender gap – whether that’s through action on equal pay or by enabling more women to reach senior roles in engineering and technology.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> We’re striving to be a pioneer of an inclusive and diverse workplace, promoting equality for employees regardless of sexual orientation or gender identity.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> We consider ourselves a flexible employer and want to support you finding the right balance. We encourage you to discuss this with us in your application.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> A rewarding place to work <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p>Combine our creative, collaborative environment and global operations with an impressive range of benefits and joining Shell becomes an inspired career choice.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> We’re huge advocates for career development. We’ll encourage you to try new roles and experience new settings. & Env. Solutions Legal Counsel","jobTypes":{"CF3CP":"Full-time"},"location":{"country":"SG","city":"Singapore","postalCode":"","admin1":"S00"},"mobileStickyVjHeaderActive":false,"openCompanyLinksInNewTab":false,"parentCompanyName":null,"preciseLocationModel":null,"ratingsModel":null,"recentSearch":null,"remoteWorkModel":null,"salaryCurrency":null,"salaryMax":null,"salaryMin":null,"salaryType":null,"subtitle":"Shell - Singapore","tagModels":null,"taxonomyAttributes":{"benefits":[]},"viewJobDisplay":"DESKTOP_EMBEDDED","workplaceInsightsModel":{"workplaceInsights":[]}},"jobMetadataHeaderModel":{"jobType":"Full-time"},"jobTagModel":null,"resumeEvaluationResult":null,"sanitizedJobDescription":{"content":"<div>\n <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b>The Role<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2> \n <div>\n  <p><b>Where you fit in?<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p> The Nature and Environmental Solutions (NES) team leverages our two main current competitive advantages of our leading trading position (helmed by our Environmental Products Trading Business (EPTB) team) in both compliance and regulatory markets and our experience and credibility developing and investing in nature projects Nature Based Solutions (NBS) that produce high quality carbon credits.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> The NBS team is primarily focused on developing projects which protect or redevelop natural ecosystems, such as forests, grasslands, and wetlands. These could be projects related to conservation, afforestation or reforestation thereby generating carbon credits in the future whilst benefitting local communities and protecting biodiversity.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> Shell’s Global CO2 Trading team is headquartered in London with desks in Houston, Dubai, Singapore, Beijing and Tokyo. The Global NBS team is headquartered in Singapore with commercial teams placed stretching from Australia to the Americas.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> EPTB is responsible for the management and optimisation of the CO2 exposures faced by Shell assets around the world, and for generating revenue streams from external business development and proprietary trading activities. In addition, Shell has an environmental products team in North America that focuses on broader renewable energy and emissions markets in the US, Canada and Mexico.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> CO2 markets have experienced rapid growth over recent years, and Shell has remained at the forefront of the market since executing the first ever European Union (EU) CO2 Allowance trade in 2003. With CO2 increasingly being embedded into the global commodity mix, the Global EPTB team is well positioned to meet the CO2 trading and commodity requirements of new and existing customers over the coming years.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> What’s the role? <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p>The successful candidate will also be one of the primary legal focal for the NBS business in Asia. The candidate will be expected the support the NBS team in negotiating and reviewing:<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <ul>\n   <li> NDAs and MOUs, share sale &amp; purchase agreements, project finance agreements, share subscription agreements, joint venture agreements, consultancy agreements, banking instruments, land lease agreements and commodity offtake agreements amongst others.<\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> The candidate will also be required to assist and advice the NBS team on acquisitions of company’s enforcement\u002F regulatory\u002F licensing issues involving national and international CO2 schemes, land and indigenous rights issues, credit security structures and land rights issues.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> The candidate will also be expected to guide and advise the NBS business on potential Anti Bribery &amp; Corruption\u002F Anti-Money Laundering (ABC\u002FAML) issues as well as precautions, structures and mitigants in respect of projects in high-risk jurisdictions and work with SMEs to deliver the right result for Shell.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> The NBS team’s increased focus on complex structured finance deals with significant cross jurisdictional implications mean that the candidate shall be responsible for the drafting and\u002For review of a vast array of complex bespoke contracts, including those relating to financing and security arrangements and contracts that have significant embedded optionality.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> Such structured finance deals are anticipated to be conducted in various jurisdictions, often involving challenging and unclear legal and regulatory landscapes and the candidate will be required to:<\u002Fp>\n  <ul>\n   <li> Provide sound legal and commercial advice on deal structuring considering a challenging commercial and legal landscape.<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Address any regulatory issues that may arise from security arrangements or from the deal in general.<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Work closely with internal functions to ensure alignment and compliance with Shell’s requirements.<\u002Fli>\n   <li> As an integral member of the deal team, lead the deal and be a check on the deal Lead to ensure that deadlines are met; and<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Revise deal documents and lead negotiations with counterparties, and ensure that all internal requirements are reflected in the final deal documents<\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> The candidate will further be expected to have significant exposure to the use of and management of external counsel for structured financing transactions. The candidate will be expected to liaise closely with external counsel and act as an effective conduit between the commercial desk and external counsel to manage workload, procurement of advice and effectively manage the balance between cost effectiveness and fit for purpose external legal service. Where necessary, the candidate is expected to exercise good judgement in requesting assistance and steer from Senior Legal Counsel within the NES team or the line manager.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> The candidate shall be expected to travel occasionally for this role.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> The candidate is also required to be a secondary legal focal to the EPTB team in Asia for its day-to-day operations including:<\u002Fp>\n  <ul>\n   <li> Reviewing and negotiating Master Sale &amp; Purchase Agreements and confirmations, Term sale &amp; purchase agreements and other transaction documents.<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Potentially contentious operational matters such as late delivery or failure situations, Force Majeure, and breaches of contract.<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Advise and interface with the Contracts Unit, including on master sale and purchase agreements, preparation and updating of standard contracts, knowledge sharing and training, and with other Shell Trading functions, mainly Finance, Credit, Operations, HR and Tax.<\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> Special Challenges<\u002Fb><br> A fast paced environment, innovative business development teams and the challenges arising as the CO2 Trading and NBS businesses continue to adapt to changing industry and regulatory environments will require that this individual is commercially minded, flexible, willing to challenge and learn, and able to work under pressure.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> What we need from you?<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> While a Law degree and professional legal qualification in a common law jurisdiction is essential, we are also keen to hear from candidates with the following experience:<\u002Fp>\n  <ul>\n   <li> At least 8 years of post-qualification experience<\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n  <ul>\n   <li> Sound knowledge of contract law and sale of goods principles. Ideally, a knowledge of and interest in the legal issues relevant to Upstream project delivery matters.<\u002Fli>\n   <li> This individual must be motivated, self-directed, able to handle multiple streams of work, prioritise workload and to work both independently and as a member of a team, while at the same time knowing when to seek advice from the line manager or other senior colleagues.<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Able to work without direct supervision.<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Ability to draft with appropriate understanding and interpretation of the commercial intentions.<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Excellent drafting skills. Good verbal and written communication skills<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Exposure to international common law and\u002For civil law contracts.<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Ability to work on several issues in parallel.<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Ability to understand and take account of business drivers and needs.<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Able to give clear exposition of a legal issue and to provide succinct accurate and comprehensible legal advice.<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Able to coordinate between internal functions and achieve alignment.<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Knowledge and experience to identify critical legal risks in the face of deadlines and deal pressures.<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Influencing, negotiation and facilitation skills. Capacity for collaborative teamwork and able to act as a network performer to coordinate with multiple contributors.<\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> About Shell Singapore<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p> Shell is one the largest foreign investors in Singapore and began operations in 1891. Today, we have more than 3,200 employees in Singapore alone. The Pulau Bukom Manufacturing Site today is the largest Shell refinery in the world in terms of crude distillation capacity, which makes Singapore a key regional supply and trading centre for Shell in the East. Singapore is the largest petrochemical production and export centre in the Asia Pacific region. Shell Jurong Island (SJI) manufactures petrochemicals to meet the fast-growing demand for these products in the region. We also have one of the largest single-branded retail networks in Singapore, providing customers with a wide range of quality products and services. When you join Shell in Singapore, you can count on our commitment to help you thrive and propel your career by means of our industry-leading development programme and our available and unrivalled pool of local and global experts. Our numerous global and local skill pools as well as our diversity are key to our success and continuing innovation.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><b><br> An innovative place to work <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p>There’s never been a more exciting time to work at Shell. Everyone here is helping solve one of the biggest challenges facing the world today: bringing the benefits of energy to everyone on the planet, whilst managing the risks of climate change.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> Join us and you’ll be adding your talent and imagination to a business with the ambition to shape the future – whether by investing in renewables, exploring new ways to store energy, or developing technology that helps the world to use energy more efficiently, everyone at Shell does their part.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> An inclusive place to work <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p>To power progress together, we need to attract and develop the brightest minds and make sure every voice is heard. Here are just some of the ways we are nurturing an inclusive environment – one where you can express your ideas, extend your skills, and reach your potential…<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <ul>\n   <li> We’re creating a space where people with disabilities can excel through transparent recruitment process, workplace adjustments and ongoing support in their roles. Feel free to let us know about your circumstances when you apply, and we’ll take it from there.<\u002Fli>\n   <li> We’re closing the gender gap – whether that’s through action on equal pay or by enabling more women to reach senior roles in engineering and technology.<\u002Fli>\n   <li> We’re striving to be a pioneer of an inclusive and diverse workplace, promoting equality for employees regardless of sexual orientation or gender identity.<\u002Fli>\n   <li> We consider ourselves a flexible employer and want to support you finding the right balance. We encourage you to discuss this with us in your application.<\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> A rewarding place to work <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p>Combine our creative, collaborative environment and global operations with an impressive range of benefits and joining Shell becomes an inspired career choice.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> We’re huge advocates for career development. We’ll encourage you to try new roles and experience new settings. By pushing people to reach their potential, we frequently help them find skills they never knew they had, or make career moves they never thought possible.<\u002Fp>\n  <br> \n <\u002Fdiv>\n <p><\u002Fp> \n <div>\n  <h3 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><p>Disclaimer <\u002Fp><\u002Fh3>\n  <div>\n   <div>\n    Please note: We occasionally amend or withdraw Shell jobs and reserve the right to do so at any time, including prior to the advertised closing date. The Shell Group and its approved recruitment consultants will never ask you for a fee to process or consider your application for a career with Shell. Anyone who demands such a fee is not an authorised Shell representative and you are strongly advised to refuse any such demand. <p>This is a contract-role of up to 12 months.<br> <\u002Fp>\n <p><\u002Fp>\n <br> \n <p><b>What is the role <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n <p>The Legal Counsel\u002F Consultant will be part of a legal team responsible for the provision of a broad range of legal services to the organisation's businesses in the energy, chemicals and marketing sectors, and ensuring compliance with laws and regulations. <\u002Fp>\n <p>1. Work independently to provide and\u002For act as integrator in the provision of comprehensive, timely, professional and fit-for-purpose legal advice, negotiation strategy and contract drafting expertise and deliver effective legal support across a range of different business activities and transactions including products sales, projects, business development activities and joint ventures &amp; related matters that would enable the Company's energy transition to a lower carbon energy future. <\u002Fp>\n <p>2. Proactively identify commercial, ethics &amp; compliance and legal risks, ensuring appropriate alternative commercial and legal structures and strategies are considered, and documents are appropriately drafted to reflect commercial decisions, at all times consistent with professional standards, legal obligations and company policies. <\u002Fp>\n <p>3. Provide legal advice and, where appropriate, manage external counsel in relation to claims for and against the companies’ businesses prior to and following commencement of litigation to ensure speedy resolution of all disputes, minimising exposure to civil or criminal liabilities, minimising legal costs and the interests of the organisation. <\u002Fp>\n <p>4. Work with business leaders to help develop and embed a business culture with the right focus on ethics &amp; compliance. <\u002Fp>\n <p>5. Monitor relevant legal developments in Singapore and beyond (particularly within the Asia Pacific) and communicate these to internal stakeholders as appropriate. <\u002Fp>\n <p>6. Contribute to a positive, proactive culture in the Legal team encouraging a learner mindset, continuous improvement and collaboration.<br> <\u002Fp>\n <p><\u002Fp>\n <br> \n <p><b>What we need from you <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n <p>1. A Degree in Law (Honours) from a Singapore university or internationally recognised university. <\u002Fp>\n <p>2. <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b>The Role<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2> \n <div>\n  <p><b>Where you fit in? <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p>The size and complexity of Shell Trading &amp; Supply (T&amp;S) has increased substantially over the past few years and the expectations around risk management from a regulatory perspective have also shifted for Energy trading. We are therefore strengthening the risk management capabilities of the organization from a people, process, data and systems perspective in both the first and second lines of defence.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> The Operational Risk Manager is a new second line role and will work in partnership with 1LOD to embed the components of the integrated framework for the Risk Management Approach across T&amp;S.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> You will report to the Head of Operational Risk Asia supporting all lines of business and regions with some specialization expected as the maturity of the function develops over time. Additionally, you will work with T&amp;S Commercial, Compliance, Finance and Group Functions. The Shell T&amp;S hubs are in London, Houston, Rotterdam, Dubai and Singapore, with global activities.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> What is the role?<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> Your key responsibilities will include:<\u002Fp>\n  <ul>\n   <li> Provide 2nd line business-facing expertise and guidance on Operational Risk topics within T&amp;S<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Advising commercial leadership teams and the Business Integration and Assurance Managers (BIAMs, responsible for risk management in the first line) on how to apply and operationalize the policies and procedures describing the framework for the Risk Management Approach within their business as they relate to operational risk;<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Support and partner with the business\u002FBIAM teams to implement components of the integrated framework for the Risk Management Approach providing appropriate training, ongoing guidance and respectful challenge;<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Support business decisions by providing advice and direction to the commercial businesses on the health of the T&amp;S control frameworks for Operational Risk;<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Contribute to T&amp;S governance meetings related to the Operational Risk profile;<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Support the generation of operational risk profiles for each region\u002Fbusiness;<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Escalate operational risk\u002Fcontrol issues to commercial stakeholders and advise on steps to be taken by the business to manage and\u002For mitigate the issue;<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Support the Head of Operational Risk Asia in their role as the primary advisor on risk management to the Front Office Controls Enhancement programme;<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Promote a positive risk culture which supports a “Learner Mindset” around operational risk issues and encourages learnings from incidents;<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Support documentation of Control Learning Events (or equivalent “lessons learned”) by 1LOD and, where appropriate, facilitate the “read across” to other parts of T&amp;S;<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Support the commercial business in assessing the design and effectiveness of business controls for Operational Risk whilst providing independent challenge and independent assurance where appropriate.<\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> What we need from you? <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p>We'd hope to see as many of the following as possible on your CV:<\u002Fp>\n  <ul>\n   <li> Strong understanding and technical knowledge of non-financial risk management in a complex Trading organization<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Ideally experience of physical and financial commodity trading and\u002For having worked in a regulated trading business<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Clear understanding of the “3 Lines of Defence” model and segregation of duties for each LOD;<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Good understanding of the suite of controls which are generally employed to mitigate various types of Operational Risk within a complex trading organization and ability to articulate “what does good look like?” to the rest of T&amp;S;<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Proven ability to work in partnership with the 1st line of defence;<\u002Fli>\n   <li> High quality written and visual presentation skills (Word, PowerPoint);<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Excellent attention to detail, methodical, organized;<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Resilient when working under pressure, with the ability to prioritize tasks to meet deadlines<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Self-starter, highly motivated, outcome driven;<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Good judgement to provide advice, question discrepancies, escalate issues;<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Learner mindset: innovative and creative, excellent problem-solving capabilities<\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> Company Description<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p> Shell is one the largest foreign investors in Singapore and began operations in 1891. Today, we have more than 3,200 employees in Singapore alone. The Pulau Bukom Manufacturing Site today is the largest Shell refinery in the world in terms of crude distillation capacity, which makes Singapore a key regional supply and trading centre for Shell in the East. Singapore is the largest petrochemical production and export centre in the Asia Pacific region. Shell Jurong Island (SJI) manufactures petrochemicals to meet the fast-growing demand for these products in the region. We also have one of the largest single-branded retail networks in Singapore, providing customers with a wide range of quality products and services. When you join Shell in Singapore, you can count on our commitment to help you thrive and propel your career by means of our industry-leading development programme and our available and unrivalled pool of local and global experts. Our numerous global and local skill pools as well as our diversity are key to our success and continuing innovation.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> An innovative place to work <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p>There’s never been a more exciting time to work at Shell.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> Join us and you’ll be adding your talent and imagination to a business with the ambition to shape the future – whether by investing in oil, gas and renewable energy to meet demand, exploring new ways to store energy, or developing technology that helps the world to use energy more efficiently, everyone at Shell does their part.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> An inclusive place to work <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p>To power progress, we need to attract and develop the brightest minds and make sure every voice is heard. Here are just some of the ways we are nurturing an inclusive environment – one where you can express your ideas, extend your skills, and reach your potential.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <ul>\n   <li> We’re creating a space where people with disabilities can excel through transparent recruitment process, workplace adjustments and ongoing support in their roles. Feel free to let us know about your circumstances when you apply, and we’ll take it from there.<\u002Fli>\n   <li> We’re closing the gender gap – whether that’s through action on equal pay or by enabling more women to reach senior roles in engineering and technology.<\u002Fli>\n   <li> We’re striving to be a pioneer of an inclusive and diverse workplace, promoting equality for employees regardless of sexual orientation or gender identity.<\u002Fli>\n   <li> We consider ourselves a flexible employer and want to support you finding the right balance. We encourage you to discuss this with us in your application.<\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> A rewarding place to work <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p>Combine our creative, collaborative environment and global operations with an impressive range of benefits and joining Shell becomes an inspired career choice.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> We’re huge advocates for career development. We’ll encourage you to try new roles and experience new settings. By pushing people to reach their potential, we frequently help them find skills they never knew they had, or make career moves they never thought possible.<\u002Fp>\n  <br> \n <\u002Fdiv>\n <p><\u002Fp> \n <div>\n  <h3 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><p>Disclaimer <\u002Fp><\u002Fh3>\n  <div>\n   <div>\n    Please note: We occasionally amend or withdraw Shell jobs and reserve the right to do so at any time, including prior to the advertised closing date.
