<h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b>The Role<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2> \n <div>\n  <p><b>This is an exciting opportunity for you to work in a rapidly evolving business area wherein you will demonstrate progress in building our capability and deployment of carbon accounting and models at scale to promote portfolio and business growth and reduce associated uncertainty in our measurement reporting and verification of carbon projects.<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> Where you fit in<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> Nature Based Solutions (NBS) comprise all activities related to the protection of or (re-) development of natural ecosystems resulting in natural carbon sequestration, and the marketing, trading and sale of resulting carbon credits and other services and products. NBS are expected to play a material role in tackling climate change (this report from NGO The Nature Conservancy gives a good overview), and have also been identified as a potentially material lever to achieve Shell’s announced Net Carbon Footprint ambition.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><br> The NBS team in Emerging Energy Solutions is developing Shell’s business model and growth approach to realize NBS’s potential for Shell. This includes pursuing project investments that will yield carbon credits in the near term, but also more programmatic approaches with global multilaterals and land resource holders to assess what role Shell can play in the development of these resources.<br> This effort is being conducted in concert with other teams in Shell who are involved with NBS. There is a sizeable Environmental Products Trading Business in Shell Trading that already serves internal and external customers seeking to offset GHG and other emissions. There are also pilots being conducted in various Downstream LoBs, aimed at assessing the potential of carbon neutral energy product sales to Shell customers.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> What’s the role?<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p><br> As a NBS Technical Adviser Carbon Accounting, you will lead the quantification of carbon benefits from our carbon project portfolio (focusing on agriculture but also across other pathways), together with the associated measurement, reporting and verification. The incumbent will identify, develop and manage carbon estimation models working with partners to deploy the models at scale across the portfolio and regions. This work is central to the NBS strategy to be a leading innovator and build a diversified portfolio of agriculture projects. Pathways is one of the five core capabilities that are being developed within the NBS Development Team (alongside Technical, Geomatics, Innovation and HSSE) as key contributors to enable and support the NBS business growth.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><br> The role is an opportunity to join NBS at the shaping stage, not just in Shell but also in the broader societal and corporate space.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><br> More specific responsibilities include:<\u002Fp>\n  <ul>\n   <li> Be responsible for the detailed quantification of carbon opportunities associated with carbon projects in agriculture, including the development of baseline and project scenarios by linking agricultural activities with carbon removal or emission reduction estimates<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Develop and maintain project-specific carbon estimation models for both emission reductions of methane and N2O as well as carbon removal through soil carbon sequestration<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Co-develop, assess, and use different soil carbon models, biogeochemical models, and other statistical models to improve the quality, implementation and value of the models<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Design and maintain data management plans for monitoring of carbon projects in agriculture<br> Manage data system including for measurement, reporting and verification purposes, for carbon projects in agriculture<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Integrate and streamline developed data systems with other existing data management systems in NBS, working with Digital and Innovation teams as required<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Support and raise understanding across internal and external stakeholders in data requirements and management required for successful carbon projects and programs<\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n  <p><b><br> What we need from you?<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> We’re keen to hear from individuals with professional experience working in agriculture and rural areas with emphasis on monitoring and evaluation activities and processes. You’ll also call on your Bachelor’s\u002FMaster’s degree in Soil Science, Agronomy, Agricultural Economics, Statistics, Physics, or similar field.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> We also hope you possess the following skills and experience:<\u002Fp>\n  <ul>\n   <li> Additional studies in Measurement Reporting and Verification or Monitoring &amp; Evaluation, research design or data management, modelling is an advantage<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Knowledge of carbon certification standards, regulatory accounting, auditing requirements, and practical implications and opportunities<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Knowledge of carbon calculators in agriculture (eg. Cool Farm Tool) and other accounting tools<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Strong skills in using data processing or statistical software such as Excel, R, STATA, or others<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Strong quantitative and qualitative data analysis skills<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Strong data management skills, including maintenance of databases<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Experience in Nature Based Solutions in the context of the supply of carbon credits<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Strong relationship skills and ability to gain trust and credibility quickly with wide range of internal and external stakeholders<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Strong project management skills, with ability to work through complexity and uncertainty<\u002Fli>\n   <li> A hunger for success, with hands-on experience in developing business strategies to develop and grow new opportunities for Shell<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Ability to work with key Shell business colleagues and become an integral part of virtual teams by adding value and bringing solutions<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Excellent communication and presentation skills<\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> COMPANY DECRIPTION<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> Shell started operations in the United Kingdom more than 110 years ago. Since then, we have grown into a leading innovative Oil &amp; Energy company that rewards its employees by investing heavily in their careers and learning. Our people are our greatest asset, and our commitment to your career will see you thrive in a work environment that offers an industry-leading development programme. When your ideas travel, Shell will benefit, and innovation will thrive. Shell has a key role to play in helping meet the UK’s growing energy demand, whilst using innovative technologies to develop cleaner energy. We are the largest FTSE 100 company in the UK by market capitalisation and make a significant contribution to the UK economy. As well as processing 35% of the gas coming into the UK, we serve more than four million customers at our filling stations each week. Shell employs some 6,400 skilled staff as well as many contractors.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> An innovative place to work <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p>There’s never been a more exciting time to work at Shell.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> Join us and you’ll be adding your talent and imagination to a business with the ambition to shape the future – whether by investing in oil, gas and renewable energy to meet demand, exploring new ways to store energy, or developing technology that helps the world to use energy more efficiently, everyone at Shell does their part.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> An inclusive place to work <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p>To power progress, we need to attract and develop the brightest minds and make sure every voice is heard. Here are just some of the ways we are nurturing an inclusive environment – one where you can express your ideas, extend your skills, and reach your potential.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <ul>\n   <li> We’re creating a space where people with disabilities can excel through transparent recruitment process, workplace adjustments and ongoing support in their roles. Feel free to let us know about your circumstances when you apply, and we’ll take it from there.<\u002Fli>\n   <li> We’re closing the gender gap – whether that’s through action on equal pay or by enabling more women to reach senior roles in engineering and technology.<\u002Fli>\n   <li> We’re striving to be a pioneer of an inclusive and diverse workplace, promoting equality for employees regardless of sexual orientation or gender identity.<\u002Fli>\n   <li> We consider ourselves a flexible employer and want to support you finding the right balance. We encourage you to discuss this with us in your application.<\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> A rewarding place to work <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p>Combine our creative, collaborative environment and global operations with an impressive range of benefits and joining Shell becomes an inspired career choice.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> We’re huge advocates for career development. We’ll encourage you to try new roles and experience new settings. By pushing people to reach their potential, we frequently help them find skills they never knew they had, or make career moves they never thought possible.<\u002Fp>\n  <br> \n <\u002Fdiv>\n <p><\u002Fp> \n <div>\n  <h3 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><p>Disclaimer <\u002Fp><\u002Fh3>\n  <div>\n   <div>\n    Please note: We occasionally amend or withdraw Shell jobs and reserve the right to do so at any time, including prior to the advertised closing date. Before applying, you are advised to read our data protection policy. This policy describes the processing that may be associated with your personal data and informs you that your personal data may be transferred to Shell\u002FShell Group companies around the world. The Shell Group and its approved recruitment consultants will never ask you for a fee to process or consider your application for a career with Shell. Anyone who demands such a fee is not an authorised Shell representative and you are strongly advised to refuse any such demand. Shell is an Equal Opportunity Employer.\n   <\u002Fdiv>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b>The Role<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2> \n <div>\n  <div>\n   <p>If you are interested in the very heart of our business – Counterparties – and have a passion to deliver effective, top tier first line of defence (LOD1), this could be your chance to make a difference in Shell Trading &amp; Supply.<\u002Fp>\n   <p><\u002Fp>\n   <p> Enhancing the Shell Counterparty (CP) experience whilst upholding our ethical and regulatory standards is at the heart of this role.<\u002Fp>\n   <p><\u002Fp>\n   <p> Reporting into the Counterparty Lifecycle Management (CLCM) Enablement and Integration Manager, you will have responsibility managing the portfolio of CLCM change projects supporting and enhancing our services to customers.<\u002Fp>\n   <p><\u002Fp>\n   <p> You will work closely with stakeholders from across the Lines of Business, Compliance and CLCM to evaluate and prioritize core improvement opportunities in the E2E CLCM cycle and continually improve our process and services to deliver a better customer experience.<\u002Fp>\n   <p><\u002Fp>\n   <p><b> Where you fit in<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n   <p><\u002Fp>\n   <p> Shell Trading and Supply (T&amp;S) is one of the largest energy trading operations in the world. With over 7000 employees operating across the globe to support our world class integrated trading and supply value chain, we support the Shell group through trading environmental products, biofuels, power, LNG, chemical feedstocks, crude oil, refined products and freights in trading hubs all over the world with the main trading and marketing locations in Houston, London, Dubai, Rotterdam and Singapore.<\u002Fp>\n   <p><\u002Fp>\n   <p> The Commercial Operations organization within T&amp;S operates in 9 trading hubs, 4 key SBO locations, with over 1360 people supporting 35 countries. It is designed to improve T&amp;S cross business execution including both ‘run the business capabilities’ e.g. trading operations support and ‘change the business capabilities’. This is achieved through enhanced business transformation activities such as a joint data and digital team, project delivery team and Centre of Excellence.<\u002Fp>\n   <p><\u002Fp>\n   <p> The Customer Insights and Integration team is focused on ensuring a lens of the customer across all touchpoints of the Life of a Deal. CLCM is the onboard touchpoint and is focused on creating the tools and standards to support a positive experience across the CLCM chain (onboarding, rereviews, updates and exits) whilst supporting the adherence to Compliance requirements.<\u002Fp>\n   <p><\u002Fp>\n   <p> You will be part of our CLCM Enablement and Integration, a team of professionals who are passionate about enhancing our ability to trade with counterparties whilst maintaining our compliance and ethical standards.<\u002Fp>\n   <p><\u002Fp>\n   <p><b> What’s the role?<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n   <p><\u002Fp>\n   <p> As the CLCM Continuous Improvement (CI) Senior Specialist you will be responsible for delivering CI initiatives across the CLCM landscape, including onboarding, maintenance and exit of our Counterparties. You will work closely with internal and external stakeholders across Shell T&amp;S at all levels of the organization, including but not limited to; CLCM Process Authority, Lines of Business Representatives, Compliance, FO Data &amp; Credit, to identify and implement process and performance improvements. You will manage and prioritise the pipeline of activity and report progress of projects to the T&amp;S Leadership Team, taking ownership for the delivery and successful outcome of CLCM led initiatives.<\u002Fp>\n   <p><\u002Fp>\n   <p> You will be responsible for shaping, delivering and managing your own improvement projects, as well as, managing the progress of individual initiatives led by project team members or delegates from other parts of the organisation (e.g., LOBs, Compliance, FO Data).<\u002Fp>\n   <p><\u002Fp>\n   <p> You will apply your knowledge of operational excellence and experience in managing change portfolios to support the continued growth and performance of CLCM.<\u002Fp>\n   <p><\u002Fp>\n   <p> More specifically, your role will include:<\u002Fp>\n   <ul>\n    <li><p> Working with stakeholders from across the Lines of Business and Compliance to identify, scope and prioritise opportunities for improvement in CLCM processes<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n    <li><p> Managing the portfolio of change projects owned and supported by CLCM<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n    <li><p> Providing guidance and support to delegates delivering projects within the CLCM portfolio<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n    <li><p> Delivering complex projects and initiatives from within the CLCM portfolio of work<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n    <li><p> Performing detailed Impact Assessment of Change Requests to determine detailed scope, budget and resource requirements to deliver CLCM change projects<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n    <li><p> Report on the progress of CLCM portfolio and status of projects to the T&amp;S Leadership<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n    <li><p> Providing direction and best practice on how to manage and deliver operational excellence &amp; process improvement projects, in line with Shell’s methodologies<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n    <li><p> Managing and delivering periodic CI learning events to influence and develop a CI culture mindset across the CLCM community<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <\u002Ful>\n   <p><\u002Fp>\n   <p><b> What we need from you<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n   <p><\u002Fp>\n   <p> You will have experience managing a portfolio of projects across a complex organisation with insight on industry best practice. Combined with this you will also have experience influencing teams without direct authority and working with them in facilitating recommended changes.<\u002Fp>\n   <p><\u002Fp>\n   <p> To enable you in this role, not only will you require excellent leadership and communication skills but strong analytical and problem-solving skills, coupled with the ability to socialize and “sell” the solutions you propose to senior stakeholders in the business. You will be able to inspire project delivery partners to work towards practical goals that have a real impact on our counterparties’ experience of doing business with Shell.<\u002Fp>\n   <p><\u002Fp>\n   <p> As part of the broader CLCM team, you will also have a responsibility to help drive and deliver our vision, working autonomously and as a team to deliver on our portfolio of change activity.<\u002Fp>\n   <p><\u002Fp>\n   <p> Furthermore, you will have:<\u002Fp>\n   <ul>\n    <li><p> Relevant years working in a change environment with a focus on Continuous improvement.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n    <li><p> Strong change management experience, ensuring that changes are embedded into the organization and sustained<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n    <li><p> Experience setting up continuous improvement agendas and governance, delivering successful portfolios of work<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n    <li><p> Experience in delivering business \u002F process improvement projects (e.g., Lean, Six Sigma) with Blackbelt certification desirable.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n    <li><p> Previous experience working in Financial Crime or KYC standards preferred<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n    <li><p> Experience delivering change across the delivery lifecycle, from inception through to closure<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n    <li><p> Confidence coaching and upskilling others, for example in continuous improvement tools and techniques<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n    <li><p> Stakeholder engagement skills to manage relationships across different businesses and functions.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n    <li><p> Strong organization and people management skills; comfortable managing and influencing a team without direct authority, covering multiple projects or workstreams simultaneously<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n    <li><p> Ability to take ownership and deliver results in a complex and fast-paced environment<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n    <li><p> Excellent written and verbal communication and presentation skills, with the ability to condense large amounts of information into concise messaging<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n    <li><p> Skilled in using PowerPoint and Excel to present and structure information<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n    <li><p> Exhibit resilience at work. Be able to meet tight deadlines often under pressure.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n    <li><p> Self-starter who can work independently demonstrating personal drive and taking own initiative.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n    <li><p> Demonstrated ability to collaborate and work effectively in a team.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <\u002Ful>\n   <p><\u002Fp>\n   <p><b> Company Description<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n   <p> Shell started operations in the United Kingdom more than 110 years ago. Since then, we have grown into a leading innovative Oil &amp; Energy company that rewards its employees by investing heavily in their careers and learning. Our people are our greatest asset, and our commitment to your career will see you thrive in a work environment that offers an industry-leading development programme. When your ideas travel, Shell will benefit, and innovation will thrive. Shell has a key role to play in helping meet the UK’s growing energy demand, whilst using innovative technologies to develop cleaner energy. We are the largest FTSE 100 company in the UK by market capitalisation and make a significant contribution to the UK economy. As well as processing 35% of the gas coming into the UK, we serve more than four million customers at our filling stations each week. Shell employs some 6,400 skilled staff as well as many contractors.<\u002Fp>\n   <p><\u002Fp>\n   <p><b> An innovative place to work <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n   <p>There’s never been a more exciting time to work at Shell.<\u002Fp>\n   <p><\u002Fp>\n   <p> Join us and you’ll be adding your talent and imagination to a business with the ambition to shape the future – whether by investing in oil, gas and renewable energy to meet demand, exploring new ways to store energy, or developing technology that helps the world to use energy more efficiently, everyone at Shell does their part.<\u002Fp>\n   <p><\u002Fp>\n   <p><b> An inclusive place to work <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n   <p>To power progress, we need to attract and develop the brightest minds and make sure every voice is heard. Here are just some of the ways we are nurturing an inclusive environment – one where you can express your ideas, extend your skills, and reach your potential.<\u002Fp>\n   <ul>\n    <li><p> We’re creating a space where people with disabilities can excel through transparent recruitment process, workplace adjustments and ongoing support in their roles. Feel free to let us know about your circumstances when you apply, and we’ll take it from there.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n    <li><p> We’re closing the gender gap – whether that’s through action on equal pay or by enabling more women to reach senior roles in engineering and technology.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n    <li><p> We’re striving to be a pioneer of an inclusive and diverse workplace, promoting equality for employees regardless of sexual orientation or gender identity.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n    <li><p> We consider ourselves a flexible employer and want to support you finding the right balance. We encourage you to discuss this with us in your application.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <\u002Ful>\n   <p><\u002Fp>\n   <p><b> A rewarding place to work <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n   <p>Combine our creative, collaborative environment and global operations with an impressive range of benefits and joining Shell becomes an inspired career choice.<\u002Fp>\n   <p><\u002Fp>\n   <p> We’re huge advocates for career development. We’ll encourage you to try new roles and experience new settings. By pushing people to reach their potential, we frequently help them find skills they never knew they had, or make career moves they never thought possible.<\u002Fp>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <br> \n <\u002Fdiv>\n <p><\u002Fp> \n <div>\n  <h3 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><p>Disclaimer <\u002Fp><\u002Fh3>\n  <div>\n   <div>\n    Please note: We occasionally amend or withdraw Shell jobs and reserve the right to do so at any time, including prior to the advertised closing date. The Shell Group and its approved recruitment consultants will never ask you for a fee to process or consider your application for a career with Shell. Anyone who demands such a fee is not an authorised Shell representative and you are strongly advised to refuse any such demand. Shell is an Equal Opportunity Employer.\n   <\u002Fdiv>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b>The Role<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2> \n <p><\u002Fp>\n <div>\n  <p><b>Where you fit in?<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p> Shell Trading and Supply (T&amp;S) has an integrated global portfolio of crude oil, refined products, natural gas, LNG, electrical power, chemical feedstocks and environmental products. Based in the UK, US, Canada, Singapore, The Netherlands, Japan, Bahamas, Brazil, Dubai and Russia, and with over 7000 employees, Shell Trading and Supply (Shell T&amp;S) trades on average over 12 million barrels of crude and oil products and 5 million\u002Fboe in natural gas and power each day. Shell T&amp;S has also recently established a Low Carbon Fuels (LCF) business (as part of T&amp;S Products) which intends to optimize globally low carbonfuels (such as bionaphta, ethanol, biodiesel) and developing new opportunities in feedstock supply, sustainable aviation fuel as well as routes to market for biomethane. The LCF business will also act as key enabler for the success of other Shell businesses working in this area.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> What’s the role? <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p>Professional, timely, cost-effective and commercial legal advice and support to the T&amp;S crude and oil products trading and shipping businesses in Singapore and Dubai and together with other team members, to work closely with the Lead Counsel\u002FGlobal Focal and Asia Focal to provide regional legal support for the new and growing T&amp;S Low Carbon Fuels business, which will include supporting the strategic long-term sourcing of biofuel feedstock, together with increasing Trading Commodity Finance activity, working across jurisdictions where nascent legal frameworks and regulatory regimes are complex, ambiguous and frequently changing.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> The role also involves working with the LCF regulatory advice team and advising on risk appetite (commercial and regulatory) from a regional perspective.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> Successful candidate will be accountable for the following:<\u002Fp>\n  <ul>\n   <li> Work within a team to provide legal support for the T&amp;S crude and products businesses in Singapore and Dubai on commercial, operational and project matters.<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Work with the global network of legal support for T&amp;S LCF, leveraging lawyers across T&amp;S and Downstream and externally, to integrate and resolve legal and\u002For regulatory issues across multiple jurisdictions.<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Proactively identify legal risks and propose alternative strategies to manage novel commercial structures and business development, generally in the crude and products trading business and in the Low Carbon Fuels space; and<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Provide support for the T&amp;S LCF Regulatory Advice team in an uncertain global regulatory environment to mitigate potentially material reputational and\u002For financial impact.<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Ability to quickly identify potential regulatory exposure in business proposals and work with business \u002F Regulatory advice team to devise strategies for managing that exposure.<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Work independently on most matters with support from line manager and experienced colleagues in the team.<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Ensure documents reflect accurately commercial decisions, at all times consistent with regulatory \u002F legal obligations and the Shell Control Framework.<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Strong interpersonal skills and able to develop and maintain relations with internal and external stakeholders are important.<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Represent Shell vis-à-vis third parties and to senior leadership in the Shell T&amp;S organization<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Ability to work as part of a team and with both internal and external stakeholders with diverse cultural backgrounds in a dynamic and fast-moving environment.<\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> Special Challenges<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <ul>\n   <li> Fast paced, diversified and very fast-growing business will require that this individual be flexible, think laterally, be willing to learn, and be willing to take on new challenges.<\u002Fli>\n   <li> The ability to handle a range of time sensitive client demands, mixing strategic project work and day to day transactions and queries, in a fast-paced and dynamic trading environment and the ability to work under pressure is critical as operational and commercial issues demand.<\u002Fli>\n   <li> The role will require the ability to connect across a range of cultures and the ability to operate in uncertain jurisdictions and on high-risk transactions, including exposure to a growing portfolio of structured commodity finance and divestment linked transactions, together with LCF and Crude\u002FOP business development.<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Supporting the Group Compliance program in difficult environments and under challenging conditions.<\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> What we need from you?<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> While a Law degree and professional legal qualification in a common law jurisdiction is essential, we are also keen to hear from candidates with the following experience:<\u002Fp>\n  <ul>\n   <li> At least 12 years of post-qualification experience<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Experience working within a physical commodity trading environment, preferably with exposure to crude or refined products trading, would be well regarded. In addition, given the integrated nature of the nascent LCF business and project pipeline, those with New Business Development\u002FM&amp;A and project development would also be well suited.<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Understanding of the main legal areas relevant to international commodities trading and regulatory regimes. An understanding of the regulations applicable to the LCF business and an understanding of the impact and implications of the regulations applicable to the T&amp;S business in Asia would be particularly helpful.<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Understanding of some of the main legal areas relevant to integrated project development and value chains, structured finance, credit security and insolvency and exchange trading of commodities.<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Ability to draft and negotiate with appropriate understanding of the regulatory background and commercial intentions.<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Strong influencing, negotiating and facilitation skills, including the ability to lead negotiations in transactions with multiple parties.<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Experienced in international common law and\u002For civil law contracts.<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Ability to work on multiple issues in parallel with an ability to prioritize.<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Ability to develop and sustain relationships with clients at all levels and in a range of cultures.<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Ability to understand and take account of business drivers and needs and balance with wider constraints.<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Able to quickly identify and give clear exposition of a legal issue and to provide succinct, practical and accurate legal advice.<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Attention to detail, proactive, pragmatic, autonomous and hands on;<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Excellent command of English language, both spoken and written\u002Fdrafting skills.<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Ability to address issues creatively and sensitively and to build strong relationships across a range of organizations and internal stakeholders.<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Strong academic background and capable of applying jurisprudence in real situations.<\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> Shell is one the largest foreign investors in Singapore and began operations in 1891. Today, we have more than 3,200 employees in Singapore alone. The Pulau Bukom Manufacturing Site today is the largest Shell refinery in the world in terms of crude distillation capacity, which makes Singapore a key regional supply and trading centre for Shell in the East. Singapore is the largest petrochemical production and export centre in the Asia Pacific region. Shell Jurong Island (SJI) manufactures petrochemicals to meet the fast-growing demand for these products in the region. We also have one of the largest single-branded retail networks in Singapore, providing customers with a wide range of quality products and services. When you join Shell in Singapore, you can count on our commitment to help you thrive and propel your career by means of our industry-leading development programme and our available and unrivalled pool of local and global experts. Our numerous global and local skill pools as well as our diversity are key to our success and continuing innovation.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><b><br> An innovative place to work <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p>There’s never been a more exciting time to work at Shell. Everyone here is helping solve one of the biggest challenges facing the world today: bringing the benefits of energy to everyone on the planet, whilst managing the risks of climate change.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> Join us and you’ll be adding your talent and imagination to a business with the ambition to shape the future – whether by investing in renewables, exploring new ways to store energy, or developing technology that helps the world to use energy more efficiently, everyone at Shell does their part.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> An inclusive place to work <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p>To power progress together, we need to attract and develop the brightest minds and make sure every voice is heard. Here are just some of the ways we are nurturing an inclusive environment – one where you can express your ideas, extend your skills, and reach your potential…<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <ul>\n   <li> We’re creating a space where people with disabilities can excel through transparent recruitment process, workplace adjustments and ongoing support in their roles. Feel free to let us know about your circumstances when you apply, and we’ll take it from there.<\u002Fli>\n   <li> We’re closing the gender gap – whether that’s through action on equal pay or by enabling more women to reach senior roles in engineering and technology.<\u002Fli>\n   <li> We’re striving to be a pioneer of an inclusive and diverse workplace, promoting equality for employees regardless of sexual orientation or gender identity.<\u002Fli>\n   <li> We consider ourselves a flexible employer and want to support you finding the right balance. We encourage you to discuss this with us in your application.<\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> A rewarding place to work <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p>Combine our creative, collaborative environment and global operations with an impressive range of benefits and joining Shell becomes an inspired career choice.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> We’re huge advocates for career development. We’ll encourage you to try new roles and experience new settings. By pushing people to reach their potential, we frequently help them find skills they never knew they had, or make career moves they never thought possible.<\u002Fp>\n  <br> \n <\u002Fdiv>\n <p><\u002Fp> \n <div>\n  <h3 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><p>Disclaimer <\u002Fp><\u002Fh3>\n  <div>\n   <div>\n    Please note: We occasionally amend or withdraw Shell jobs and reserve the right to do so at any time, including prior to the advertised closing date. Before applying, you are advised to read our data protection policy. This policy describes the processing that may be associated with your personal data and informs you that your personal data may be transferred to Shell\u002FShell Group companies around the world. The Shell Group and its approved recruitment consultants will never ask you for a fee to process or consider your application for a career with Shell. Anyone who demands such a fee is not an authorised Shell representative and you are strongly advised to refuse any such demand. Shell is an Equal Opportunity Employer.\n   <\u002Fdiv>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b>The Role<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2> \n <div>\n  <p><b>Where you fit in<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p> The IT Site Operations Engineer is to support all IT Operations on their site(s). They deliver a consistent business focused approach through site IT Operations to unlock business value and respond to change with agility and speed. The role benefits from standardized ways of working while recognizing and supporting functional differences. The IT Site Operations Engineer must build and manage trust-based relations with site business user community and business IT representatives and is responsible for the site integrity and services. <\u002Fp>\n  <p>The chosen candidate will work in close collaboration with the IT Site Operations Lead, who is end-to-end accountable for the IT infrastructure operations of site(s), including the delivery of day-to-day site level infrastructure services to the agreed SLAs.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> What’s the role? <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p>Accountabilities:<\u002Fp>\n  <ul>\n   <li><p> Supporting the IT project team for various project activities and ensures most effective way of delivery(including improving outcomes and reducing costs).<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Ensures HSSE rules are respected by internal and external IT teams and partners on site(s) (Goal Zero) Ensuring contractors are meeting all HSSE requirements and storing related evidence.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Responsible for site Information Risk Management (IRM) compliance and actively driving remediation of local vulnerabilities and non-compliance.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Escalating site IT problems and business impact to Site Operations Lead (SOL) and\u002For IT Partners.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Promoting Continuous Improvement culture within own scope of accountability, (i.e. Service Improvements, Ways of Working, Cost reduction, Capacity Management).<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Supporting any facilitation activities from IT perspective including mass on-boarding, Transfer and Off-boarding.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Digitalization support, BIG Bets (for example real time decisions, autonomous operation, fully digitized workflow etc.), Emerging Tech, bucket 3 site-driven demand, Lightly Managed Apps (LMA) to IT support.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Shell Energy Transition and Shell Digitalization transformation.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> End User Productivity\u002FEnd User Experience and associate IT services, IT Centre, end user tool knowledge and education (Asset upskilling).<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Ensures that successful landscape service performance partnership needs to be built with the IDT Managers, IT Operations Engineers for BC and non-BC applications and the Business Vertical &amp; Common Services Delivery Managers.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Strong ownership that ensures proactive and further active involvement in all projects that have IT infrastructure\u002Foperations element.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Strong dotted line to local natural team (e.g. Real Estate\u002FHSSE\u002FAsset Protection) supporting all aspects of site(s) operations.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Business proximate role.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> What we need from you<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <ul>\n   <li><p> Bachelor’s degree preferably in the Engineering, IT or related field.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Minimum of 7 years relevant work experience in a complex organization or equivalent.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Strong Stakeholder Management, IT Service Management, Application and Infrastructure Management skills and experience.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Excellent grounding in IT Infrastructure solutions and operations (particularly in the network space).<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Strong communication and analytical skills.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Skilled in systematically troubleshooting complex issues to a root cause and reporting out to stakeholders in business language.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Skilled in investigating and fixing complex issues across organizational boundaries, including vendors.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Emotional intelligence (i.e., patience, listening, self-reflective, thoughtful, ability to build trusting relationships, reasoning, and understanding), strong relationship and influencing skills with people at all levels in the organization and in diverse cultures.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Ability to work with other disciplines in a global environment, and to bridge technical, commercial and IT skills.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Working knowledge of ITIL Foundations (ITIL Certification advantageous).<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Ability to work effectively under pressure.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Experience in the Oil &amp; Gas, Refinery and Chemical industries are very advantageous.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Fluent in English, spoken and written.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> Company Description<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p> Shell is one the largest foreign investors in Singapore and began operations in 1891. Today, we have more than 3,200 employees in Singapore alone. The Pulau Bukom Manufacturing Site today is the largest Shell refinery in the world in terms of crude distillation capacity, which makes Singapore a key regional supply and trading centre for Shell in the East. Singapore is the largest petrochemical production and export centre in the Asia Pacific region. Shell Jurong Island (SJI) manufactures petrochemicals to meet the fast-growing demand for these products in the region. We also have one of the largest single-branded retail networks in Singapore, providing customers with a wide range of quality products and services. When you join Shell in Singapore, you can count on our commitment to help you thrive and propel your career by means of our industry-leading development programme and our available and unrivalled pool of local and global experts. Our numerous global and local skill pools as well as our diversity are key to our success and continuing innovation.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> An innovative place to work <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p>There’s never been a more exciting time to work at Shell.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> Join us and you’ll be adding your talent and imagination to a business with the ambition to shape the future – whether by investing in oil, gas, and renewable energy to meet demand, exploring new ways to store energy, or developing technology that helps the world to use energy more efficiently, everyone at Shell does their part.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> An inclusive place to work <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p>To power progress, we need to attract and develop the brightest minds and make sure every voice is heard. Feel free to let us know about your circumstances when you apply, and we’ll take it from there.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> We’re closing the gender gap – whether that’s through action on equal pay or by enabling more women to reach senior roles in engineering and technology.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> We’re striving to be a pioneer of an inclusive and diverse workplace, promoting equality for employees regardless of sexual orientation or gender identity.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> We consider ourselves a flexible employer and want to support you finding the right balance. We encourage you to discuss this with us in your application.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> A rewarding place to work <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p>Combine our creative, collaborative environment and global operations with an impressive range of benefits and joining Shell becomes an inspired career choice.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> We’re huge advocates for career development. <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b>The Role<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2> \n <div>\n  <p><b>Where you fit in?<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p> The purpose of this role is to manage risk identification: model &amp; portfolio assumptions and market inputs, pricing issues, and drive understanding of the design and utilization of Value at Risk, Stress Testing, and Scenario Analysis for the Oil Trading business in Singapore. This role will also identify, develop, and implement system efficiencies and reporting capabilities for the risk books, partnering with other team members to align best practices across the Global Oil Trading business in Shell.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> This role will report into the Risk Manager East Oil and support other Crude &amp; Products businesses outside Singapore, where applicable.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> What’s the role? <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p>The Senior Oil Market Risk Analyst is responsible for ensuring that day to day risk management activities surrounding the Trading &amp; Supply (T&amp;S) Oil (with main focus on Refined Products) organization is executed in a controlled and professional manner including:<\u002Fp>\n  <ul>\n   <li> Ensuring all trading activities remain within mandated exposure and risk limits.<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Ensuring all exposures are properly recorded using established fair value methodologies.<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Ensuring a daily commentary is produced analyzing daily\u002Fmonthly P&amp;L performance.<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Ensure independent assessments of risk\u002Freturn for the business is inline with the risk appetite of the business<\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> The role is expected to have Market Risk oversight over the T&amp;S Crude\u002FProducts businesses, specifically in ensuring there is appropriate control and understanding on the identification, valuation and exposure reporting for the various Trading desks, and where required, provide event-specific additional monitoring (e.g. IMO 2020), or act as a Focal point for a major Market Risk initiative (e.g. Quant Portal focal point). You'll be working closely with the larger Risk Organization to ensure trading risks and returns are fully understood, captured and challenged where necessary. This will also include longer term risks, inherent in contracts such as, but not limited to, storage, pipelines, time-charters.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> This role will also work closely with risk leads from all parts of the risk management spectrum including a significant Shell Business Operations component. The incumbent is tasked with ensuring that the T&amp;S Crude\u002FProducts business is widely understood and that any changes to it or the supporting risk management framework are communicated properly to all stakeholders.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> What we need from you?<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> We are keen to hear from candidates with the following qualifications\u002Fexperience:<\u002Fp>\n  <ul>\n   <li> Master’s\u002FBachelor’s degree in Business\u002F Economics\u002F Mathematics\u002F Accounting\u002F Engineering or IT<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Understanding of trading, operations, risk and mid\u002Fback-office business processes, policies, procedures and controls an advantage<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Awareness of trading influences, deal structures and types, interpreting positions, P&amp;L, mark to market, trading reporting regulations, financial and management reporting, position reporting, and financial analysis<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Continuous improvement mindset, utilizing tools to streamline and automate tasks<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Experience in energy trading risk management systems will be an advantage.<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Capable of maintaining independence and objectivity in their analysis of the trading business<\u002Fli>\n   <li> This is a role for a person who brings diversity of thought, who is not afraid to speak up and who is comfortable challenging senior stakeholders and carry out an advisory role<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Strong business analysis and problem-solving skills, modelling capabilities, research and technologically oriented, innovative &amp; creative<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Self-starter, highly motivated, result oriented, manages own work with limited supervision<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Team player with good interpersonal skills, flexible to work across numerous time zones with both Market Risk teams across various locations and the Shell Business Operations Centre in India.<\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> About Shell Singapore<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p> Shell is one the largest foreign investors in Singapore and began operations in 1891. Today, we have more than 3,200 employees in Singapore alone. The Pulau Bukom Manufacturing Site today is the largest Shell refinery in the world in terms of crude distillation capacity, which makes Singapore a key regional supply and trading centre for Shell in the East. Singapore is the largest petrochemical production and export centre in the Asia Pacific region. Shell Jurong Island (SJI) manufactures petrochemicals to meet the fast-growing demand for these products in the region. We also have one of the largest single-branded retail networks in Singapore, providing customers with a wide range of quality products and services. When you join Shell in Singapore, you can count on our commitment to help you thrive and propel your career by means of our industry-leading development programme and our available and unrivalled pool of local and global experts. Our numerous global and local skill pools as well as our diversity are key to our success and continuing innovation.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><b><br> An innovative place to work <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p>There’s never been a more exciting time to work at Shell. Everyone here is helping solve one of the biggest challenges facing the world today: bringing the benefits of energy to everyone on the planet, whilst managing the risks of climate change.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> Join us and you’ll be adding your talent and imagination to a business with the ambition to shape the future – whether by investing in renewables, exploring new ways to store energy, or developing technology that helps the world to use energy more efficiently, everyone at Shell does their part.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> An inclusive place to work <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p>To power progress together, we need to attract and develop the brightest minds and make sure every voice is heard. Here are just some of the ways we are nurturing an inclusive environment – one where you can express your ideas, extend your skills, and reach your potential…<\u002Fp>\n  <ul>\n   <li> We’re creating a space where people with disabilities can excel through transparent recruitment process, workplace adjustments and ongoing support in their roles. Feel free to let us know about your circumstances when you apply, and we’ll take it from there.<\u002Fli>\n   <li> We’re closing the gender gap – whether that’s through action on equal pay or by enabling more women to reach senior roles in engineering and technology.<\u002Fli>\n   <li> We’re striving to be a pioneer of an inclusive and diverse workplace, promoting equality for employees regardless of sexual orientation or gender identity.<\u002Fli>\n   <li> We consider ourselves a flexible employer and want to support you finding the right balance. We encourage you to discuss this with us in your application.<\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> A rewarding place to work <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p>Combine our creative, collaborative environment and global operations with an impressive range of benefits and joining Shell becomes an inspired career choice.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> We’re huge advocates for career development. We’ll encourage you to try new roles and experience new settings. By pushing people to reach their potential, we frequently help them find skills they never knew they had, or make career moves they never thought possible.<\u002Fp>\n  <br> \n <\u002Fdiv>\n <p><\u002Fp> \n <div>\n  <h3 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><p>Disclaimer <\u002Fp><\u002Fh3>\n  <div>\n   <div>\n    Please note: We occasionally amend or withdraw Shell jobs and reserve the right to do so at any time, including prior to the advertised closing date. Before applying, you are advised to read our data protection policy. This policy describes the processing that may be associated with your personal data and informs you that your personal data may be transferred to Shell\u002FShell Group companies around the world. The Shell Group and its approved recruitment consultants will never ask you for a fee to process or consider your application for a career with Shell. Anyone who demands such a fee is not an authorised Shell representative and you are strongly advised to refuse any such demand. Shell is an Equal Opportunity Employer.\n   <\u002Fdiv>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b>The Role<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2> \n <div>\n  <p><b>Where you fit in?<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p> To provide real time, proactive, legal advice on all regulatory matters related to Shell’s Singapore and Asia Pacific Trading and Supply organisation. The candidate will work hand in hand with and alongside the Trading &amp; Supply (T&amp;S) Compliance organisation and provide legal advice and support on all regulatory matters as are relevant to the business in the region for crude, products, gas power, and environmental products.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> What’s the role? <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p>The following accountabilities cover the whole Asia Pacific region, except where stated:<\u002Fp>\n  <ul>\n   <li> Pro-actively scan the horizon and develop the team’s practice, expertise and know-how to provide advice as an APAC regional focal point on key up-and -coming Environmental, Social and Governance (ESG) areas including regulation of voluntary carbon credits, human rights, biofuels and other low carbon fuels, taxonomies, disclosure standards and their impact on the T&amp;S business<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Provide advice on how financial regulations in Singapore impact the T&amp;S business and work closely with the Regulatory team in T&amp;S Compliance and the Business to ensure business compliance.<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Provide input and advice to T&amp;S Business lawyers and Compliance colleagues on commonly encountered regulatory issues, including best practices or on risks and mitigants as part of review process for relevant new business proposals across all business lines in region<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Maintain\u002Frefresh or prepare Regulatory Deep Dives for key T&amp;S jurisdictions so that there is a clear overall picture of the regulatory risks faced by the T&amp;S business in those jurisdictions<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Act as an integrator to work with relevant SMEs, compliance colleagues and the business focal points to assess the impact of new or expanded regulations (e.g., data protection) and to take the right steps to ensure compliance.<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Where external regulatory legal advice is required, work with business lawyers to ensure that the advice commissioned from external counsel addresses the key regulatory risks and provides fit for purpose solutions to address such risk and is provided in a cost-effective manner.<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Provide regulatory advice on portfolio transactions which involve the merger with acquisition or divestment of businesses with regulated activities.<\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> Key challenges<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p> The candidate should be comfortable and assured in dealing quickly and accurately with requests for advice on regulatory matters from business clients, front-line trading staff and compliance colleagues in a fast moving and, at times, pressurised business environment. The candidate should be comfortable in advising business colleagues at the highest level.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> Dimensions<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p> Shell Trading &amp; Supply one of the largest energy traders in the world. It is a key business for the Shell Group, closely connected to the Upstream, Downstream and Integrated Gas businesses.<\u002Fp>\n  <p> Shell Trading &amp; Supply comprises a worldwide trading network with a global portfolio in crude oil, refined products, biofuels, environmental products, LNG and natural gas, power and chemicals, together with associated derivatives trading both for hedge and speculative purposes.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> Beyond the Trading network, Shell Trading &amp; Supply provides an extended supply and distribution network delivering oil, gas, power, and refined products. Shell Trading &amp; Supply equally houses one of the largest LNG shipping operators in the world: Shell manages over 40 LNG carriers and 10 oil tankers.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><b><br> What we need from you?<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> We are keen to hear from candidates with the following qualifications and experience:<\u002Fp>\n  <ul>\n   <li> Law degree and professional legal qualification in Singapore or a common law jurisdiction<\u002Fli>\n   <li> With at least 12-15 years PQE<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Excellent command of English language, both spoken and written\u002Fdrafting skills.<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Experienced in regulatory matters and financial regulation as it applies a commodity trading business and willingness to grow knowledge in the physical regulation space, including gas and power and biofuels<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Experience supporting organizational compliance programs in difficult environments and under challenging conditions.<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Ability to quickly identify and give clear exposition of regulatory exposure in business activities and to advise on how to manage those risks.<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Ability to understand and take account of business drivers and needs and balance with wider constraints.<\u002Fli>\n   <li> The ability to work both independently and as a team member is essential. Strong interpersonal skills to develop and maintain relations with internal and external stakeholders across diverse cultural backgrounds.<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Strong influencing, negotiation, business partnering and facilitation skills<\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> Shell is one the largest foreign investors in Singapore and began operations in 1891. Today, we have more than 3,200 employees in Singapore alone. The Pulau Bukom Manufacturing Site today is the largest Shell refinery in the world in terms of crude distillation capacity, which makes Singapore a key regional supply and trading centre for Shell in the East. Singapore is the largest petrochemical production and export centre in the Asia Pacific region. Shell Jurong Island (SJI) manufactures petrochemicals to meet the fast-growing demand for these products in the region. We also have one of the largest single-branded retail networks in Singapore, providing customers with a wide range of quality products and services. When you join Shell in Singapore, you can count on our commitment to help you thrive and propel your career by means of our industry-leading development programme and our available and unrivalled pool of local and global experts. Our numerous global and local skill pools as well as our diversity are key to our success and continuing innovation.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><b><br> An innovative place to work <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p>There’s never been a more exciting time to work at Shell. Everyone here is helping solve one of the biggest challenges facing the world today: bringing the benefits of energy to everyone on the planet, whilst managing the risks of climate change.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> Join us and you’ll be adding your talent and imagination to a business with the ambition to shape the future – whether by investing in renewables, exploring new ways to store energy, or developing technology that helps the world to use energy more efficiently, everyone at Shell does their part.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> An inclusive place to work <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p>To power progress together, we need to attract and develop the brightest minds and make sure every voice is heard. Here are just some of the ways we are nurturing an inclusive environment – one where you can express your ideas, extend your skills, and reach your potential…<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <ul>\n   <li> We’re creating a space where people with disabilities can excel through transparent recruitment process, workplace adjustments and ongoing support in their roles. Feel free to let us know about your circumstances when you apply, and we’ll take it from there.<\u002Fli>\n   <li> We’re closing the gender gap – whether that’s through action on equal pay or by enabling more women to reach senior roles in engineering and technology.<\u002Fli>\n   <li> We’re striving to be a pioneer of an inclusive and diverse workplace, promoting equality for employees regardless of sexual orientation or gender identity.<\u002Fli>\n   <li> We consider ourselves a flexible employer and want to support you finding the right balance. We encourage you to discuss this with us in your application.<\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> A rewarding place to work <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p>Combine our creative, collaborative environment and global operations with an impressive range of benefits and joining Shell becomes an inspired career choice.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> We’re huge advocates for career development. We’ll encourage you to try new roles and experience new settings. By pushing people to reach their potential, we frequently help them find skills they never knew they had, or make career moves they never thought possible.<\u002Fp>\n  <br> \n <\u002Fdiv>\n <p><\u002Fp> \n <div>\n  <h3 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><p>Disclaimer <\u002Fp><\u002Fh3>\n  <div>\n   <div>\n    Please note: We occasionally amend or withdraw Shell jobs and reserve the right to do so at any time, including prior to the advertised closing date. Before applying, you are advised to read our data protection policy. This policy describes the processing that may be associated with your personal data and informs you that your personal data may be transferred to Shell\u002FShell Group companies around the world. The Shell Group and its approved recruitment consultants will never ask you for a fee to process or consider your application for a career with Shell. Anyone who demands such a fee is not an authorised Shell representative and you are strongly advised to refuse any such demand. Shell is an Equal Opportunity Employer.\n   <\u002Fdiv>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b>The Role<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2> \n <div>\n  <p><b>Where you fit in <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p>Electrical Technician resides in Shell Jurong Island (SJI) Maintenance Department.<\u002Fp>\n  <p> The primary role is to execute Electrical maintenance to the optimum level of performance for safe, reliable and efficient operation of the plant.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> Electrical technicians are to provide hands on maintenance, and manage contractors’ staff to provide a safe, cost-effective and efficient day-to-day maintenance services on Electricals.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> What’s the role? <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <ul>\n   <li>Compliance to HSSE standards and requirements to make Shell Jurong Island (SJI) a safe place to work, and accountable for all assigned Critical activities.<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Perform Authorized Applicant\u002FAuthorized Engineer as per SJI Permit to Work (PTW) requirement.<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Drive high standard of personal accountability &amp; performance to deliver the Site &amp; Department goals and target.<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Accountable to perform assigned Critical activities as per Process Safety requirement (HEMP, IPF, etc).<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Execute and supervise day-to-day maintenance activities including contractor\u002Fspecialist management as assigned from end-to-end basis to enable high equipment reliability &amp; plant availability. Update maintenance records, investigation findings &amp; prepare relevant reports<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Provide feedback on effectiveness of planning for the Corrective and preventive maintenance for site reliability improvement. Support in Bad actors management.<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Provide support for Turnaround execution in related Process Units (PUs).<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Use Computerized Maintenance Management System (CMMS) in compliance with the global maintenance and business processes.<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Approve Maintenance expenditures accordance with the library of authority<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Accept or reject the quality of work &amp; goods provided by contractors\u002Fvendors<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Evaluate and feedback contractor performance.<\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful> \n <\u002Fdiv>\n <p><\u002Fp> \n <div>\n  <h3 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><p>Translated Company Description <\u002Fp><\u002Fh3>\n  <div>\n   <div>\n    <p><b>What we need from you<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n    <p><b> Educational Qualifications<\u002Fb>:<\u002Fp>\n    <p> Diploma\u002FITE or equivalent.<\u002Fp>\n    <p><\u002Fp>\n    <p><b> Professional Experience<\u002Fb>:<\u002Fp>\n    <p> 2-4 years relevant experience as Electrical Technician or equivalent work in process plant.<\u002Fp>\n    <p><\u002Fp>\n    <p><b> Company Description<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n    <p> Shell is one the largest foreign investors in Singapore and began operations in 1891. Today, we have more than 3,200 employees in Singapore alone. The Pulau Bukom Manufacturing Site today is the largest Shell refinery in the world in terms of crude distillation capacity, which makes Singapore a key regional supply and trading centre for Shell in the East. Singapore is the largest petrochemical production and export centre in the Asia Pacific region. Shell Jurong Island (SJI) manufactures petrochemicals to meet the fast-growing demand for these products in the region. We also have one of the largest single-branded retail networks in Singapore, providing customers with a wide range of quality products and services. When you join Shell in Singapore, you can count on our commitment to help you thrive and propel your career by means of our industry-leading development programme and our available and unrivalled pool of local and global experts. Our numerous global and local skill pools as well as our diversity are key to our success and continuing innovation.<\u002Fp>\n    <p><\u002Fp>\n    <p><b> An innovative place to work <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n    <p>There’s never been a more exciting time to work at Shell.<\u002Fp>\n    <p><\u002Fp>\n    <p> Join us and you’ll be adding your talent and imagination to a business with the ambition to shape the future – whether by investing in oil, gas, and renewable energy to meet demand, exploring new ways to store energy, or developing technology that helps the world to use energy more efficiently, everyone at Shell does their part.<\u002Fp>\n    <p><\u002Fp>\n    <p><b> An inclusive place to work <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n    <p>To power progress, we need to attract and develop the brightest minds and make sure every voice is heard. Here are just some of the ways we are nurturing an inclusive environment – one where you can express your ideas, extend your skills, and reach your potential.<\u002Fp>\n    <p><\u002Fp>\n    <ul>\n     <li> We’re creating a space where people with disabilities can excel through transparent recruitment process, workplace adjustments and ongoing support in their roles. Feel free to let us know about your circumstances when you apply, and we’ll take it from there.<\u002Fli>\n     <li> We’re closing the gender gap – whether that’s through action on equal pay or by enabling more women to reach senior roles in engineering and technology.<\u002Fli>\n     <li> We’re striving to be a pioneer of an inclusive and diverse workplace, promoting equality for employees regardless of sexual orientation or gender identity.<\u002Fli>\n     <li> We consider ourselves a flexible employer and want to support you finding the right balance. We encourage you to discuss this with us in your application.<\u002Fli>\n    <\u002Ful>\n    <p><\u002Fp>\n    <p><b> A rewarding place to work <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n    <p>Combine our creative, collaborative environment and global operations with an impressive range of benefits and joining Shell becomes an inspired career choice.<\u002Fp>\n    <p><\u002Fp>\n    <p> We’re huge advocates for career development. We’ll encourage you to try new roles and experience new settings. By pushing people to reach their potential, we frequently help them find skills they never knew they had, or make career moves they never thought possible.<\u002Fp>\n   <\u002Fdiv> \n  <\u002Fdiv>\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n  <h3 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><p>Disclaimer <\u002Fp><\u002Fh3>\n  <div>\n   <div>\n    Please note: We occasionally amend or withdraw Shell jobs and reserve the right to do so at any time, including prior to the advertised closing date.
